<article class="blog-archive-post post-23263 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside wordpress-5-4-release">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/wordpress-5-4-release/" title="WordPress 5.4 Release"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/wordpress-5-4-release/" title="WordPress 5.4 Release"><time datetime="2020-04-03T12:00:24-04:00">April 3, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2020/03/adderley/">WordPress 5.4 was released</a> this week, featuring new and better blocks, a cleaner block editor UI, improved user data privacy features, and a handful of under the hood performance and developer improvements. Seven 10uppers helped make this release possible, including myself, who was recognized as a Noteworthy&nbsp;Contributor.</p>
<p>Thank you for helping make WordPress: Ben Greeley, Fabian Kaegy, Felipe Elia, John Watkins, Ryan Welcher, and Tung&nbsp;Du!</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-23128 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings website-mobile-admin-user-experience">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/website-mobile-admin-user-experience/">Evaluating The Website Mobile Admin User Experience, A New Report From&nbsp;10up</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/chriswallace/" title="Posts by Chris Wallace" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Chris-Wallace_avatar_1510758076-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2017/11/Chris-Wallace_avatar_1510758076-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Chris Wallace</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/website-mobile-admin-user-experience/" title="Evaluating The Website Mobile Admin User Experience, A New Report From 10up"><time datetime="2020-03-24T13:25:29-04:00">March 24, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover.png" alt="Mobile Behaviors Special Report" width="1600" height="500" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-23206" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover.png 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-300x94.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-800x250.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-768x240.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-1536x480.png 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-220x69.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/Mobile-Behaviors-Report-Cover-160x50.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Consumers have become accustomed to optimized mobile experiences. Billions use popular apps — WhatsApp, Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, Gmail, and Twitter — to perform small acts of publishing, like sharing content, editing photos, uploading videos, and inserting URLs. These applications deliver carefully constructed user experiences focused on a narrow set of specific content creation tasks. </p>
<p><em>But what does the mobile experience look like for those managing website content?</em></p>
<p>10up conducted a user experience study to understand how consumers are creating, publishing, and managing website content from mobile devices. The study included live user interviews and a survey of 148 qualified participants from 30 countries about their individual experiences using website admin dashboards on smartphones.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/website-mobile-admin-user-experience/#more-23128" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Evaluating The Website Mobile Admin User Experience, A New Report From&nbsp;10up</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-23098 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings classifai-image-tagging-smart-cropping">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/classifai-image-tagging-smart-cropping/">ClassifAI Updates Deliver Automated Image Tagging, Smart Cropping, And Greater Developer Control</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/classifai-image-tagging-smart-cropping/" title="ClassifAI Updates Deliver Automated Image Tagging, Smart Cropping, And Greater Developer Control"><time datetime="2020-03-19T12:00:35-04:00">March 19, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://classifaiplugin.com/">ClassifAI</a> — our plugin that augments WordPress-powered websites with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology — was <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress/">released last year</a>. As a connector to cloud-based services like <a href="https://www.ibm.com/watson">IBM Watson</a> and <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/overview/ai-platform/">Microsoft Azure AI</a>, ClassifAI introduced the automatic tagging and classification of content as well as the assignment of descriptive alt text to images to WordPress.</p>
<p>Since that time, 10up has shipped the <a href="https://github.com/10up/classifai/releases/tag/1.4.0">1.4</a> and <a href="https://github.com/10up/classifai/releases/tag/1.5.0">1.5</a> releases, representing a substantial ongoing investment in ClassifAI and our commitment to driving applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning technology forward in the content management and open source industries. <strong>Highlights of ClassifAI’s recent releases include automated image tagging, smart focal point cropping of images, bulk scanning of existing content, and other vital enhancements</strong>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/classifai-image-tagging-smart-cropping/#more-23098" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on ClassifAI Updates Deliver Automated Image Tagging, Smart Cropping, And Greater Developer Control</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-23053 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings adjusting-to-remote-work">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/adjusting-to-remote-work/">Adjusting To Remote Work: Tips From A Nine Year Old, Fully Remote Company</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-gabe-karp" title="Posts by Gabe Karp" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2017/11/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Gabe Karp</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/adjusting-to-remote-work/" title="Adjusting To Remote Work: Tips From A Nine Year Old, Fully Remote Company"><time datetime="2020-03-16T05:30:55-04:00">March 16, 2020</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/adjusting-to-remote-work/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote.jpg" alt="10up working remote" width="1600" height="874" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-23065" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote.jpg 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-300x164.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-800x437.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-768x420.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-1536x839.jpg 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-220x120.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-working-remote-160x87.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>When I joined 10up two and a half years ago to lead our strategic and commercial growth across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA), I was not only starting a new position, I was beginning an entirely new remote work experience. Inspired by companies like <a href="https://automattic.com/">Automattic</a> and <a href="https://basecamp.com/">Basecamp</a>, and fueled by the explosion in video conferencing and digital collaboration tools, 10up was founded as a fully distributed digital agency: our entire team, now <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10ups-9th-anniversary/">200 full-time team members</a>, works from home or in some cases, co working spaces, around the globe.</p>
<p>10up has been featured in case studies, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Work-Together-Anywhere-Remotely-Successfully-Individuals-ebook/dp/B07C2TTZVG">books</a>, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/remote-work-culture/">ebooks</a>, <a href="https://www.boye-co.com/blog/2019/7/1/how-to-make-remote-working-successful">interviews</a>, and <a href="https://www.comparably.com/articles/10-companies-with-fully-remote-workforces-that-are-hiring-now/">articles</a> about <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2017/04/25/10-virtual-companies-offering-six-figure-salaries.html">remote work culture</a>, including a Forbes list of <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/laurashin/2016/03/31/at-these-125-companies-all-or-most-employees-work-remotely/#6e81772b6530">notable remote work companies</a>. Our founder and president, Jake Goldman, has guest lectured at universities like Stanford and University of Michigan on the subject.</p>
<p>As a social person who enjoys collaborating with others, I didn’t know what to expect from a work-at-home culture and I wondered how I would be able to collaborate effectively with colleagues located around the world. Thankfully, my nerves were laid to rest quickly as I learned that a remote work culture can operate and even feel very similar to an in-office culture.</p>
<p>Faced with global health concerns and efforts to contain a rapidly spreading virus, many traditional in-office workforces are asking employees to work from home. For many professionals, this will be their first time navigating a remote work lifestyle. With that mind, I thought it might help to share some of the ways we approach remote work, foster meaningful connections, and cultivate a vibrant team culture.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/adjusting-to-remote-work/#more-23053" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Adjusting To Remote Work: Tips From A Nine Year Old, Fully Remote Company</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22966 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings 10up-launches-accelerev">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10up-launches-accelerev/">10up Launches AcceleRev, Provides Smaller Publishers Access To Vital&nbsp;Tools</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/katiewilkerson/" title="Posts by Katie Wilkerson" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/katie-wilkerson-bw-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/katie-wilkerson-bw-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Katie Wilkerson</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10up-launches-accelerev/" title="10up Launches AcceleRev, Provides Smaller Publishers Access To Vital Tools"><time datetime="2020-03-09T12:41:04-04:00">March 9, 2020</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10up-launches-accelerev/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>In 1994, the first website banner ad appeared on HotWired.com, boasting a <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2017/04/the-first-ever-banner-ad-on-the-web/523728/">44% clickthrough rate</a>. Since then, publishers have been investing in monetization strategies like direct display advertising and sponsored content to boost revenues. Today, distracted consumers, increased competition, banner blindness, and ad blocking tools make website monetization an increasing challenge for publishers.</p>
<p>From our work with clients like <em><a href="https://10up.com/our-work/saturday-evening-post/">The Saturday Evening Post</a></em>, <em><a href="https://10up.com/our-work/techcrunch/">TechCrunch</a></em>, and <a href="https://10up.com/our-work/pa-media-group/">PA Media Group</a>, to our partnerships with <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10up-partnership-the-news-project/">The News Project</a> and the <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/google-news-initiative-revenue-accelerator/">Google Local News Initiative</a>, 10up has a storied history of collaboration with news and media organizations around the world. Our Audience &amp; Revenue team works closely with publishers of all sizes to:</p>
<ol>
<li>Maximize the value of every visitor through digital advertising, reader revenue strategies, and conversion optimization;</li>
<li>Drive up the number of visitors through engagement strategy, content marketing, SEO, and advanced analytics.</li>
</ol>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google.png" alt="10up and Google Partnership" width="1600" height="271" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-23002" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google.png 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-300x51.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-800x136.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-768x130.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-1536x260.png 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-220x37.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/03/10up-google-160x27.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Now, <strong>10up is partnering with Google to offer new services through Google’s Ad Manager 360 platform in support of smaller publishers.</strong></p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10up-launches-accelerev/#more-22966" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Launches AcceleRev, Provides Smaller Publishers Access To Vital&nbsp;Tools</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22792 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings 10ups-9th-anniversary">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10ups-9th-anniversary/">10up Celebrates Its 9th Anniversary</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10ups-9th-anniversary/" title="10up Celebrates Its 9th Anniversary"><time datetime="2020-02-28T12:30:29-05:00">February 28, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary.jpg" alt="10up Celebrates Its 9th Anniversary" width="1600" height="560" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22798" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary.jpg 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-300x105.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-800x280.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-768x269.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-1536x538.jpg 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-220x77.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/02/10up-ninth-anniversary-160x56.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>This February, 10up wrapped its ninth year with much to celebrate. The company saw continued team and financial growth, with our most significant expansions across our European division, productized Managed Services offerings, and strategic Audience &amp; Revenue consulting services. We also doubled down on our contributions to a broader open web community, and team culture.</p>
<p>The result: We continued to expand our client roster with some of our most impressive wins to date. In 2019, we welcomed some of the most respected brands and organizations in the world into our portfolio, and expanded existing relationships with industry leading clients like Google and Microsoft.</p>
<h2>Consistent Revenue And Team Growth</h2>
<p><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10ups-8th-anniversary/">10up’s eighth anniversary</a> celebrated significant financial and team growth, which continued into our ninth year. We achieved <strong>18% revenue growth</strong> and gained <strong>48 new clients</strong> across verticals including healthcare, publishing, government, high tech, architecture, and financial services. We’re especially pleased by the increased diversification of that revenue across pillar accounts, which we see as vital to a healthy, sustainable workplace in the services sector. While in 2018, 20% of our revenue came from a single client, <strong>2019 included five seven-figure clients</strong>, with the largest accounting for only 9% of company-wide revenue.</p>
<p>The growth of our client portfolio along with our commitment to exceptional client delivery drove the expansion of Team10up to <strong>200 full-timers</strong>. This includes <strong>two full-time, in-house recruiters</strong> and <strong>10uppers spread across six continents and twenty-four countries</strong> (tell Antarctica we’re hiring). The executive team also expanded, as we welcomed our first full time Chief Financial Officer, Chuck Barlett, and made three internal promotions: </p>
<ul>
<li>Sarah Williams, VP, Client Delivery</li>
<li>Phil Crum, VP, New Client Strategy</li>
<li>Martha Schmidt, VP, Account Strategy</li>
</ul>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/10ups-9th-anniversary/#more-22792" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Celebrates Its 9th Anniversary</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22627 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside enterprise-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/enterprise-wordpress/" title="Enterprise WordPress Ebook"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jason-Clarke_avatar_1526492567-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/05/Jason-Clarke_avatar_1526492567-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jason-clarke" title="Posts by Jason Clarke" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jason Clarke</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/enterprise-wordpress/" title="Enterprise WordPress Ebook"><time datetime="2020-02-11T17:10:21-05:00">February 11, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>Today <a href="https://w3techs.com/technologies/details/cm-wordpress">WordPress powers 35% of the web</a>, yet there are still many myths and misconceptions about using the WordPress as an enterprise-level content management system.</p>
<p>10up is one of four enterprise agency partners featured in the new ebook, <a href="https://pantheon.io/resources/faster-smarter-safer-wordpress-for-enterprise-ebook">Faster, Smarter, Safer WordPress for Enterprise</a>, by <a href="https://pantheon.io/webops">Pantheon, a WebOps platform</a> for open-source Drupal and WordPress websites. The ebook shares valuable insights on how enterprises can best leverage WordPress and work with an agency partner. It also addresses common myths and misconceptions about the capability, security, and scalability of WordPress as a platform.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22420 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings google-news-initiative-revenue-accelerator">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/google-news-initiative-revenue-accelerator/">The Google News Initiative Revenue Accelerator</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/mikebal/" title="Posts by Mike Bal" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Mike-Bal-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/Mike-Bal-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Mike Bal</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/google-news-initiative-revenue-accelerator/" title="The Google News Initiative Revenue Accelerator"><time datetime="2020-01-30T11:55:21-05:00">January 30, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1.png" alt="Google News Initiative, LION Publishers, and 10up Partnership" width="1544" height="500" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22483" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1.png 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-800x259.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-768x249.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-1536x497.png 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/partnership-gni-lion-publishers-10up-1-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>The GNI Revenue Accelerator Program is a partnership between the <a href="https://newsinitiative.withgoogle.com/">Google News Initiative</a>, <a href="https://www.lionpublishers.com/">LION Publishers</a>, and <a href="https://10up.com/">10up</a> focused on establishing a foundational blueprint for local publishers to comprehensively optimize their web-based revenue. The pilot program kicked off in September 2019 and will continue throughout 2020. </p>
<p>The conditions for quality local journalism can be daunting. Digital ad revenue isn’t growing fast enough to offset decreases in print ad revenue, even as news organizations need to invest more to keep pace with digital innovation and change. As larger publishers leverage their resources to quickly adopt and integrate new technologies, they attract more readers and widen the gap between large-scale publishers and smaller publishers who lack the same resources.</p>
<p><strong>The GNI Revenue Accelerator Program aims to help local publishers keep pace, by providing technology resources to drive insights, traffic, engagement, and revenue yield.</strong> The core solutions and tactics the program offers are focused on universally applicable challenges and relatively easy-to-implement solutions. The goal isn’t to just help the publishers in the program, but to provide all publishers with a data-backed reference point for growing their audience and increasing their revenue.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/google-news-initiative-revenue-accelerator/#more-22420" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on The Google News Initiative Revenue Accelerator</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22336 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings ads-txt-manager">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/ads-txt-manager/">Ads.Txt Manager 1.2 Further Eases Ads.Txt Management Inside Of&nbsp;WordPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/ads-txt-manager/" title="Ads.Txt Manager 1.2 Further Eases Ads.Txt Management Inside Of WordPress"><time datetime="2020-01-23T12:15:09-05:00">January 23, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager.png" alt="Ads.txt Manager For WordPress" width="1544" height="500" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22348" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager.png 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-800x259.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-768x249.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-1536x497.png 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/ads-txt-manager-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>10up often finds itself immersed in the business of publishing, which includes the configuration and management of the programmatic buying and selling of ad space. Our long-time work in this space inspired the build of <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2017/ads-txt-manager-for-wordpress/">Ads.txt Manager</a>, our WordPress plugin that facilitates the creation, management, and validation of a site’s ads.txt whitelist file from the WordPress admin interface. With more than <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/ads-txt/">70,000 active installations</a>, the plugin has helped thousands of site owners eliminate the need to manually upload a new ads.txt file with every change and applies validation to prevent simple mistakes that can cause lost advertising revenue. Learn more about the Interactive Advertising Bureau’s Ads.txt initiative and its benefits in our <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2017/ads-txt-manager-for-wordpress/">launch post</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Our latest update, Ads.txt Manager 1.2, adds revision history, conflicting file detection, expanded developer features</strong>, better error message formatting, and a handful of under the hood bug fixes and code improvements.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/ads-txt-manager/#more-22336" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Ads.Txt Manager 1.2 Further Eases Ads.Txt Management Inside Of&nbsp;WordPress</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22222 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings category-projects autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin/">10up Releases Autoshare For Twitter, Our Latest Free, Open-Source Plugin</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin/" title="10up Releases Autoshare For Twitter, Our Latest Free, Open-Source Plugin"><time datetime="2020-01-21T12:30:18-05:00">January 21, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin.png" alt="Autoshare For Twitter WordPress Plugin" width="1544" height="500" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22228" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin.png 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-800x259.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-768x249.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-1536x497.png 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/autoshare-for-twitter/">Autoshare for Twitter</a> is our new WordPress plugin that automatically tweets your posts as soon as they’re published. Once you hit the Publish button, the plugin sends your post’s title, featured image, and link to Twitter, along with a custom message.</p>
<p>Unlike a myriad of other social media, multitool solutions, <strong>Autoshare for Twitter is built solely for Twitter</strong>. It focuses on doing one thing and does it well, with the code and interface craftsmanship we apply to every project.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/autoshare-for-twitter-wordpress-plugin/#more-22222" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Releases Autoshare For Twitter, Our Latest Free, Open-Source Plugin</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-22195 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web category-design 9to5mac-dark-side">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/9to5mac-dark-side/">Bringing Out 9to5Mac’s Dark&nbsp;Side</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-ricky-lee-whittemore" title="Posts by Ricky Lee Whittemore" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Ricky Lee Whittemore" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/ricky-lee-whittemore-avatar-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/ricky-lee-whittemore-avatar-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Ricky Lee Whittemore</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/9to5mac-dark-side/" title="Bringing Out 9to5Mac’s Dark Side"><time datetime="2020-01-14T12:30:32-05:00">January 14, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example.jpg" alt="9to5mac Dark Mode Example" width="1600" height="1225" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22207" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example.jpg 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-300x230.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-800x613.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-768x588.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-1536x1176.jpg 1536w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-162x124.jpg 162w, https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/9to5mac-dark-mode-example-118x90.jpg 118w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Brightly colored screens in low-light environments can <a href="https://www.health.harvard.edu/staying-healthy/blue-light-has-a-dark-side">keep people up at night</a>, contribute to eyestrain, and even <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/10/21/dark-mode-ios-13-test/">burn up battery life on newer devices with OLED displays</a>. In recent years, all major operating systems — <a href="https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT208976">macOS</a>, <a href="https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210332">iOS</a>, <a href="https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2019/04/01/windows-10-tip-dark-theme-in-file-explorer/">Windows</a>, and <a href="https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/look-and-feel/darktheme">Android</a> — have added a dark-mode option. With this setting, the OS and any application that supports dark mode can switch from a light color scheme to darker tone, which offers UI personalization and reduces eye fatigue.</p>
<p><strong>With all major web browsers now supporting the dark-mode setting, web developers can also serve either a light or dark theme, based on the user’s device setting.</strong></p>
<p>Apple news site 9to5mac, a long-term client, <a href="https://9to5mac.com/2019/09/09/dark-mode-iphone-ipad-mac/">added dark-mode support</a> to its site just before the official release of iOS 13 last Fall — the first version of the iPhone operating system to offer dark mode.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/9to5mac-dark-side/#more-22195" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Bringing Out 9to5Mac’s Dark&nbsp;Side</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21973 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings category-projects elasticsearch-elasticpress-porsche-quality-search-experience">

<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/elasticsearch-elasticpress-porsche-quality-search-experience/">Leveraging Elasticsearch With ElasticPress To Create A Porsche-Quality Search Experience</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-vasken-hauri" title="Posts by Vasken Hauri" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/VHauri-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/VHauri-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Vasken Hauri</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2020/elasticsearch-elasticpress-porsche-quality-search-experience/" title="Leveraging Elasticsearch With ElasticPress To Create A Porsche-Quality Search Experience"><time datetime="2020-01-09T12:00:38-05:00">January 9, 2020</time></a>
</p>
<p>When <a href="https://www.elferspot.com/">Elferspot</a>, the largest marketplace for classic and pre-owned Porsche sports cars, wanted to create a premium search experience on their WordPress site, they turned to 10up’s managed search solution for WordPress, <a href="https://www.elasticpress.io/">ElasticPress.io</a>.</p>

<p>“I’ve never had such an amazing support experience with any company. I had a problem with how I wanted to use ElasticPress and the support team worked with us to solve the problem together.” </p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-21814 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside remote-work-culture">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/remote-work-culture/" title="Remote Work Culture"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/remote-work-culture/" title="Remote Work Culture"><time datetime="2019-12-04T12:30:17-05:00">December 4, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>From New York City, to rural South Africa, to a dozen countries across Europe, our distributed workforce model empowers us to bring in the best strategists, designers, and engineers, wherever they may live—because the best talent isn’t found in a single zip code. </p>
<p>Recently, I had the opportunity to discuss our forward-looking <a href="https://10up.com/about/#distributed">remote work culture</a> with Toggl. </p>
<p>My interview is featured in their new ebook <a href="https://toggl.com/work-with-online-clients/">How Remote-Friendly Organizations Can Embrace a Client Roster That’s Not Limited by Office Location</a>, along with insights from other remote work cultures, including Buffer, Gitlab, and Doist. The ebook provides a blueprint for building a successful business while working remotely, including establishing customer expectations, choosing the right tools, and navigating cultural differences.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21331 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings elasticpress-improves-elasticsearch-functionality">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/elasticpress-improves-elasticsearch-functionality/">ElasticPress 3.1 introduces a friendly interface to manage search weighting and&nbsp;ordering</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-vasken-hauri" title="Posts by Vasken Hauri" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/VHauri-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/VHauri-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Vasken Hauri</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/elasticpress-improves-elasticsearch-functionality/" title="ElasticPress 3.1 introduces a friendly interface to manage search weighting and ordering"><time datetime="2019-11-20T12:30:14-05:00">November 20, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p>At 10up, we think digital innovation often happens at the intersection of expertise in design and engineering. The latest release of ElasticPress represents 10up innovation at its best, bringing together expertise in user interface design, web engineering, and systems architecture. In ElasticPress 3.1, we’ve introduced a simple and friendly user interface right inside of WordPress for managing search result weighting and customized results; a challenge that required Elasticsearch appliance expertise, and advanced WordPress UI and back end development.</p>
<p>From information discovery and filtering to data visualization and mapping, search is the foundation of many digital experiences across the websites and apps we use every day.</p>
<p>Thousands of websites rely on <a href="https://www.elasticpress.io/">ElasticPress</a> to extend the native WordPress search functionality through an integration with Elasticsearch, a fast, scalable way to manage searchable content in near-real-time. The release of <a href="https://www.elasticpress.io/blog/2019/11/weighting-and-search-ordering/">ElasticPress 3.1</a>, that includes weighted search and custom search ordering, moves several popular code-based features into an intuitive dashboard that provides a comfortable experience for anyone familiar with WordPress.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/elasticpress-improves-elasticsearch-functionality/#more-21331" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on ElasticPress 3.1 introduces a friendly interface to manage search weighting and&nbsp;ordering</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21496 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web category-happenings wordpress-github-actions-streamline-plugin-deployment">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-github-actions-streamline-plugin-deployment/">10up Releases WordPress GitHub Actions To Streamline Plugin Deployment</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-github-actions-streamline-plugin-deployment/" title="10up Releases WordPress GitHub Actions To Streamline Plugin Deployment"><time datetime="2019-11-18T16:44:33-05:00">November 18, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-github-actions-streamline-plugin-deployment/#comments" class="comments-count">5 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>According to GitHub, developers have contributed more than <a href="https://github.blog/2019-10-08-github-actions-from-open-source-maintainers/">1,200 Actions to GitHub Marketplace</a> since <a href="https://github.com/features/actions">GitHub Actions</a> was released in beta last year. Our mission to craft tools for content creators — including developers — and our passion for <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-practice/">open-source contribution</a> led us to make <strong>a solution that uses GitHub Actions to radically streamline and simplify WordPress plugin release management.</strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Automating Your Workflow With GitHub Actions</strong><br>
GitHub Actions enables you to create <a href="https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/about-github-actions">custom software development life cycle (SDLC)</a> workflows directly in your GitHub repository. You can write individual tasks, called actions, and combine them to create a custom workflow. Workflows are custom automated processes that you can set up in your repository to build, test, package, release, or deploy any code project on GitHub.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>As a WordPress core lead developer and Director of Open Source Initiatives at 10up, I immediately saw the opportunity to use GitHub Actions to make specific tasks easier for WordPress plugin developers, like deploying a plugin and its assets/readme updates to the official <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/">WordPress.org plugin repository</a>. </p>
<p>We <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins/">previously introduced</a> early versions of these Actions, and now they’re ready for primetime following the announcement of <a href="https://github.blog/2019-11-14-powering-community-led-innovation-with-github-actions/">general availability of GitHub Actions</a> — an announcement that took the time to spotlight our “WordPress publishing” solution:</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wordpress-github-actions-mention.png" alt="WordPress GitHub Actions Mention on the GitHub Blog" width="1600" height="630" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-21523" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention.png 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention-300x118.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention-768x302.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention-800x315.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention-220x87.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/wordpress-github-actions-mention-160x63.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-github-actions-streamline-plugin-deployment/#more-21496" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Releases WordPress GitHub Actions To Streamline Plugin Deployment</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21421 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside wordpress-5-3-released">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-5-3-released/" title="WordPress 5.3 Released"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordpress-5-3-released/" title="WordPress 5.3 Released"><time datetime="2019-11-13T12:15:51-05:00">November 13, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2019/11/kirk/">WordPress 5.3</a> was released yesterday, featuring block editor refinements that deliver more intuitive interactions and improved accessibility, new editor features that give designers more control over visual design, and the block-based Twenty Twenty WordPress theme. Several 10uppers contributed to this release during its development cycle, including Jeffrey Paul and Adam Silverstein, who are recognized as Noteworthy Contributors.</p>
<p>Thank you for helping make WordPress:<br>
Ashar Irfan, Christian Chung, Helen Hou-Sandi, Mario Aguiar (emeritus), and Ryan Welcher.</p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-21133 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings category-projects open-source-best-practices">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-best-practices/">Best Practices for Managing Open-Source Software</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-best-practices/" title="Best Practices for Managing Open-Source Software"><time datetime="2019-10-29T12:00:28-04:00">October 29, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">Contribution to the open web</a> is one of 10up’s guiding values. The sharing of expertise, like our <a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/">engineering best practices</a>, and the creation of our open source tools like <a href="https://distributorplugin.com/">Distributor</a>, <a href="https://classifaiplugin.com/">ClassifAI</a>, and <a href="https://www.elasticpress.io/">ElasticPress</a>, along with our hundreds of commits to open projects like WordPress, reflect 10up’s position as a leading contributor to open source platforms.</p>
<p><strong>Our latest contribution is the release of our official <a href="https://10up.github.io/Open-Source-Best-Practices/">Open Source Best Practices as a public project on GitHub</a>.</strong></p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/10up-open-source-best-practices.png" alt="10up Open Source Best Practices GitHub Repo Home Page" width="1814" height="1122" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-21436" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices.png 1814w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices-300x186.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices-768x475.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices-800x495.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices-200x124.png 200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/10up-open-source-best-practices-146x90.png 146w" sizes="(max-width: 1814px) 100vw, 1814px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Following 10up’s mission to make a better web with finely crafted websites and tools for content creators, our <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-practice/">Open Source Practice</a> brings forth deep experience in the long-term stewardship of open-source projects. Beyond pushing code to a public repository, effective open-source management requires thoughtful consideration of licensing, defining maintenance procedures, and proactive communication with participants. By releasing our best practices, we hope to provide a guide for the establishment and ownership of open-source projects.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-best-practices/#more-21133" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Best Practices for Managing Open-Source Software</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21118 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances category-happenings wordcamp-us-2019">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-us-2019/">10up Is WordCamp US&nbsp;Bound</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-us-2019/" title="10up Is WordCamp US Bound"><time datetime="2019-10-22T12:00:16-04:00">October 22, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wordcamp-us-2019.png" alt="WordCamp US" width="1300" height="420" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-21124" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019.png 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019-768x248.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019-800x258.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/wordcamp-us-2019-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Each year, we participate in dozens of industry events around the world. One highlight is <a href="https://2019.us.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp US</a>, the largest official WordPress conference in the United States. This year, we’re heading to St. Louis, Missouri for three days. </p>
<h2>Speaking</h2>
<p>We’re proud to have two speakers leading off this year’s event. In the presentation <a href="https://2019.us.wordcamp.org/session/open-source-open-process-open-web/">Open Source, Open Process, Open Web</a>, Helen Hou-Sandi, Director of Open Source Initiatives, will examine the histories of open source and the open web, and discuss how they apply to WordPress. </p>
<p>Jeffrey Paul, Open Source Practice Manager, will answer the question, “I’m not a developer, how can I contribute to WordPress?” in the presentation <a href="https://2019.us.wordcamp.org/session/contributing-to-core-no-coding-necessary/">Contributing to Core, No Coding Necessary</a>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-us-2019/#more-21118" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Is WordCamp US&nbsp;Bound</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21097 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects integrating-millions-of-public-data-records-with-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/integrating-millions-of-public-data-records-with-wordpress/">Integrating More Than 20 Million Public Data Records With WordPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-brian-bourn" title="Posts by Brian Bourn" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/BrianBourn-BW-800x800-1-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/BrianBourn-BW-800x800-1-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Brian Bourn</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/integrating-millions-of-public-data-records-with-wordpress/" title="Integrating More Than 20 Million Public Data Records With WordPress"><time datetime="2019-10-15T12:15:48-04:00">October 15, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-21103" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019.jpg" alt="Brian Bourn Speaking at BigWP SF" width="1200" height="702" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019.jpg 1200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-300x176.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-768x449.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-800x468.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-212x124.jpg 212w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-292x172.jpg 292w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/10/brian-bourn-bigwp-sf-june-2019-154x90.jpg 154w" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>As a WordPress.com VIP gold agency partner, 10up was recently invited to speak at <a href="https://www.meetup.com/Big-Media-Enterprise-WordPress-Meetup-SF/">BigWP SF</a>, the enterprise WordPress meetup series that brings together developers, business leaders, and product managers who work with high-scale WordPress applications every day.</p>
<p>My presentation, <a href="https://wpvip.com/2019/09/05/using-elasticsearch-for-millions-of-public-data-records-with-wordpress/">Managing Millions of Public Data Records With WordPress</a>, highlighted the challenges we encountered when integrating millions of public data records with the WordPress-powered website for <a href="https://electricityplans.com/">ElectricityPlans</a>, a broker in the deregulated Texas electricity market, and how we used solutions like <a href="https://www.elasticpress.io/">ElasticPress</a> to overcome those challenges.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/integrating-millions-of-public-data-records-with-wordpress/#more-21097" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Integrating More Than 20 Million Public Data Records With WordPress</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-21052 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web leveraging-new-relic-to-keep-content-flowing">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/leveraging-new-relic-to-keep-content-flowing/">Leveraging New Relic to Keep Content Flowing</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-vasken-hauri" title="Posts by Vasken Hauri" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/VHauri-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/VHauri-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Vasken Hauri</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/leveraging-new-relic-to-keep-content-flowing/" title="Leveraging New Relic to Keep Content Flowing"><time datetime="2019-09-27T12:00:32-04:00">September 27, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/vasken-new-relic-guest-post.jpg" alt="New Relic Guest Post By Vasken Hauri" width="1600" height="515" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-21058" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post.jpg 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post-300x97.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post-768x247.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post-800x258.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post-220x71.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/vasken-new-relic-guest-post-160x52.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>When discussing website performance, most people zero in on page load speed and the front-end user experience. This approach, however, ignores a critical subset of people interacting with the website—content creators working in the content management system (CMS). In a <a href="https://blog.newrelic.com/product-news/10up-uses-new-relic-to-help-website-content-creators/">guest post published on the official New Relic blog</a>, I share how 10up leveraged New Relic tools to better support content creators and empower them to work more efficiently through back-end performance improvements.</p>
<p>10up uses New Relic’s performance monitoring to acquire real-time and trending data that can be used to troubleshoot performance challenges and diagnose problems quickly, which in turn, saves time and reduces cost.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20950 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings open-source-practice">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-practice/">Introducing 10up’s Open Source Practice</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul" title="Posts by Jeff Paul" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Jeffrey Paul." src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JeffreyPaul_headshot-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/JeffreyPaul_headshot-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jeff Paul</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-practice/" title="Introducing 10up’s Open Source Practice"><time datetime="2019-09-12T12:30:07-04:00">September 12, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming.jpg" alt="10up Summit in Jackson Hole, Wyoming" width="1600" height="777" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20959" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming.jpg 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming-300x146.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming-768x373.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming-800x389.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming-220x107.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/10up-summit-jackson-hole-wyoming-160x78.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>10up aims to make a better web through finely crafted websites, innovative tools for content creators, and open-source contributions that drive growth. As a leading contributor to WordPress and the greater open-source community, the creation and sharing of open platforms and tools is a large part of our identity.</p>
<p><strong>The establishment of an official Open Source Practice within 10up demonstrates our commitment to advance open-source technology, lead by example, and grow the community of which we are proud to be a part and upon whose shoulders we stand.</strong></p>
<p>We have long utilized employee downtime between client projects for open-source contribution. Earlier this year, I joined the team as <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jeff-paul">Open Source Practice Manager</a>. I work most closely with <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-helen-hou-sandi">Helen Hou-Sandí</a>, our Director of Open Source Initiatives, and <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-adam-silverstein">Adam Silverstein</a>, a Lead Open Source Initiatives Engineer, both of whom primarily focus on open source and contribution. That core team is augmented by additional 10uppers, some of whom have dedicated recurring time carved out for open source initiatives, and some of whom join our efforts for discrete projects. Collectively, 10up invests more than 350 hours every month into our open source initiatives.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/open-source-practice/#more-20950" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Introducing 10up’s Open Source Practice</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20887 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings category-projects insert-special-characters-wordpress-plugin">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/insert-special-characters-wordpress-plugin/">10up Releases Insert Special Characters For The New WordPress Editor</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-thorsten-ott" title="Posts by Thorsten Ott" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TOtt-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TOtt-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Thorsten Ott</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/insert-special-characters-wordpress-plugin/" title="10up Releases Insert Special Characters For The New WordPress Editor"><time datetime="2019-09-05T14:03:21-04:00">September 5, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/insert-special-characters-wordpress-plugin/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/insert-special-characters-banner.png" alt="Insert Special Characters Plugin Banner" width="1600" height="518" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20908" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner.png 1600w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner-768x249.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner-800x259.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/09/insert-special-characters-banner-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1600px) 100vw, 1600px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
Last week, we released <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/insert-special-characters/">Insert Special Characters</a>, a plugin that brings a special characters menu to the new WordPress block editor. </p>
<p>The new WordPress editor (aka Gutenberg) introduced a modern, block-based paradigm for visually authoring content. For all of its advancements, a button to insert special characters was not carried over from the classic editing experience—a feature critical to writers and publishers frequently using mathematical notation or other symbols. <a href="https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/1678">Feedback concerning its absence</a> and some client questions inspired our Open Source Practice to take action.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/insert-special-characters-wordpress-plugin/#more-20887" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Releases Insert Special Characters For The New WordPress Editor</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-20749 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings significant-distributor-improvements">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/significant-distributor-improvements/">Distributor Delivers Enhanced Performance and Improved Media Handling</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/significant-distributor-improvements/" title="Distributor Delivers Enhanced Performance and Improved Media Handling"><time datetime="2019-08-20T11:45:24-04:00">August 20, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/distributor-blog-post-graphic.jpg" alt="Distributor WordPress Plugin" width="1544" height="500" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20764" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic.jpg 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-300x97.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-768x249.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-800x259.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-220x71.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-160x52.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><a href="https://distributorplugin.com/">Distributor</a>—our plugin that makes it easy to syndicate and reuse content across WordPress-powered websites—<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/distributor-wordpress-syndication-reuse/">was released in beta last year</a>. Since that time, 10up has shipped several point releases, representing significant and continued investment in Distributor and <strong>delivering improvements in performance, smarter media syndication, and enhancements to the content “pull” feature</strong>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/significant-distributor-improvements/#more-20749" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Distributor Delivers Enhanced Performance and Improved Media Handling</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20689 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside wordcamp-for-publishers-2019">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-for-publishers-2019/" title="John Eckman Speaking at WordCamp for Publishers"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-for-publishers-2019/" title="John Eckman Speaking at WordCamp for Publishers"><time datetime="2019-08-07T11:23:34-04:00">August 7, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>From its conception, 10up has worked with vital publishers and content creators to improve storytelling across the web. This week I’m in Columbus, Ohio to participate in the third annual <a href="https://2019-columbus.publishers.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp for Publishers</a>—a conference bringing together content creators using WordPress to manage and grow publications of all sizes. Thursday, I’ll be delivering the lightning talk “<a href="https://2019-columbus.publishers.wordcamp.org/session/thursday-lightning-talks/">#NoStalking</a>,” about the challenges of delivering advertising that drives revenue but also respects user privacy.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20584 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web analysis-css-in-javascript-applications">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/analysis-css-in-javascript-applications/">Analysis of CSS in JavaScript Applications Featured on&nbsp;CSS-Tricks</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/dominicmagnifico/" title="Posts by Dominic Magnifico" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Dominic-Magnifico-v2-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/11/Dominic-Magnifico-v2-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Dominic Magnifico</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/analysis-css-in-javascript-applications/" title="Analysis of CSS in JavaScript Applications Featured on CSS-Tricks"><time datetime="2019-07-17T12:00:31-04:00">July 17, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications.png" alt="Article Screenshot The Many Ways to Include CSS in JavaScript Applications" width="1772" height="980" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20590" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications.png 1772w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications-300x166.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications-768x425.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications-800x442.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications-220x122.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications-160x88.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1772px) 100vw, 1772px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>There are several ways to handle CSS architecture within JavaScript applications. While considered a controversial topic among front-end developers, it’s important to remember that each method, whether in a React, Vue, or Angular application, has its own merits and inefficiencies. In a recent article for CSS-Tricks (one of the leading digital publications covering web technologies), I explore CSS architecture and the <a href="https://css-tricks.com/the-many-ways-to-include-css-in-javascript-applications/">many ways to include CSS in JavaScript Applications</a>—from using an external stylesheet, to creating CSS Modules, or writing CSS-in-JS.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20530 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings 10up-partnership-the-news-project">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10up-partnership-the-news-project/">10up’s Partnership With The News Project Makes Headlines</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10up-partnership-the-news-project/" title="10up’s Partnership With The News Project Makes Headlines"><time datetime="2019-07-12T12:00:22-04:00">July 12, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/calmatters-website-1.png" alt="CALmatters Website" width="1814" height="1122" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20551" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1.png 1814w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1-300x186.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1-768x475.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1-800x495.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1-200x124.png 200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/calmatters-website-1-146x90.png 146w" sizes="(max-width: 1814px) 100vw, 1814px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>The News Project has launched its first customer on its new SaaS platform for small to mid market publishers, and we couldn’t be more thrilled.</p>
<p>You may have <a href="https://www.axios.com/the-news-project-wordpress-local-news-cms-49d8f91e-2253-4709-bd85-9fb9e06fdd23.html">read about The News Project</a>—and our involvement—earlier this year on Axios. As a long-time digital partner for publishers and news organizations around the world, 10up is proud to be the technical strategy and implementation partner for <a href="https://thenewsproject.net/">The News Project</a>, helping bring to life its vision for a “news business in a box”.&nbsp;In engineering the core platform atop WordPress, we worked closely with its first customer—<a href="https://calmatters.org/">CALmatters</a>—to provide customizations and ensure a successful launch.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10up-partnership-the-news-project/#more-20530" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up’s Partnership With The News Project Makes Headlines</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20569 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-aside making-distributed-work-successful">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/making-distributed-work-successful/" title="Making Distributed Work Successful"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/making-distributed-work-successful/" title="Making Distributed Work Successful"><time datetime="2019-07-11T18:01:15-04:00">July 11, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>At 10up, we believe the best talent isn’t found in a single zip code—from New York City, to the wilds of Idaho, to a dozen countries across the globe, our model empowers us to bring in the best strategists, designers, and engineers, wherever they may live. In a recent <a href="https://www.boye-co.com/blog/2019/7/1/how-to-make-remote-working-successful">conversation with Boye &amp; Company</a>, I share important considerations for organizations exploring a distributed team model, challenges a remote work environment can create for growing companies, and insights on how we make remote work successful within 10up.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20362 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings extending-gutenberg-with-slotfill">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/extending-gutenberg-with-slotfill/">Extending Gutenberg With SlotFill and&nbsp;Filters</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/ryanwelcher/" title="Posts by Ryan Welcher" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/ryan_welcher_headshot-bw-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/ryan_welcher_headshot-bw-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Ryan Welcher</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/extending-gutenberg-with-slotfill/" title="Extending Gutenberg With SlotFill and Filters"><time datetime="2019-07-10T11:30:00-04:00">July 10, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/extending-gutenberg-with-slotfill/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p>Last year, WordPress 5.0 launched with an entirely new, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/gutenberg-user-research/">block-based content editing experience</a>—previously codenamed Gutenberg—and along with it, a new paradigm for developers to extend the editing and content publishing experience.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-20560" style="text-align: left; visibility: visible;" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-distributor.png" alt="SlotFill Distributor Plugin Example" width="260" height="293" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-distributor.png 400w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-distributor-267x300.png 267w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-distributor-110x124.png 110w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-distributor-80x90.png 80w" sizes="(max-width: 260px) 100vw, 260px" data-xblocker="passed"> <img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-20563" style="text-align: left; visibility: visible;" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-postpublishpanel-1.png" alt="SlotFill PostPublishPanel Example" width="260" height="293" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-postpublishpanel-1.png 400w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-postpublishpanel-1-267x300.png 267w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-postpublishpanel-1-110x124.png 110w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-postpublishpanel-1-80x90.png 80w" sizes="(max-width: 260px) 100vw, 260px" data-xblocker="passed"> <img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-20557" style="text-align: left; visibility: visible;" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-plugindocumentsettingpanel.png" alt="Slotfill PluginDocumentSettingsPanel Example" width="260" height="293" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-plugindocumentsettingpanel.png 400w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-plugindocumentsettingpanel-267x300.png 267w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-plugindocumentsettingpanel-110x124.png 110w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/07/slotfill-plugindocumentsettingpanel-80x90.png 80w" sizes="(max-width: 260px) 100vw, 260px" data-xblocker="passed"></p>
<p><em>SlotFills enable developers to extend WordPress’ new editor interface.</em></p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/extending-gutenberg-with-slotfill/#more-20362" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Extending Gutenberg With SlotFill and&nbsp;Filters</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
