<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/project-scaffolds-released/">10up Project Scaffolds Released</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/project-scaffolds-released/" title="10up Project Scaffolds Released"><time datetime="2019-06-25T11:45:16-04:00">June 25, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/project-scaffolds.jpg" alt="Project Scaffolds Screen With Code" width="1278" height="374" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20335" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds.jpg 1278w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds-300x88.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds-768x225.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds-800x234.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds-220x64.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/project-scaffolds-160x47.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1278px) 100vw, 1278px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>At 10up, we make remarkable tools for building and telling stories—and make those tools available to everyone. With a goal of maintaining the highest standards for design and engineering, we created a scaffold to help ensure the 10up standards are applied to all projects in the most efficient way possible.</p>
<p><strong>Today, we are excited to open-source and release our project scaffolding application suite.</strong></p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-20227 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances wpcampus-2019">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wpcampus-2019/">Supporting Higher Education at WPCampus&nbsp;2019</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-64x64.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-128x128.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wpcampus-2019/" title="Supporting Higher Education at WPCampus 2019"><time datetime="2019-06-20T11:30:36-04:00">June 20, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wpcampus-2019.png" alt="WPCampus 2019 Logo" width="1300" height="420" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20233" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019.png 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019-768x248.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019-800x258.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wpcampus-2019-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Every year, 10uppers across the globe volunteer, speak at, and organize dozens of industry events. Whether its a local WordCamp or national jsConf, a niche conference like Write the Docs or an expansive one like CMS Expo, we make the time to <a href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">give back to open-source</a> and share our expertise. </p>
<p>Given our portfolio of client projects and partnerships in higher education, we’re thrilled to once again be a part of <a href="https://2019.wpcampus.org/">WPCampus</a>, a three-day conference dedicated to the confluence of WordPress in higher education, taking place July 25-27, 2019 at Lewis &amp; Clark College in Portland, Oregon.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wpcampus-2019/#more-20227" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Supporting Higher Education at WPCampus&nbsp;2019</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20215 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress/">ClassifAI Brings AI and Machine Learning Services to&nbsp;WordPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress/" title="ClassifAI Brings AI and Machine Learning Services to WordPress"><time datetime="2019-06-18T08:30:08-04:00">June 18, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/ClassifAI.png" alt="ClassifAI Screen Example" width="1300" height="1017" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20260" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI.png 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI-300x235.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI-768x601.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI-800x626.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI-159x124.png 159w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/ClassifAI-115x90.png 115w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><a href="https://www.drive.ai/">Drive.ai</a> uses artificial intelligence to create self-driving cars. <a href="https://openai.com/">OpenAI</a>, a nonprofit research company backed by Elon Musk, created an artificial intelligence model called GPT2 that can generate text relevant to topic, tone, and feeling based on only a few words. Navigation services use artificial intelligence to decipher hundreds of thousands of data points to provide real-time traffic data.</p>
<p>Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning are revolutionizing technology and when applied to digital publishing, the opportunities available to streamline internal workflows, enhance visitor experiences, and increase revenue are endless.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Artificial Intelligence vs. Machine Learning</strong><br>
<em>AI is the capability of a machine to imitate intelligent human behavior. Machine learning is a subset of AI with the ability to <a href="https://skymind.ai/wiki/ai-vs-machine-learning-vs-deep-learning">modify itself when exposed to more data</a>; i.e. machine learning is dynamic and does not require human intervention to make certain changes.</em></p>
</blockquote>
<p>Search engines like Google rely on AI and machine learning to “understand” what your content and site are about and how it should be ranked. But have you ever wondered if search engines interpret your content the same way you do? Or have you ever considered how these cutting edge technologies could be used to improve your content strategy or reduce resources?</p>
<p>These are the questions we’re asking at 10up as we look to the future of publishing technology and explore practical solutions that streamline editorial processes, increase audience engagement, and boost profits—solutions like our new plugin ClassifAI.</p>
<p><strong><a href="https://classifaiplugin.com/">ClassifAI</a> is a free, open-source plugin that leverages leading cloud-based services like <a href="https://www.ibm.com/watson">IBM Watson</a> and <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/overview/ai-platform/">Microsoft Azure AI</a> to augment WordPress-powered websites with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology.</strong></p>
<p>With years of experience working with some of the largest digital content creators, 10up understands that AI and machine learning will play an important role in the future of content creation and website experiences and we’re committed to driving this technology forward in the WordPress community. Today we are excited to share merely the first steps for ClassifAI: <strong>automated content tagging and classification</strong> as well as the <strong>automatic creation of image ALT text</strong>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/classifai-ai-machine-learning-wordpress/#more-20215" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on ClassifAI Brings AI and Machine Learning Services to&nbsp;WordPress</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20203 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web category-design get-started-with-gutenberg">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/get-started-with-gutenberg/">Get Started With Gutenberg</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/get-started-with-gutenberg/" title="Get Started With Gutenberg"><time datetime="2019-06-12T12:10:46-04:00">June 12, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/get-started-with-gutenberg/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20209" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/get-started-with-gutenberg.jpg" alt="Get Started with Gutenberg Books" width="1300" height="420" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg.jpg 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg-300x97.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg-768x248.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg-800x258.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg-220x71.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/get-started-with-gutenberg-160x52.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>I recently contributed an article to <em>Get Started With Gutenberg</em>, a free publication produced by <a href="https://www.heartinternet.uk/">Heart Internet</a>. <em>Jumpstart Your Gutenberg Designs With SketchPress</em> provides a detailed tutorial on using <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordpress-wireframes-sketch/">SketchPress</a>: a library of WordPress admin interfaces, symbols, and icons for use with the popular design toolkit, Sketch. With SketchPress designers can create high-fidelity mockups of custom blocks and other editorial interfaces for both Gutenberg and classic versions of the WordPress admin. SketchPress and other <a href="https://github.com/10up">open-source projects from 10up</a> are <a href="https://github.com/10up/SketchPress">available on GitHub</a>. You can pick up a copy of the book at WordCamp Europe or <a href="https://www.heartinternet.uk/blog/download-your-free-get-started-with-gutenberg-ebook/">download the digital copy</a>.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20167 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances category-happenings wordcamp-europe-2019">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-europe-2019/">10up Heads To Berlin for WordCamp Europe&nbsp;2019</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-gabe-karp" title="Posts by Gabe Karp" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2017/11/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Gabe Karp</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-europe-2019/" title="10up Heads To Berlin for WordCamp Europe 2019"><time datetime="2019-06-10T17:34:07-04:00">June 10, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-20173" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wordcamp-europe-2019.png" alt="" width="1300" height="420" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019.png 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019-768x248.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019-800x258.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/06/wordcamp-europe-2019-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>From speaking and delivering product demos to volunteering at contributor day, #team10up is excited to be part of <a href="https://2019.europe.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Europe 2019</a>, a WordPress conference happening June 21-22 in Berlin, Germany that attracts more than 2,000 attendees.</p>
<p>Contributing to communities that value an open web is <a href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">a big part of our identity</a>, and we can’t wait to share insights and collectively further the WordPress project. Several 10uppers, including myself and Brent van Rensburg, Director of Engineering, will be roaming the event, presenting, and lending a hand at the Google booth.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/wordcamp-europe-2019/#more-20167" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up Heads To Berlin for WordCamp Europe&nbsp;2019</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20054 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances presenting-at-remote-future-summit">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/presenting-at-remote-future-summit/">Presenting at Remote Future&nbsp;Summit</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-brad-miller" title="Posts by Brad Miller" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/cropped-brad-headshot-scaled-2-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2023/04/cropped-brad-headshot-scaled-2-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Brad Miller</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/presenting-at-remote-future-summit/" title="Presenting at Remote Future Summit"><time datetime="2019-05-14T13:38:20-04:00">May 14, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-20056 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Brad_Miller.png" alt="Brad Miller presents How to Be Successful in a Remote Job and Company at Remote Future Summit." width="1920" height="1080" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller.png 1920w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-300x169.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-768x432.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-800x450.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-220x124.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-1152x648.png 1152w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-576x324.png 576w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/05/Brad_Miller-160x90.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>The best talent isn’t found in a single zip code and an international clientele requires a global perspective. Independence from traditional “brick and mortar” offices, freedom from commutes, and flexible schedules across nearly a dozen time zones mean we work when and where we’re most inspired and are available when our clients need us. At 10up, we’re advocates for remote work and know how to make it succeed for the company and the individual.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/presenting-at-remote-future-summit/#more-20054" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Presenting at Remote Future&nbsp;Summit</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-20021 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-design category-uncategorized nate-allen-contributes-dashicons">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/nate-allen-contributes-dashicons/">Nate Allen contributes to the WordPress Dashicon Library</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/nate-allen-contributes-dashicons/" title="Nate Allen contributes to the WordPress Dashicon Library"><time datetime="2019-04-24T13:28:15-04:00">April 24, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p>Iconography design might seem an uncommon undertaking for a developer, but <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-nate-allen">Senior Engineer Nate Allen</a> recently saw an opportunity to make <a href="https://developer.wordpress.org/resource/dashicons/">WordPress’s Dashicon library</a> more inclusive. He took the initiative to tackle the design challenge himself, learning Adobe Illustrator in order to supplement the existing “businessman” icon with additional icons for “businesswoman” and “businessperson.” These icons, along with many more new icons, <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2019/04/11/dashicons-in-wordpress-5-2/">will be released with WordPress 5.2</a>.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-20029 aligncenter" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/business-people-icons-1.png" alt="" width="200" height="102" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/04/business-people-icons-1.png 200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/04/business-people-icons-1-160x82.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Nate’s determination to stretch his core skills and proactively contribute a creative, open source solution is a small but meaningful representation of the 10up way. Thanks for your dedication to the community and your craft, Nate!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19980 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-design gutenberg-user-research">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/gutenberg-user-research/">Early Perceptions of the New WordPress Editor</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/gutenberg-user-research/" title="Early Perceptions of the New WordPress Editor"><time datetime="2019-04-12T13:36:27-04:00">April 12, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<p>Prior to the release of WordPress 5.0, I conducted a survey asking WordPress users with Gutenberg experience to offer their perspective on the new editor. The survey was conducted as part of a broader user-research effort designed to understand more about how content publishers view page-building and <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/design/2018/11/30/exploring-sitebuilding-via-user-research/">site-building</a> tools, and how the new content editor matches expectations. This research was intended to explore the behaviors and opinions of people who had already tried Gutenberg. Updates to the new editor based on this research are being tracked on <a href="https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg">Github</a> and <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/tag/gutenberg/">MakeWordPress.org</a>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/gutenberg-user-research/#more-19980" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Early Perceptions of the New WordPress Editor</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19914 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-aside tim-wright-a11y">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/tim-wright-a11y/" title="Tim Wright’s work in support of accessibility"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/tim-wright-a11y/" title="Tim Wright’s work in support of accessibility"><time datetime="2019-03-20T14:04:14-04:00">March 20, 2019</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>At 10up, we believe that the web is better when we prioritize equal access to digital content, regardless of age, size, ability, or disability. Over the last several months, our Director of Front End Engineering, Tim Wright, has been working to resolve accessibility challenges in the new WordPress content editor, code-named Gutenberg. In addition to contributing code to the new editor, Tim joined the vendor selection committee for an <a href="https://wpcampus.org/audit/">accessibility audit sponsored by WPCampus</a>, adding agency representation to a committee largely comprised of higher education advocates. An <a href="https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vTBA7LWimbWZIGLAPmCDwefZxPK47r4fz-MeHYFfl4E5Hf2te-AjoP0ajoXiOpvMKJ1zaIk9FTyP3lV/pub?start=false&amp;loop=false&amp;delayms=3000&amp;mc_cid=de3f63f8a5&amp;mc_eid=ec68e93591&amp;slide=id.p">audit overview and update</a> were presented as part of <a href="https://online.wpcampus.org/schedule/">WPCampus Online 2019</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19940 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins/">Introducing GitHub Actions for WordPress (Plugins)</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins/" title="Introducing GitHub Actions for WordPress (Plugins)"><time datetime="2019-03-14T12:10:26-04:00">March 14, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins/#comments" class="comments-count">12 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-19943" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/github-actions-banner.png" alt="" width="1912" height="450" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner.png 1912w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner-300x71.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner-768x181.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner-800x188.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner-220x52.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/03/github-actions-banner-160x38.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1912px) 100vw, 1912px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Do you develop your WordPress plugins on GitHub? Then here’s a treat for you! We’re excited to release a GitHub Action that <a href="https://github.com/10up/actions-wordpress">deploys to the WordPress.org Plugin Repository</a> whenever you tag a new version on GitHub. You’ll be able to manage your entire development lifecycle in GitHub—no more futzing with local Bash scripts or controlling commit/push access in multiple places.</p>
<p>Keep reading for more details about GitHub Actions and how to get set up, but the gist is this: you reference our action in your plugin repo’s workflow file, filtered to only run when a tag is pushed, and set your username/password secrets. After that, each time you tag a new version on GitHub, whether by pushing a Git tag from the command line or making one using the GitHub releases interface, your plugin will be deployed to WordPress.org.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-github-actions-for-wordpress-plugins/#more-19940" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Introducing GitHub Actions for WordPress (Plugins)</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19884 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings 10ups-8th-anniversary">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10ups-8th-anniversary/">10up’s 8th Anniversary</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10ups-8th-anniversary/" title="10up’s 8th Anniversary"><time datetime="2019-02-22T13:00:26-05:00">February 22, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10ups-8th-anniversary/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-19890" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary.jpg" alt="10up&#39;s 8th anniversary." width="1300" height="420" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary.jpg 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary-300x97.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary-768x248.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary-800x258.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary-220x71.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/02/blog-header-10up-8th-anniversary-160x52.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1300px) 100vw, 1300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>10up’s eighth year saw significant team and financial growth, all while we renewed our dedication to the values of openness and ownership. Our ethos of collective ownership drove us to find creative solutions, looking beyond the short-term to consider how our ideas scale, fit into product roadmaps, or impact the overall technology stack. And through it all, we <strong>increased revenue</strong> and <strong>grew our team</strong>—each by 30%—and <strong>welcomed more than 40 new</strong> clients across industries as diverse as <strong>media, publishing, high-tech, finance, food &amp; beverage, and architecture</strong>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/10ups-8th-anniversary/#more-19884" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up’s 8th Anniversary</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19826 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects introducing-wp-acceptance">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-wp-acceptance/">Introducing WP&nbsp;Acceptance</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-wp-acceptance/" title="Introducing WP Acceptance"><time datetime="2019-01-31T17:22:07-05:00">January 31, 2019</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-wp-acceptance/#comments" class="comments-count">3 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-19828" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/WP-acceptance-banner.png" alt="Sample of successful execution of WP Acceptance." width="802" height="188" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner.png 802w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner-300x70.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner-768x180.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner-800x188.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner-220x52.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2019/01/WP-acceptance-banner-160x38.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 802px) 100vw, 802px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><strong><a href="https://github.com/10up/wpacceptance">WP Acceptance</a>—a team-centric tool we’ve built for writing reliable, scalable acceptance tests—is now available in beta</strong>. Part of our pursuit of finely crafted web experiences, we think that WP Acceptance will help ensure stable releases and fewer regressions for WordPress applications. <a href="https://wpacceptance.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#wp-acceptance">This toolkit</a> lets developers and <a href="https://www.infoworld.com/article/3271126/ci-cd/what-is-cicd-continuous-integration-and-continuous-delivery-explained.html">continuous integration (CI) pipelines</a> test codebases through version-controlled acceptance tests and sharable, defined file and database snapshots.</p>
<p><strong>We’re considering this a public beta release</strong>. It won’t adversely affect your application or introduce instability, but it has not yet been thoroughly tested as a framework and may have some bugs. Through our own testing and community involvement, we’ll further solidify WP Acceptance as it approaches a full, public release.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2019/introducing-wp-acceptance/#more-19826" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Introducing WP&nbsp;Acceptance</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-19767 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings gearing-up-for-wordcamp-us">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/gearing-up-for-wordcamp-us/">Gearing up for WordCamp&nbsp;US</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-thorsten-ott" title="Posts by Thorsten Ott" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TOtt-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TOtt-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Thorsten Ott</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/gearing-up-for-wordcamp-us/" title="Gearing up for WordCamp US"><time datetime="2018-12-04T13:00:24-05:00">December 4, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-19774" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-800x268.png" alt="WordCamp US 2018" width="650" height="218" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-800x268.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-300x101.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-768x257.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-220x74.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM-160x54.png 160w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/12/Screen-Shot-2018-12-03-at-9.32.10-PM.png 1838w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>#team10up is returning to Nashville for <a href="https://2018.us.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp US 2018</a>, the largest official WordPress conference hosted in the United States! Being part of the open-source community is a <a href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">big part of our identity</a>, and we’re especially happy to be participating in so many ways this year, from speaking, to co-sponsoring events, to facilitating and attending, we’re here to immerse ourselves and help foster a great event.</p>
<h2>Presenting</h2>
<p>Helen Hou-Sandi, our Director of Open Source Initiatives, will be speaking on Saturday, December 8th at 11 a.m. Through her work building editorial experiences in WordPress core and for 10up solutions, Helen has seen the need to innovate beyond familiar UI elements like metaboxes, which are sometimes overly relied upon. In “<a href="https://2018.us.wordcamp.org/session/metaboxes-considered-harmful/">Metaboxes Considered Harmful</a>” she’ll be reviewing some creative solutions from the past that have broken outside of the bounds of metaboxes and other form-centric interfaces while still maintaining that WordPress “feel.” She will look at practical examples where rethinking the editorial experience and interface led to significantly better outcomes for both builders and content creators alike.</p>
<p>After her talk, she’ll be at the Happiness Bar until lunch to chat and answer any questions.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/gearing-up-for-wordcamp-us/#more-19767" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Gearing up for WordCamp&nbsp;US</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19698 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-design tag-gutenberg tag-user-testing testing-the-gutenberg-publishing-userflow">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/testing-the-gutenberg-publishing-userflow/">Testing the Gutenberg Publishing Userflow</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/testing-the-gutenberg-publishing-userflow/" title="Testing the Gutenberg Publishing Userflow"><time datetime="2018-11-13T13:23:50-05:00">November 13, 2018</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/testing-the-gutenberg-publishing-userflow/#comments" class="comments-count">3 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://make.wordpress.org/design/"><b>The WordPress Design Team</b></a> recently had an in-depth conversation in <a href="https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/7602">Github</a> about <b>enhancing the publisher flow in Gutenberg</b>. After watching Gutenberg go through several iterations since <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/user-testing-gutenberg/">our last user test</a>, I decided to try testing the current flow to see how well it was received by publishers. I hoped to identify friction or pain points in the Gutenberg authoring experience in the interests of helping refine the publishing flow.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/testing-the-gutenberg-publishing-userflow/#more-19698" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Testing the Gutenberg Publishing Userflow</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19729 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects storycorps-google-doodle">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/storycorps-google-doodle/">StoryCorps and Google team up to honor veterans, with a 10up&nbsp;assist</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jay-moore" title="Posts by Jay Moore" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/JayMoore_ProfilePic-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2020/01/JayMoore_ProfilePic-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jay Moore</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/storycorps-google-doodle/" title="StoryCorps and Google team up to honor veterans, with a 10up assist"><time datetime="2018-11-11T12:46:00-05:00">November 11, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-19731 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/storycorps-google-doodle-hero.jpg" alt="StoryCorps Google Doodle" width="1154" height="540" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero.jpg 1154w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-300x140.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-768x359.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-800x374.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-220x103.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-1152x540.jpg 1152w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/11/storycorps-google-doodle-hero-160x75.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1154px) 100vw, 1154px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>We love what we do here at 10up—solving problems and creating digital experiences for our clients. The partnerships we’ve been privileged to form not only make the work more rewarding, they open doors to some really … just cool opportunities.</p>
<p><strong>Our friends at <a href="https://storycorps.org/">StoryCorps</a> are being featured on the <a href="http://www.google.com/doodles/veterans-day-2018">Google Doodle</a> today, and we <a href="https://storycorps.org/google-doodle/">designed a landing page</a> for the occasion.</strong></p>
<p>It’s our mission to make tools that enable simple and affordable digital story telling. We’ve been pleased to work with StoryCorps, and help them to “preserve and share humanity’s stories in order to build connections between people and create a more just and compassionate world.” Through our collaboration, we’re not just making the internet better, we’re making the world just a little bit better.</p>
<p>What <a href="https://10up.com/contact/">can we build together</a>?</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19614 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects distributor-wordpress-syndication-reuse">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/distributor-wordpress-syndication-reuse/">Distributor publicly released with Gutenberg support and Enterprise service offering</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/distributor-wordpress-syndication-reuse/" title="Distributor publicly released with Gutenberg support and Enterprise service offering"><time datetime="2018-08-28T12:28:05-04:00">August 28, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-19617 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/distributor-blog-post-graphic(1).jpg" alt="Distributor" width="1544" height="500" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic.jpg 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-300x97.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-768x249.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-800x259.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-220x71.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/08/distributor-blog-post-graphic-160x52.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>We are proud to announce that <strong><a href="https://distributorplugin.com/">Distributor</a> has exited beta and is now openly available</strong>. Distributor is a free WordPress plugin that makes it easy to syndicate and reuse content across your websites—whether in a single multisite network or across the web with the REST API.</p>
<p>With Distributor, content creators can “push” or “pull” content between multiple sites, while retaining updates from the original source and preserving SEO. Copy, media, metadata, and categories all come along, and our fully extensible, open-source code base empowers developers to adapt it to even the most complicated workflows. <strong>To get the release version, and enable simple updates, <a href="https://distributorplugin.com/#cta">head to DistributorPlugin.com and fill out the short registration form</a></strong>.</p>
<p>More than 100 organizations and developers participated in our <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2017/distributor-plugin/">Distributor beta program</a>. Their feedback has helped us ensure that Distributor can be the trusted solution for sharing content between WordPress sites. We’ve already integrated many improvements contributed by beta testers, including 10up clients. Distributor has been approved for use on <a href="https://vip.wordpress.com/">WordPress.com VIP</a> and is ready for enterprise implementations. We have a roadmap of planned enhancements, with ambitious plans including more advanced media distribution and sophisticated “take down” features for the forced removal of distributed content.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/distributor-wordpress-syndication-reuse/#more-19614" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Distributor publicly released with Gutenberg support and Enterprise service offering</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19539 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-fun 2018-all-hands-summit">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/2018-all-hands-summit/">2018 All Hands&nbsp;Summit</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/christinegarrison/" title="Posts by Christine Garrison" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christine Garrison</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/2018-all-hands-summit/" title="2018 All Hands Summit"><time datetime="2018-08-06T14:40:49-04:00">August 6, 2018</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/2018-all-hands-summit/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p><div class="fluid-width-video-wrapper" style="position: relative; width: 100%; padding-top: 56.3077%;"><iframe loading="lazy" width="650" height="366" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/q3b9lS5rvOc.html" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" style="position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; top: 0px;"></iframe></div></p>
<p>Kanye has nothing on 10up. Just a few days after the rapper <a href="https://pitchfork.com/features/article/what-we-saw-at-kanyes-ye-listening-party-in-wyoming/">debuted his new album near Jackson Hole, Wyoming</a>, 10uppers from all over the world descended on <a href="https://www.springcreekranch.com/">Spring Creek Ranch</a>&nbsp;for our largest All Hands Summit yet. This coming together of our team—and a few clients and partners—spanned two full days of conference-like programming, followed by another two days of team-centric activities and bonding in an inspiring setting among the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groundhog">whistle pigs</a> and prairie grasses.</p>
<p>This annual event provides an opportunity to step away from our home offices, webcams, and daily routines to inhabit a space, share insights with each other, form enduring memories, and build on a common vision for our team and clients.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/2018-all-hands-summit/#more-19539" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 2018 All Hands&nbsp;Summit</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-19461 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects simple-podcasting-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/simple-podcasting-wordpress/">Introducing Simple Podcasting</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/simple-podcasting-wordpress/" title="Introducing Simple Podcasting"><time datetime="2018-07-02T15:15:21-04:00">July 2, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-19467" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/banner-1544x500.png" alt="" width="1544" height="500" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500.png 1544w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500-300x97.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500-768x249.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500-800x259.png 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500-220x71.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/06/banner-1544x500-160x52.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1544px) 100vw, 1544px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>When a client with several podcasts expressed interest in a simple way to manage their casts from within WordPress, we began with a review of existing solutions and plugins. We quickly identified a gap between bare bones plugins supporting a single feed and complicated plugins designed for advanced workflows, such as sponsor management. To fill that void, we created <a href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/simple-podcasting/">Simple Podcasting</a>, an intuitive, lightweight, and forward looking plugin that includes <strong>beta support for Gutenberg</strong>.<a href="https://www.marketingcharts.com/industries/media-and-entertainment-82693"><br>
</a></p>
<p>Our client’s ideal user story seemed common enough: they offer several podcasts across a network of news sites, with some sites featuring multiple podcasts. They wanted to fully manage and distribute their podcast feeds inside of WordPress, albeit sometimes hosting the media itself externally. Podcasts episodes would be managed as regular posts, and appear alongside their other news, enabling visitors to play an episode right from the website or by subscribing in iTunes or any other “podcatcher.”</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/simple-podcasting-wordpress/#more-19461" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Introducing Simple Podcasting</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19474 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-aside 10upper-on-google-open-source-blog">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/10upper-on-google-open-source-blog/" title="Adam Silverstein published on Google Open Source Blog"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TOtt-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TOtt-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-thorsten-ott" title="Posts by Thorsten Ott" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Thorsten Ott</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/10upper-on-google-open-source-blog/" title="Adam Silverstein published on Google Open Source Blog"><time datetime="2018-06-29T17:49:04-04:00">June 29, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>My story about contributing to Google’s AMP project was <a href="https://opensource.googleblog.com/2018/06/contributing-to-amp-project.html">published on Google’s official Open Source Blog</a>. I received a <a href="https://opensource.googleblog.com/2016/09/google-open-source-peer-bonus-program.html">Google Open Source Peer Bonus</a> for my contribution, which <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/contributing-google-amp-project/">added MathML support</a> to&nbsp;AMP.</p>

</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19415 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-design tag-gutenberg tag-user-testing user-testing-gutenberg">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/user-testing-gutenberg/">User Testing Gutenberg</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/user-testing-gutenberg/" title="User Testing Gutenberg"><time datetime="2018-06-22T15:07:39-04:00">June 22, 2018</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/user-testing-gutenberg/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p>A new WordPress content editing experience—<a href="https://wordpress.org/gutenberg/">Gutenberg</a>—is <a href="https://wptavern.com/matt-mullenweg-unveils-gutenberg-roadmap-at-wceu-wordpress-agencies-and-product-developers-sprint-to-prepare">coming soon to WordPress core</a>, and 10up’s User Experience team is eager to understand how it will impact the experience for content creators. As a starting point, I <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/usability-test-gutenberg/">created a usability test</a> to study the experiences of professional, digital content publishers who are used to writing stories in the current editor. Building on other <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/test/2017/11/22/testing-flow-in-gutenberg/">Gutenberg usability tests</a> that focused on re-creating a prescribed layout, I instead asked professional writers to produce the same kind of content they already produce every day: write a simple story.</p>
<p>The user test asked ten participants to complete the following prompt:</p>
<p><em>Write a news-style blog post about somewhere interesting you have visited. Please include the following elements in your post:</em></p>
<ul>
<li><em>A title</em></li>
<li><em>A paragraph or two about the place</em></li>
<li><em>An image</em></li>
<li><em>An extra item such as a video or blockquote</em></li>
</ul>
<p>These tests were taken with Gutenberg 2.9.2 (the current build at the time the test was created). As of this post, the current version is 3.0.1.</p>
<p>During the unmoderated test, participants described what they were thinking as they progressed through the task. Their words and screen movements were recorded with permission.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-19428 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/userfeel_interface-e1529693329540.png" alt="Userfeel Interface" width="1301" height="671" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/user-testing-gutenberg/#more-19415" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on User Testing Gutenberg</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19259 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-design wordpress-wireframes-sketch">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordpress-wireframes-sketch/">Accelerate WordPress Wireframing with SketchPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordpress-wireframes-sketch/" title="Accelerate WordPress Wireframing with SketchPress"><time datetime="2018-06-19T06:00:08-04:00">June 19, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://www.sketchapp.com/">Sketch</a>, a digital design app for macOS, enables the the rapid creation of wireframes using libraries of symbols and and reusable design elements. 10up has extended these capabilities with <a href="https://github.com/10up/SketchPress"><b>SketchPress</b></a><b>: a library of WordPress admin interfaces, symbols, and icons</b>. When wireframing admin interfaces, SketchPress frees up our designers’ time to focus on big picture problem solving and user experience challenges, rather than the repetitive minutia of button treatments and existing page layouts.</p>
<p>Recently, SketchPress was <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/design/2018/06/07/design-meeting-notes-for-june-6-2018/">recognized as the preferred admin wireframing resource</a> by Make WordPress Design – the official core WordPress design team – and is now listed&nbsp;<a href="https://trello.com/c/6bGz7i3H/142-wordpress-admin-interface-in-sketch-10up">on their official Trello project board</a>. This endorsement validates the utility of the project while inspiring us to continue iterating. We value feedback, contribution, and adoption by the community as we seek to share high quality open-source design resources as part of our commitment to openness and giving back.</p>
<h2>Getting started with SketchPress</h2>
<p><a href="https://github.com/10up/SketchPress">Download SketchPress from GitHub</a> and open it in Sketch. You’ll see a number of pages down the left side of the interface. The first page is an introduction to the document and outlines information about what is included. If &nbsp;you plan to regularly use SketchPress, you’ll probably want to set it up in the templates folder: clone or download the repo directly into the Sketch templates folder, and you can to begin a new Sketch wireframe from the newly-saved template. Add or remove elements to begin modeling WordPress admin interfaces.</p>
<p><div class="fluid-width-video-wrapper" style="position: relative; width: 100%; padding-top: 56.3077%;"><iframe loading="lazy" width="650" height="366" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jKnsynUW5mo.html" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" style="position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; top: 0px;"></iframe></div></p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordpress-wireframes-sketch/#more-19259" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Accelerate WordPress Wireframing with SketchPress</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19351 type-post status-publish format-event hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-event wordcamp-europe-2018">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordcamp-europe-2018/">Catch 10up speakers at WordCamp Europe&nbsp;2018</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-gabe-karp" title="Posts by Gabe Karp" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2017/11/Gabe-Karp_avatar_1511804624-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Gabe Karp</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordcamp-europe-2018/" title="Catch 10up speakers at WordCamp Europe 2018"><time datetime="2018-06-14T07:30:04-04:00">June 14, 2018</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Jun</span>
14</time>

<p class="event-title">WordCamp Europe&nbsp;2018</p>

<p class="location">Belgrade</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="attending">Attending</span>
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>This week, I’ll be in Belgrade, Serbia with a few of my fellow 10uppers for <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Europe 2018</a>, Europe’s largest annual WordPress conference, which attracts more than 2,000 participants.</p>
<p>On Friday <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/speaker/adam-silverstein/">Adam Silverstein</a>, Lead Engineer and <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/adam-silverstein-wordpress-core-committer/">core committer to WordPress</a>, will present <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/session/javascript-apis-in-wordpress/">Javascript APIs in WordPress</a> at 10am. One of our newest engineers, <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/speaker/sami-keijonen/">Sami Keijonen</a>, will also co-lead a 3 hour workshop focused on <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/session/testing-web-accessibility-for-designers-developers-and-content-managers/">testing web accessibility</a>.&nbsp;We’re also co-sponsoring a networking event with WP Engine that evening. The following day, Lead Engineer <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/speaker/ben-greeley/">Ben Greely</a> will present a lightning talk: <a href="https://2018.europe.wordcamp.org/session/taming-the-wp-options-table/">Taming the WP Options Table</a>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wordcamp-europe-2018/#more-19351" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Catch 10up speakers at WordCamp Europe&nbsp;2018</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19246 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized usability-test-gutenberg">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/usability-test-gutenberg/">Usability Test: Gutenberg for Professional Writers</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/sarahjames/" title="Posts by Sarah James" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Sarah-James_avatar_1478022499-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Sarah James</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/usability-test-gutenberg/" title="Usability Test: Gutenberg for Professional Writers"><time datetime="2018-05-04T12:55:39-04:00">May 4, 2018</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/usability-test-gutenberg/#comments" class="comments-count">4 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-19248 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Gutenberg-e1525452266668.png" alt="Gutenberg content editor for WordPress" width="1301" height="593" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">The next major release of WordPress is slated to include <a href="https://wordpress.org/gutenberg/">Gutenberg</a>, a new content writing/editing experience that will change how we craft content inside of WordPress by modernizing the interface and increasing control over the layout and structure of pages and posts. 10up is actively contributing to the development of Gutenberg and is deploying it for some of our clients, and we’d like to better understand how professional content creators will perceive and adopt to the change.</p>
<p><strong>We’re conducting a professional usability study on the current build of Gutenberg.</strong> Our goal is to augment existing user testing to better understand a particular subset of the user base: professionals who write and edit relatively standard, news-style content inside of WordPress. We want to observe how this audience perceives and adjusts to this new experience by watching them use it to create some basic content. Our ideal participant has experience creating content with WordPress, and brings a reasonably fresh and unbiased experience to Gutenberg.</p>
<p>Would you like to help us?</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/usability-test-gutenberg/#more-19246" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Usability Test: Gutenberg for Professional Writers</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-19225 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects post_format-post-format-image wp-local-docker-wp-snapshots">

<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wp-local-docker-wp-snapshots/">WP Local Docker + WP&nbsp;Snapshots</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-christian-chung" title="Posts by Christian Chung" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/FullSizeRender2-e1499791877409-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2017/07/FullSizeRender2-e1499791877409-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christian Chung</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wp-local-docker-wp-snapshots/" title="WP Local Docker + WP Snapshots"><time datetime="2018-04-24T13:52:58-04:00">April 24, 2018</time></a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="250" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-1300x500.jpg" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot.jpg 1300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-300x115.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-768x295.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-800x308.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-220x85.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2018/04/snapshot-160x62.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p>At 10up, we have a history of open sourcing tools that help WordPress engineers practice their craft. One year ago, we introduced <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2017/wp-docker/">WP Local Docker</a>, a lightweight local development alternative to VVV, another popular project <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/varying-vagrant-vagrants-future/">started by 10up</a>. A more recent project, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2017/wp-snapshots-share-wordpress-setup/">WP Snapshots</a>, efficiently pushes project snapshots into the cloud.</p>
<p>As we increasingly used WP Local Docker and WP Snapshots in conjunction, we discovered some technical obstacles that could make WP Snapshots difficult to use. We realized that bundling the two projects would solve those problems and offer value to anyone already using both projects.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2018/wp-local-docker-wp-snapshots/#more-19225" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on WP Local Docker + WP&nbsp;Snapshots</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
