<article class="blog-archive-post post-18183 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside adam-silverstein-wordpress-core-committer">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/adam-silverstein-wordpress-core-committer/" title="Adam Silverstein made WordPress core committer"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/adam-silverstein-wordpress-core-committer/" title="Adam Silverstein made WordPress core committer"><time datetime="2016-11-30T11:11:39-05:00">November 30, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>Congratulations to 10up Lead Engineer <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-adam-silverstein" target="_blank">Adam Silverstein</a>, recently <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2016/11/24/new-committers/" target="_blank">made a WordPress core committer</a>!</p>
<p>With complete access to the WordPress code repository, <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/handbook/about/organization/#the-wordpress-core-team" target="_blank">core committer status</a> is not given out lightly. Through his work on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2013/08/oscar/" target="_blank">Revisions UI for WordPress 3.6</a>, <a href="https://github.com/WP-API/client-js" target="_blank">leading the recent WP API Backbone client development</a> and many more core JavaScript features, his countless <a href="http://wordpress.tv/?s=adam+silverstein" target="_blank">speaking appearances</a>, and his mentorship during WordCamp contributor days, Adam illustrated his dedication to WordPress and the 10up values of openness and community service.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-18106 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-happenings sixth-annual-summit">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/sixth-annual-summit/">Sixth Annual All Hands Summit: photographic retrospective</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/johnragozzine/" title="Posts by John Ragozzine" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/johnragozzine-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/johnragozzine-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Ragozzine</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/sixth-annual-summit/" title="Sixth Annual All Hands Summit: photographic retrospective"><time datetime="2016-11-28T11:58:19-05:00">November 28, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-18124 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/atl-skyline-e1479939327392.jpg" alt="atl-skyline" width="1600" height="1060" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Back in September, team 10up gathered in Atlanta from around the globe for four days of knowledge sharing, team building, and face-to-face time. Our days were filled with inspiring, educational presentations from our peers, while the evenings let us kick back and relax with teammates whom we normally only see on our computer screen.</p>
<p>The event began with an in-depth keynote presented by company leadership: our own 10up State of the Union. The keynote was followed by more than a dozen sessions presented by 10uppers who contributed their time and effort to share their knowledge, lessons learned, and perspective. Topics—to name a few—explored:</p>
<ul>
<li>new tools, best practices, and important concepts for engineering, user experience, and design;</li>
<li>techniques we can use to delight our clients;</li>
<li>lessons learned from projects;</li>
<li>the current and future state of content platforms and distribution;</li>
<li>ways to support more performant, effective web ads that are more profitable for publishers without sacrificing visitor engagement, and;</li>
<li>how to identify and manage impostor syndrome.</li>
</ul>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/sixth-annual-summit/#more-18106" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Sixth Annual All Hands Summit: photographic retrospective</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-18097 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects windows-azure-storage-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/windows-azure-storage-wordpress/">Reintroducing Windows Azure Storage for&nbsp;WordPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/windows-azure-storage-wordpress/" title="Reintroducing Windows Azure Storage for WordPress"><time datetime="2016-11-22T15:52:22-05:00">November 22, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>When collaborating with Microsoft, we are often responsible for making WordPress work seamlessly with Microsoft’s own offerings, including their <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/" target="_blank">Azure cloud service platform</a>. An ideal Azure hosting configuration leverages <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/#blob-storage" target="_blank">Azure Blob Storage</a> to store and deliver uploaded media assets and attachments. Microsoft’s existing, open source solution, <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/windows-azure-storage/" target="_blank">Windows Azure Storage for WordPress</a>, had been neglected for years; we stepped up to overhaul the plugin.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/windows-azure-storage/" target="_blank">4.0 release</a> addresses legacy SDK dependencies and features a refactored code base, bringing it in line with our <a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/" target="_blank">WordPress Best Practices</a>.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/windows-azure-storage-wordpress/#more-18097" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Reintroducing Windows Azure Storage for&nbsp;WordPress</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-18083 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web iab-new-ad-portfolio">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/iab-new-ad-portfolio/">IAB unveils a new Ad Unit Portfolio</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/robinwhitney/" title="Posts by Robin Whitney" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Robin-Whitney_avatar_1479223761-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/Robin-Whitney_avatar_1479223761-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Robin Whitney</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/iab-new-ad-portfolio/" title="IAB unveils a new Ad Unit Portfolio"><time datetime="2016-11-21T12:30:25-05:00">November 21, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-18085" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/new-ad-portfolio.png" alt="new-ad-portfolio" width="1040" height="331" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio.png 1040w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio-300x95.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio-768x244.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio-756x241.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio-220x70.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/new-ad-portfolio-160x51.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1040px) 100vw, 1040px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>On October 25, the <a href="https://www.iab.com/" target="_blank">Interactive Advertising Bureau</a> (IAB)—responsible for setting online ad guidelines and best practices—held a webinar to review an <a href="https://www.iab.com/newadportfolio" target="_blank">ambitious overhaul</a> of its Ad Standards Portfolio.</p>
<h2>So why the overhaul?</h2>
<p>The new portfolio of ad units aims to address concerning trends, including an increase in the <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/ios-9-content-blockers-analysis-whitepaper/" target="_blank">adoption of ad blockers</a> and <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/amp-google-publishers/" target="_blank">content delivery platforms</a> like Google AMP and Apple News that limit ad integrations. The IAB has <a href="https://www.iab.com/news/lean/" target="_blank">asserted</a> that, as publishers focused on margins and increased automation, their audiences have increasingly encountered invasive interstitials, purposefully-hidden opt-outs, auto-play videos, and recurring-ad fatigue. Sites have <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/new-years-resolutions-for-websites/" target="_blank">grown heavy</a> with extended load times often caused primarily by third-party ad servers and content discovery platforms like Outbrain and Taboola.</p>
<p>“We messed up,” <a href="https://www.iab.com/news/lean/" target="_blank">wrote</a> Scott Cunningham, Senior Vice President of Tech and Ad Ops at IAB. “As technologists tasked with delivering content and services to users, we lost track of the user experience.”</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/iab-new-ad-portfolio/#more-18083" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on IAB unveils a new Ad Unit Portfolio</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-18071 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects twenty-sixteen-react-nodeifywp">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/twenty-sixteen-react-nodeifywp/">Introducing Twenty Sixteen React and&nbsp;NodeifyWP</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/twenty-sixteen-react-nodeifywp/" title="Introducing Twenty Sixteen React and NodeifyWP"><time datetime="2016-11-16T15:17:00-05:00">November 16, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/twenty-sixteen-react-nodeifywp/#comments" class="comments-count">15 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-18075" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/twentysixteenreact.gif" alt="twentysixteenreact" width="960" height="468" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
As web technologies and mobile devices improve and global internet speeds increase, consumers increasingly expect taps and clicks to deliver results nearly instantaneously; the “app-like” experience has become an expectation in web browsers. To this end, we’ve seen huge strides forward in web platforms and frameworks.</p>
<p>Among its most notable relevant advancements, WordPress introduced a <a href="http://v2.wp-api.org/" target="_blank">JSON REST API</a>, which opens up new, compelling use cases as a framework and content storage engine, such as <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/headless-cio-review/" target="_blank">headless publishing workflows</a>. However, since WordPress runs on PHP, it can’t be used in conjunction with an important breakthrough: <strong>isomorphic applications</strong>.</p>
<p>Isomorphic web applications run the same code on the server and client (web browser), providing the flexibility, extensibility, and consistency to build the most modern “app-like” experiences on the web. JavaScript and Node.js are used to create isomorphic applications, since JavaScript runs natively in the web browser and is the foundation for server-side Node.js. (<a href="http://nerds.airbnb.com/isomorphic-javascript-future-web-apps/" target="_blank">Learn more</a>&nbsp;about isomorphic applications.)</p>
<p>Since we can’t run PHP in the web browser, we have a few options for creating JavaScript-powered “app-like” experiences in WordPress.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/twenty-sixteen-react-nodeifywp/#more-18071" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Introducing Twenty Sixteen React and&nbsp;NodeifyWP</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-18033 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-aside headless-cio-review">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/headless-cio-review/" title="Going headless"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/headless-cio-review/" title="Going headless"><time datetime="2016-11-03T14:23:33-04:00">November 3, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I recently published an article on CIO Review discussing the <a href="http://enterprise-content-management.cioreview.com/cxoinsight/should-you-go-headless-leveraging-a-headless-cms-for-modern-digital-publishing-nid-23167-cid-129.html">benefits and challenges of implementing a headless publishing workflow</a>&nbsp;to better facilitate&nbsp;cross-channel and cross-platform content distribution.</p>
<p>Traditionally, content management systems handled both the management&nbsp;of content (the “backend”) and the presentation of content to audiences (the “front end”). By going headless, content creators&nbsp;decouple site backends from front ends, enabling many&nbsp;different content presentation applications –&nbsp;websites, mobile apps, social or syndication&nbsp;channels, etc –&nbsp;to&nbsp; consume content managed in a single backend.</p>
<p>Given the benefits laid out in my article, we’re increasingly encouraging 10up clients to consider “going headless” for their&nbsp;next site builds.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17991 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized refined-message-website-design">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/refined-message-website-design/">Refining our message and&nbsp;design</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/refined-message-website-design/" title="Refining our message and design"><time datetime="2016-09-30T14:06:25-04:00">September 30, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>More than two years ago, we overhauled 10up.com to reflect the company we had become. Conceived and built entirely in-house, we strove for an experience and aesthetic that would project the craftsmanship we offer our clients. More than two years later, we think the art direction and architecture has more than withstood the test of time.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="550">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Meet the new <a href="http://t.co/8Yh4wn5rmh">http://t.co/8Yh4wn5rmh</a>. (DNS may not be ready everywhere.) <a href="http://t.co/YNb3P3w1GG">pic.twitter.com/YNb3P3w1GG</a></p>
<p>— 10up (@10up) <a href="https://twitter.com/10up/status/467098802013229056">May 16, 2014</a></p></blockquote>
<p><script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script></p>
<p>Over the last two years, our mission, message, and value proposition has evolved, presenting an opportunity to improve the way we articulate ourselves, in content and design. I’m happy to announce a site wide update that highlights our refreshed mission statement and improves the way we describe #team10up.</p>
<p>We think that our own story becomes most tangible when telling our project stories, so we’ve also taken the time to completely redesign our work portfolio.&nbsp;Our user experience and visual design team worked closely with internal stakeholders and engineers to craft a portfolio that is as visually stunning as it is functional, across screen sizes and device types.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/refined-message-website-design/#more-17991" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Refining our message and&nbsp;design</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>

<p class="author byline">

<p>September is nearly here, but you can still catch 10up engineers at speaking engagements in August.</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>August 13</strong>: Web Engineer <a href="https://fortaleza.wordcamp.org/2016/session/10up-engineering-best-practices/" target="_blank">Nícholas Andre brings our Best Practices</a> to WordCamp Fortaleza in Brazil;</li>
<li><strong>August 19</strong>: Stateside, Director of Engineering Taylor Lovett will rock Nashville’s Music City Code conference with his talk, “<a href="http://www.musiccitycode.com/schedule/wordpress-best-practices-for-enterprise" target="_blank">WordPress Best Practices for Enterprise</a>;”</li>
<li><strong>August 25</strong>: Adam Silverstein will be teaching folks in Asheville, NC <a href="https://craftpeak.com/academy/backbone-and-wordpress-rest-api/" target="_blank">how to use Backbone.js with the WordPress REST API</a> at the Craftpeak Collective. <li><strong>August 27</strong>: Two 10uppers will present a total of three talks at WordCamp Columbus! Bobby Bryant will explore <a href="https://2016.columbus.wordcamp.org/session/object-creation-patterns-in-javascript/" target="_blank">object creation patterns in JavaScript</a>. Steve Grunwell is leading two sessions: his first will explain <a href="https://2016.columbus.wordcamp.org/session/writing-wp-cli-commands-that-work/" target="_blank">how to write first-rate WP-CLI scripts</a>. Steve’s second session presents “The WordPress Way” of <a href="https://2016.columbus.wordcamp.org/session/understanding-wordpress-actions-and-filters/" target="_blank">understanding WordPress actions and filters</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/hiring-senior-project-managers/">Is 10up hiring Senior Project Managers? Yes!</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/christinegarrison/" title="Posts by Christine Garrison" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christine Garrison</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/hiring-senior-project-managers/" title="Is 10up hiring Senior Project Managers? Yes!"><time datetime="2016-07-22T12:03:33-04:00">July 22, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/hiring-senior-project-managers/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>As we continue to add <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/the-undefeated/" target="_blank">inspiring</a>, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/client-webby-winners/" target="_blank">award-winning</a> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/storycorps-google-homepage/" target="_blank">clients</a> to our roster, we <a href="http://is10uphiring.com/" target="_blank">continue</a> to expand the <a href="https://10up.com/about/#our-team" target="_blank">10up team</a>. We can’t deliver outstanding client experiences and websites without first-class project managers at the helm, so while we continue to hire across our disciplines, we’re especially focused on adding qualified <strong>Senior Project Managers</strong>. </p>
<p>If you want to work with some of the biggest brands on the web with industry leading talent, let’s talk. Start by downloading the <a href="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/07/Senior-Project-Manager_job-description.pdf">Senior Project Manager job description</a> (or read on), and visit our <a href="https://10up.com/careers/" target="_blank">Careers page</a> to learn more about working at 10up. <article class="blog-archive-post post-17776 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside phantomcss-front-porch">

<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/phantomcss-front-porch/" title="Learn better regression testing with 10up"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jonbellah-btw-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/jonbellah-btw-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/jonbellah/" title="Posts by Jon Bellah" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jon Bellah</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/phantomcss-front-porch/" title="Learn better regression testing with 10up"><time datetime="2016-07-18T12:26:25-04:00">July 18, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I’m&nbsp;presenting “<a href="http://frontporch.io/jon-bellah/" target="_blank">Visual Regression Testing with PhantomCSS</a>” at <a href="http://frontporch.io/austin/" target="_blank">Front Porch Conference</a> in Austin on Tuesday. Front Porch brings together leading experts in web design and development to share their knowledge. I&nbsp;will present a better way to QA websites—traditionally an inefficient effort requiring manual review of an entire site after each code change—illustrating how <a href="https://github.com/Huddle/PhantomCSS" target="_blank">PhantomCSS</a> test suites can automatically compare visual differences and flag changes for further review.</p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-17689 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects elasticpress-2-0">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-2-0/">Meet ElasticPress 2.0</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-2-0/" title="Meet ElasticPress 2.0"><time datetime="2016-06-03T17:03:47-04:00">June 3, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/elasticpress-square.png" alt="elasticpress-square" width="214" height="252" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>ElasticPress 2.0 is a major update, with improvements to search result weighting, expanded query parameters, and better metadata syncing.</p>
<p>Tweaks to the search algorithm’s fuzzy matching limit unwanted results (i.e. searches for “yell” previously returned results for “yeti,” since the terms are only two characters apart) while still correcting for misspellings. Results are more intelligently weighted, with documents containing all search terms boosted 2x, and another 2x boost for documents matching the order of searched terms.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-2-0/#more-17689" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Meet ElasticPress 2.0</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17654 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects the-undefeated">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/the-undefeated/">10up and ESPN launch The Undefeated</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/the-undefeated/" title="10up and ESPN launch The Undefeated"><time datetime="2016-05-24T11:58:13-04:00">May 24, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="831" height="343" class="size-full wp-image-17655 alignnone" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/tu-logo.png" alt="tu-logo" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo.png 831w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo-300x124.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo-768x317.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo-756x312.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo-220x91.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/tu-logo-160x66.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 831px) 100vw, 831px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
On May 17, 10up launched <a href="https://theundefeated.com/" target="_blank">The Undefeated</a>, the latest project&nbsp;in our longstanding partnership with ESPN. Like <a href="https://10up.com/our-work/grantland/" target="_blank">Grantland</a> and <a href="https://10up.com/our-work/fivethirtyeight/" target="_blank">FiveThirtyEight</a> before it, The Undefeated examines our world through a unique lens, exploring the intersections of race, sports, and culture&nbsp;through&nbsp;“innovative storytelling, original reporting, and provocative commentary.” We’re&nbsp;thrilled to celebrate the release of The Undefeated, which is receiving <a href="http://awfulannouncing.com/2016/undefeated-launches-glowing-early-reviews.html" target="_blank">accolades</a> and high engagement with its community feature,&nbsp;<a href="http://theundefeated.com/you-got-99-words/" target="_blank">You Got 99 Words</a>.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17531 type-post status-publish format-event hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-event phptek">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/phptek/">10up at php[tek]&nbsp;2016</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/johnragozzine/" title="Posts by John Ragozzine" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/johnragozzine-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/johnragozzine-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Ragozzine</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/phptek/" title="10up at php[tek] 2016"><time datetime="2016-05-17T12:14:03-04:00">May 17, 2016</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">May</span>
23</time>

<p class="event-title">php[tek]&nbsp;2016</p>

<p class="location">Saint Louis</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>Join 10up at <a href="https://tek.phparch.com/" target="_blank">php[tek] 2016</a> on May 23-27 in Saint Louis. We are co-sponsoring the event with our cloud infrastructure partner <a href="https://www.joyent.com/" target="_blank">Joyent</a>, and will be demoing our <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/joyent-wordpress-docker/" target="_blank">WordPress Docker composition</a>. Plus, team 10up Senior Web Engineer <a href="https://tek.phparch.com/speakers/#66432" target="_blank">Steve Grunwell</a> will present two sessions.</p>
<p>In Steve’s first talk, “Professional Development for Professional Developers,” he will show how developers can continue to learn new web development skills without being overwhelmed by an industry characterized by new frameworks and tools cropping up weekly. His second talk, “Building for the PHP Command Line Interface,” covers the characteristics of well-written <a href="http://www.php-cli.com/" target="_blank">PHP CLI</a> scripts. Steve will also make the case for writing custom commands, and provide an overview of different command line tools, including WP-CLI, Artisan, and Drush.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17587 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside wordpress-4-7-lead-helen">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-4-7-lead-helen/" title="Helen Hou-Sandi to lead WordPress 4.7"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-4-7-lead-helen/" title="Helen Hou-Sandi to lead WordPress 4.7"><time datetime="2016-05-16T15:20:06-04:00">May 16, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I am honored to be <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2016/05/12/new-lead-for-4-7-helen-hou-sandi-due/">stepping in for Matt Mullenweg as the WordPress 4.7 release lead</a>, slated to go from mid-August through early December. Being a release lead for such a big and varied project is no small task, especially since it doesn’t mean I stop being a lead developer, core committer, or 10up’s Director of Platform Experience. I previously led <a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2014/09/benny/">the 4.0 release</a> in 2014 and <a href="http://helenhousandi.com/2014/09/wordpress-4-0-an-easter-egg/">provided the background music for the video</a>&nbsp;– I might make that a tradition, following&nbsp;an upcoming piano performance for&nbsp;<a href="https://2016.europe.wordcamp.org/session/code-is-poetry-a-musicians-tale/">my WordCamp Europe 2016 talk</a> in Vienna (a city associated with composers like Mozart and Schoenberg).</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17565 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects streamline-multisite-migration">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/streamline-multisite-migration/">Streamline migrating to WordPress Multisite with MU-Migration</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-nicholas-andre" title="Posts by Nicholas Andre" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/nicholas-andre-600x600-1-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2022/06/nicholas-andre-600x600-1-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Nicholas Andre</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/streamline-multisite-migration/" title="Streamline migrating to WordPress Multisite with MU-Migration"><time datetime="2016-05-12T12:37:15-04:00">May 12, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/streamline-multisite-migration/#comments" class="comments-count">6 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-17574" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/MU_Migration_2_blue.png" alt="MU_Migration_2_blue" width="1000" height="264" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue.png 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue-300x79.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue-768x203.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue-756x200.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue-220x58.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/05/MU_Migration_2_blue-160x42.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
Migrating a standalone WordPress site to a <a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network" target="_blank">site network (or “multisite”) environment</a> is a tedious and tricky endeavor.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wordpress-importer/" target="_blank">WordPress Importer</a> works reasonably well for smaller, simpler sites, but leaves room for improvement. It exports content, but not site configuration data such as Widget and Customizer configurations, plugins, and site settings. The Importer also struggles to handle a large amount of content. Third party backup plugins that are compatible with site networks offer another solution, but they often involve slow intermediary “cloud” backup and restore steps, and the reliable solutions are mostly commercial.<br>
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/streamline-multisite-migration/#more-17565" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Streamline migrating to WordPress Multisite with MU-Migration</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17536 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside brightcove-play-2016">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/brightcove-play-2016/" title="John Eckman to be a panelist at Brightcove PLAY 2016"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/brightcove-play-2016/" title="John Eckman to be a panelist at Brightcove PLAY 2016"><time datetime="2016-05-10T12:18:08-04:00">May 10, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I will be a panelist at <a href="https://play.brightcove.com/" target="_blank">Brightcove PLAY 2016</a> on May 17 in Boston. The panel, CMS Integrations: Best Practices, will discuss integrating the Brightcove Video Cloud with popular CMS platforms like WordPress and Drupal. I will review the <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/brightcove-wordpress-plugin/" target="_blank">Brightcove Video Connect</a> plugin, which we developed as <a href="https://www.brightcove.com/en/partners/wordpress" target="_blank">Brightcove’s official WordPress development partner</a>, and present the plugin’s roadmap, which we will advance with the open source community; we opened the <a href="https://github.com/10up/brightcove-video-connect" target="_blank">Github repo</a> to the public this month.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17523 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects joyent-wordpress-docker">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/joyent-wordpress-docker/">10up partners with Joyent to bring WordPress to&nbsp;Docker</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-vasken-hauri" title="Posts by Vasken Hauri" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/VHauri-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/VHauri-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Vasken Hauri</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/joyent-wordpress-docker/" title="10up partners with Joyent to bring WordPress to Docker"><time datetime="2016-05-03T14:00:37-04:00">May 3, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/joyent-wordpress-docker/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>We’re proud to announce that <strong>10up has partnered with Joyent to bring WordPress to their Docker infrastructure</strong>.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.joyent.com/" target="_blank">Joyent</a>, an Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IAAS) company providing software to power their—and their clients’—cloud platforms, knows the difficulties in prepackaging software installations that can be readily moved across server environments. To solve this, Joyent uses <a href="https://www.docker.com/what-docker" target="_blank">Docker</a>, a technology which packages an application with all of its dependencies into a standardized unit for software development. In plain terms, it creates a fully assembled, preconfigured, and portable software environment.</p>
<p>Docker offers several practical benefits for teams building websites and applications using repeatable configurations and industry best practices like testing environments. First, as simple as the WordPress <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress#Famous_5-Minute_Install" target="_blank">famous 5-minute install</a> is, it results in a default, out-of-the-box configuration; Docker helps engineers fast forward past the remaining configuration. Second, it ensures that multiple installations (local, staging, production, separate servers) mirror each other, so as to allow worry-free code deployments. We made inroads in solving this problem with <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/varying-vagrant-vagrants-future/" target="_blank">Varying Vagrant Vagrants</a>, and Docker takes that solution a step further.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/joyent-wordpress-docker/#more-17523" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up partners with Joyent to bring WordPress to&nbsp;Docker</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17448 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web client-webby-winners">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/client-webby-winners/">10up client projects win 2016 Webby&nbsp;Awards</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/johnragozzine/" title="Posts by John Ragozzine" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/johnragozzine-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/johnragozzine-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Ragozzine</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/client-webby-winners/" title="10up client projects win 2016 Webby Awards"><time datetime="2016-04-28T14:54:37-04:00">April 28, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>The 2016 Webby Award winners were announced on Tuesday.&nbsp;Of the four&nbsp;<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/webby-nominated/" target="_blank">nominated 10up client projects</a>,&nbsp;10up is proud to announce <strong>one winner of&nbsp;the professionally selected&nbsp;Webby Award</strong>, and <strong>three winners of the People’s Voice Webby</strong>, selected by open voting.</p>
<p><a href="http://webbyawards.com/winners/2016/websites/general-website/television/amccom/" target="_blank">AMC.com</a> won both the <strong>Webby</strong> and <strong>People’s Voice</strong> awards for <strong>Website: Television</strong>.<img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-17457 alignnone" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Webby_winner_AMC_c.png" alt="Webby_winner_AMC_c" width="1000" height="264" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c.png 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c-300x79.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c-768x203.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c-756x200.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c-220x58.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_AMC_c-160x42.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><a href="http://webbyawards.com/winners/2016/websites/website-features-and-design/best-homewelcome-page/bbcamericacom/" target="_blank">BBCAmerica.com</a> won a <strong>People’s Voice Webby</strong> for <strong>Website: Best Homepage/Welcome Page</strong>.<img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-17458 alignnone" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Webby_winner_BBC_c.png" alt="Webby_winner_BBC_c" width="1000" height="264" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c.png 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c-300x79.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c-768x203.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c-756x200.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c-220x58.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_BBC_c-160x42.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>The <a href="http://webbyawards.com/winners/2016/websites/general-website/car-sites-car-culture/motortrendcom-redesign/" target="_blank">MotorTrend.com Redesign</a> won a <strong>People’s Voice Webby</strong> in <strong>Websites: Car Site &amp; Car Culture</strong>.<img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-17459 alignnone" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Webby_winner_motortrend_c.png" alt="Webby_winner_motortrend_c" width="1000" height="264" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c.png 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c-300x79.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c-768x203.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c-756x200.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c-220x58.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/Webby_winner_motortrend_c-160x42.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Congratulations to our selected clients!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17471 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-aside wordpress-4-5-1-changes">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-4-5-1-changes/" title="10up drives WordPress 4.5.1 release"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TOtt-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TOtt-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-thorsten-ott" title="Posts by Thorsten Ott" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Thorsten Ott</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-4-5-1-changes/" title="10up drives WordPress 4.5.1 release"><time datetime="2016-04-27T12:45:18-04:00">April 27, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2016/04/wordpress-4-5-1-maintenance-release/" target="_blank">WordPress 4.5.1 shipped yesterday</a>, an incremental maintenance release. Co-led by me—with commits from our Director of Platform Experience <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-helen-hou-sandi" target="_blank">Helen Hou-Sandí</a>—this release fixes 12 bugs found in the <a href="https://wordpress.org/news/2016/04/coleman/" target="_blank">last release of WordPress</a>, chief among them a Twenty Eleven theme singular class issue, visual editor incompatibility in certain versions of Chrome, and a media upload issue with the Imagick extension.&nbsp;For more information see the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Version_4.5.1" target="_blank">Codex release notes</a> or consult the <a href="https://core.trac.wordpress.org/log/branches/4.5?rev=37295&amp;stop_rev=37182" target="_blank">list of version controlled changes</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17405 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-projects webby-nominated">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/webby-nominated/">10up client projects nominated for “Best of the Internet” awards</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-64x64.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-128x128.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/webby-nominated/" title="10up client projects nominated for “Best of the Internet” awards"><time datetime="2016-04-18T16:58:37-04:00">April 18, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-17407 alignnone" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/blog_webby_main_header_2.png" alt="blog_webby_main_header_2" width="1000" height="346" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2.png 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2-300x104.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2-768x266.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2-756x262.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2-220x76.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/04/blog_webby_main_header_2-160x55.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
The <a href="https://pv.webbyawards.com/2016" target="_blank">20th Annual Webby Awards</a>, the web’s canonical awards program recognizing the best of the internet, presented their nominees last week. Nominees qualify for <a href="http://webbyawards.com/about/" target="_blank">two awards</a>: The Webby Award selected by a professional judging body, as well as The Webby People’s Voice Award, selected by an open vote that runs through April 21. Among the many <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-powers-webby-nominees/" target="_blank">WordPress-powered nominees</a>, several 10up projects are in the running.<br>
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/webby-nominated/#more-17405" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up client projects nominated for “Best of the Internet” awards</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17371 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web wordpress-powers-webby-nominees">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-powers-webby-nominees/">WordPress powers 1-in-7 Webby Nominees</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-64x64.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-128x128.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-powers-webby-nominees/" title="WordPress powers 1-in-7 Webby Nominees"><time datetime="2016-04-13T19:20:30-04:00">April 13, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>WordPress is strongly represented among the <a href="https://pv.webbyawards.com/2016" target="_blank">2016 Annual Webby Awards</a>, powering 1 of every 7 nominees in the Website categories. Nominees span 32 of the 48 categories, recognizing websites marketing major financial institutions and web apps, superstar artists and musicians, government projects, and major media and news outlets.</p>
<p>With its intuitive interface, flexible code base, and focus on democratizing content creation, we’re not surprised to see our go-to CMS solution owning such a respectable percentage of the pack. 10up believes in open technology and we’re glad to see platforms such as WordPress in such high use.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wordpress-powers-webby-nominees/#more-17371" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on WordPress powers 1-in-7 Webby Nominees</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17363 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-around-the-web tag-community tag-contributing tag-wordpress post_format-post-format-aside 10up-wordpress-4-5-contributors">

<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/10up-wordpress-4-5-contributors/" title="Team 10up WordPress 4.5 contributors"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">

</p>

More than a dozen 10uppers made this release possible, most notably Adam Silverstein, <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2016/01/07/wordpress-4-5-deputies/" target="_blank">who served as Release Deputy</a>.</p>
<p>Thank you for helping make WordPress: David Brumbaugh, Drew Jaynes (emeritus), Dreb Bits, Faishal Saiyed, Helen Hou-Sandí, Josh Levinson, Lukas Pawlik, Pete Nelson, Ricky Lee Whittemore, Ryan Welcher, Scott Kingsley Clark, Steve Grunwell, and Sudar Muthu!</p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-17283 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects wp-hammer-secure-wordpress-data">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wp-hammer-secure-wordpress-data/">Clean up and secure WordPress data with WP&nbsp;Hammer</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/ivan-kruchkoff/" title="Posts by Ivan Kruchkoff" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Ivan-Kruckkoff-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Ivan-Kruckkoff-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Ivan Kruchkoff</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wp-hammer-secure-wordpress-data/" title="Clean up and secure WordPress data with WP Hammer"><time datetime="2016-04-05T12:07:06-04:00">April 5, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>When making copies of a website for development and testing, populating a thorough content and data set is vital for Quality Assurance (QA). The most efficient path typically involves mirroring the entire production site’s database. But this can be problematic: a large site can have tens of thousands of posts (each with many revisions and healthy doses of metadata) and many user accounts.</p>
<p>Those user accounts (and sometimes the site’s content) can contain sensitive data that, if mishandled, can put clients at risk. On top of that, testing, development, and initial imports—often executed on lightweight virtual machines—can be painfully slow when working with very large datasets. Cleaning up imported production data is a must, but has been a tedious, inefficient task.</p>
<p><strong>Enter 10up’s <a href="https://github.com/10up/wp-hammer" target="_blank">WP Hammer</a>: an open source developer tool that quickly and efficiently reduces—or completely removes—production data and sensitive client information</strong> like email addresses and hashed account passwords from a WordPress installation.<br>
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/wp-hammer-secure-wordpress-data/#more-17283" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Clean up and secure WordPress data with WP&nbsp;Hammer</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17231 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside team-10up-giving">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/team-10up-giving/" title="Team 10up pays it forward"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/johnragozzine-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/johnragozzine.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/johnragozzine/" title="Posts by John Ragozzine" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Ragozzine</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/team-10up-giving/" title="Team 10up pays it forward"><time datetime="2016-03-24T12:10:35-04:00">March 24, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>In 2014, we instituted <a href="https://www.rocketrip.com/" target="_blank">Rocketrip</a>, so that 10uppers could earn points for shared savings on business travel. These points could be redeemed for rewards like gift card and donations. Earlier this year, after we decided to sunset the program, our team had a few weeks to redeem their points.</p>
<p><strong>Something wonderful happened.</strong> A few of us decided to pool our points for a group charitable gift, spurring <em>dozens</em> of other 10uppers to donate their points to the pool. This week, we donated to <a href="http://girlswhocode.com/" target="_blank">Girls Who Code</a> – whose mission is to close the gender gap in technology and engineering. We’re proud to support an organization consistent with our values, practices, and culture.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17212 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized facebook-instant-articles-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/facebook-instant-articles-wordpress/">12 Facebook Instant Articles insights for WordPress content creators</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/facebook-instant-articles-wordpress/" title="12 Facebook Instant Articles insights for WordPress content creators"><time datetime="2016-03-22T12:30:28-04:00">March 22, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/facebook-instant-articles-wordpress/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-17227" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Instant-Articles-—-Hero.jpg" alt="Facebook Instant Articles" width="1518" height="741" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero.jpg 1518w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero-300x146.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero-768x375.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero-756x369.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero-220x107.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Instant-Articles-—-Hero-160x78.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 1518px) 100vw, 1518px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">On <a href="http://media.fb.com/2016/02/17/opening-up-instant-articles/" target="_blank">April 12</a>, Facebook is expanding their in-app <a href="https://instantarticles.fb.com/" target="_blank">Instant Articles</a> program—which delivers lightweight, instantly loading articles—to all publishers. All content creators, from enterprises posting corporate news to your neighbor’s food blog, can start taking advantage of the benefits of Facebook Instant Articles to maximize engagement with <a href="https://zephoria.com/top-15-valuable-facebook-statistics/" target="_blank">Facebook’s 1.5 billion users</a>.</p>
<p>We see Instant Articles as another step toward the content management system (CMS) as the hub for creating and delivering content. Content creators are distributing to many interfaces and channels: HTML/CSS front ends, mobile apps, third party sites, Google AMP, Apple News feeds…even <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/web-to-print-open-source/" target="_blank">print publications</a>! <strong>Rapidly evolving content distribution punctuates the benefits of an open and well-maintained CMS.</strong> WordPress adopters can rapidly benefit from channels like AMP and Instant Articles thanks to quickly released and well supported open source modules, circumventing the development overhead of a home grown platform or the long roadmap of a niche commercial CMS, and without surrendering their content to closed platforms like Medium.</p>
<p>Seamless integrations with platforms like Instant Articles is why 10up so fervently advocates for WordPress and the open web. And so, upon Facebook’s 12th anniversary, here are 12 key insights for publishers using WordPress and preparing for Facebook Instant Articles.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/facebook-instant-articles-wordpress/#more-17212" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 12 Facebook Instant Articles insights for WordPress content creators</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>

</p>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-17112 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web category-fun simple-page-ordering-pluginmadness">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/simple-page-ordering-pluginmadness/">Simple Page Ordering competes in Torque Mag’s #PluginMadness</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jaimee-ratliff" title="Posts by Jaimee Ratliff" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jaimee-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/07/jaimee-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jaimee Ratliff</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/simple-page-ordering-pluginmadness/" title="Simple Page Ordering competes in Torque Mag’s #PluginMadness"><time datetime="2016-03-01T15:49:17-05:00">March 1, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-17114" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo.jpg" alt="Torque Plugin Madness Logo" width="931" height="448" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo.jpg 931w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo-300x144.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo-768x370.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo-756x364.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo-220x106.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/03/Torque-Plugin-Madness-Logo-160x77.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 931px) 100vw, 931px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Torque, a news site dedicated to WordPress professionals, has launched <a href="http://torquemag.io/2016/02/introducing-torques-2016-plugin-madness-competition/" target="_blank">2016 Plugin Madness</a>: 64 of the most popular WordPress plugins from the official directory will compete for the champion title.</p>
<p>10up’s <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/simple-page-ordering/" target="_blank">Simple Page Ordering</a>, built by none other than our Founder, has been recognized as one of the most in-demand plugins, and selected as a top contender. &nbsp;Simple Page Ordering simplifies ordering of pages (and other post types) by adding drag and drop positioning to the backend page list. Torque has randomly assigned its selected plugins to brackets across four regions: <strong>Pressers</strong> (which includes our plugin), <strong>Wordees</strong>, <strong>Extenders</strong> and <strong>Installers</strong>. In NCAA March Madness bracket style, plugins will be narrowed down through rounds of voting, beginning with 64 entrants. Voting happens every week over at <a href="http://www.pluginmadness.com/" target="_blank">pluginmadness.com</a>.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17058 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-projects elasticpress-woocommerce-plugin">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-woocommerce-plugin/">Supercharge WooCommerce performance and search with ElasticPress WooCommerce</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-woocommerce-plugin/" title="Supercharge WooCommerce performance and search with ElasticPress WooCommerce"><time datetime="2016-02-22T14:47:28-05:00">February 22, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-woocommerce-plugin/#comments" class="comments-count">6 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter wp-image-17069 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/elasticpress-woocommerce-1.png" alt="elasticpress-woocommerce" width="3200" height="1050" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1.png 3200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1-300x98.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1-768x252.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1-756x248.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1-220x72.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/elasticpress-woocommerce-1-160x53.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 3200px) 100vw, 3200px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><br>
<a href="https://www.woothemes.com/woocommerce/" target="_blank">WooCommerce</a> is the world’s most popular e-commerce software, available as a free WordPress plugin. Its expansive extensions library houses a number of premium extensions addressing recurring payments, different payment gateways, shipment tracking tools, and more.</p>
<p>Scaling open source e-commerce solutions like WooCommerce, that can be installed on infrastructures of all shapes and sizes,&nbsp;is&nbsp;challenging. Online stores&nbsp;typically require intensive database transactions: complex queries on both the front and back-end that filter and sort products based on several categories, stock, and properties like pricing and reviews.</p>
<p>Further, most shoppers depend on site search to find products. Complex filters combined with keyword search across fields heavily tax relational databases like MySQL, the underlying database used by WordPress. And of course, increased store traffic increases the number of database queries to process, making every transaction even slower. Not surprisingly, many WooCommerce sites run quite slowly.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/elasticpress-woocommerce-plugin/#more-17058" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Supercharge WooCommerce performance and search with ElasticPress WooCommerce</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-17019 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-fun post_format-post-format-image 5-year-anniversary">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/5-year-anniversary/">5 Down: 10up’s Fifth&nbsp;Year</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/5-year-anniversary/" title="5 Down: 10up’s Fifth Year"><time datetime="2016-02-12T13:21:35-05:00">February 12, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/5-year-anniversary/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="304" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/10upis5.gif" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p>Our origin story is modest: just five years ago, 10up began with a single individual working in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhode_Island" target="_blank">smallest U.S. state</a> and a portfolio containing fewer clients than there were Star Wars movies at the time.</p>
<p>Since then, 10up has matured at a much faster pace than your average agency. We’ve continued to grow our team <strong>by ~30%, welcoming dozens of new 10uppers across Project Management, Web Strategy, Engineering, Design, Revenue, and User Experience</strong>. Financials also continue to thrive; <strong>in the first month of 2016</strong>, we saw <strong>more revenue than our first two years combined</strong> (and more than half of what we did in our third year).</p>
<p>But here at 10up, we value more than revenue and growth statistics—it’s about nurturing the culture within, providing our team the resources to achieve peak performance—a sense of community, a pride of ownership, and material benefits for a team that is building a future together, not merely cashing in a paycheck.</p>
<p>In 2015, we hosted our biggest <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/annual-summit-boulder/" target="_blank">All Hands Summit</a>, practically taking over a hotel in Boulder for a 10up-only conference with sessions exploring our business goals, emerging and important technologies, and the latest tactics for effective project management, with a healthy dose of team building. We even hosted an awards ceremony: The First Annual Uppies – a tradition is born.</p>
<p>As we continue to strive for the very best consulting experience in the publishing and content management space, here are just a few accomplishments since our <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/4up-birthday/" target="_blank">last birthday</a>:</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/5-year-anniversary/#more-17019" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 5 Down: 10up’s Fifth&nbsp;Year</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-16976 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web amp-google-publishers">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/amp-google-publishers/">What Google’s Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) means for consumers, publishers, and the&nbsp;future</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/amp-google-publishers/" title="What Google’s Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) means for consumers, publishers, and the future"><time datetime="2016-02-10T17:20:50-05:00">February 10, 2016</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/amp-google-publishers/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p>We now spend more time on mobile gadgets than on desktop devices. The mobile web experience is more important than ever, and overwhelmingly defined by content relevancy, timeliness, and above all, speediness.</p>
<p>Mindful web developers—given adequate budget allowances—strive to build mobile-first sites that provide lean, engaging experiences across different screen sizes and devices. These sites better retain their audience because the experience is enjoyable and, in some cases, because impatient readers will leave (“bounce”) rather than wait for a clunky web page. Because Google recognizes its customers’ preference for performant sites, it factors pagespeed into its search algorithm, boosting speedy sites in search results.</p>
<p>In spite of these incentives to minimize page weight, most websites are <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/new-years-resolutions-for-websites/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">heavier than ever</a>. High resolution displays ushered in huge images, and universal support for custom typography has us downloading fonts everywhere. While the renaissance in front end toolkits like jQuery and React.js eases development and alleviates server-side scaling, it has done so at the expense of pushing more assets and processor strain to the browser. Most problematically, today’s website monetization and measurement tools often deliver heavy (and invasive) ads with little incentive to improve.</p>
<p>Much of this “bloat” has been obfuscated by our increasingly powerful devices, improving mobile broadband connections (especially among the “creative” class), and increasingly competitive browser technology. Even so, publishers are clearly testing (or even lazily trampling) acceptable boundaries, creating an opening for ethically gray solutions like <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/ios-9-content-blockers-analysis-whitepaper/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">iOS 9’s content blockers</a>, and more closed platforms like Apple News.</p>
<p><strong>Enter the <a href="https://www.ampproject.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) project</a></strong>: an open source initiative based on existing open web standards led by Google, touting noble intentions to improve the mobile web experience by providing standardized, lightweight guidelines and tools for developers. AMP HTML versions of web pages trade complex functionality and capabilities for lightness, simplicity, and a focus on content, resulting in near instant load times.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-16978" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM.png" alt="Accelerated Mobile Pages" width="2396" height="1418" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM.png 2396w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-300x178.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-768x455.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-756x447.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-210x124.png 210w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-292x172.png 292w, https://10up.com/uploads/2016/02/Screen-Shot-2016-02-10-at-3.29.39-PM-152x90.png 152w" sizes="(max-width: 2396px) 100vw, 2396px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>While there may be more transformative long-term potential for AMP as a framework, in the near-term, Google’s initiative is hyper-focused on improving news and media consumption. In essence, AMP competes with the self-contained, largely closed, and far more restrictive experiences offered by <a href="http://www.apple.com/news/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Apple News</a>, <a href="https://instantarticles.fb.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Facebook Instant Articles</a>, and the <a href="http://www.adweek.com/socialtimes/longform-tweets-twitter-to-bump-character-limit-from-140-to-10000/632404" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">rumored “long-form format” coming to Twitter</a> (among others). Publishers opting to offer AMP’s lean presentation will be rewarded with increased visibility in mobile search results for news, including Google’s News Carousel: the highly coveted positioning at the top of mobile search results.</p>
<p>Backed by Google and already in&nbsp;<a href="https://www.ampproject.org/docs/support/faqs.html#who-will-be-able-to-use-accelerated-mobile-pages" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">beta testing with some of the largest news organizations</a>, AMP is poised to become a standard feature for content-centric websites.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/amp-google-publishers/#more-16976" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on What Google’s Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) means for consumers, publishers, and the&nbsp;future</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-16713 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized new-years-resolutions-for-websites">

<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/new-years-resolutions-for-websites/">New Year’s Resolutions for&nbsp;Websites</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/taylor/" title="Posts by Taylor Dewey" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TDewey-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/TDewey-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Dewey</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/new-years-resolutions-for-websites/" title="New Year’s Resolutions for Websites"><time datetime="2016-01-11T14:45:51-05:00">January 11, 2016</time></a>
</p>
<p>Each year people around the world make New Year’s resolutions to lose weight, exercise, and to get organized.&nbsp;The same resolutions that can make you a better person can also be applied to your website. Here are some 2016 resolutions for your website.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2016/new-years-resolutions-for-websites/#more-16713" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on New Year’s Resolutions for&nbsp;Websites</span></a></p>
