<article class="blog-archive-post post-14925 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized wanted-project-and-account-managers-reward-for-capture">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wanted-project-and-account-managers-reward-for-capture/">Wanted: Project and Account Managers, Reward for&nbsp;Capture</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/christinegarrison/" title="Posts by Christine Garrison" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christine Garrison</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wanted-project-and-account-managers-reward-for-capture/" title="Wanted: Project and Account Managers, Reward for Capture"><time datetime="2015-06-12T16:03:51-04:00">June 12, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p>10up is widely known for the complex and unique web experiences we produce. We consistently create unparalleled experiences for our clients and while engineering and design is a large part of that, senior project and account management talent are critical to the success of 10up and its clients.</p>
<p>In an effort to thank you for helping us find our next 10upper, we’ll offer you a finders fee of $500 if we decide to hire who you referred. We’ll even go a step further and throw in an additional $500 when they complete a successful 6 month review just to show our appreciation.</p>
<p>We have a <a href="https://10up.com/about/">talented team of strategists</a> consulting with enterprise clients, leading our engineers and designers, coordinating site launches, and resourcing/planning/managing some pretty <a href="https://10up.com/our-work/techcrunch/">exciting projects</a> – and better yet, we are looking to expand the team!</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wanted-project-and-account-managers-reward-for-capture/#more-14925" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Wanted: Project and Account Managers, Reward for&nbsp;Capture</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14898 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances 10up-at-wordcamp-philly">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-philly/">10up at WordCamp Philly</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-philly/" title="10up at WordCamp Philly"><time datetime="2015-06-11T12:08:09-04:00">June 11, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p>Once again, 10up is&nbsp;back for <a href="https://philly.wordcamp.org/2015/" target="_blank">WordCamp Philly</a>! This year, co-organizer and 10upper extraordinaire Doug Stewart will be joined by John Eckman, Allen Moore, and myself as speakers.</p>
<p>On Saturday morning, I’ll be presenting “<a href="https://philly.wordcamp.org/2015/session/user-first-approaches-to-apis-2/" target="_blank">User-First Approaches to APIs</a>“, which will touch on what we mean by users, what it means to be a maintainer, and the excitement of a potential fields API in WordPress.</p>
<p>Right after that,&nbsp;Allen will be presenting “<a href="https://philly.wordcamp.org/2015/session/a-need-for-speed-performance-driven-front-end-development/" target="_blank">A Need For Speed: Performance Driven Front End Development</a>,” focused on how front end performance affects User Engagement and Experience; best practices for performance driven front end development; and tools to measure front end performance.</p>
<p>Then &nbsp;John will take us into lunch with “<a href="https://philly.wordcamp.org/2015/session/getting-outside-the-wordpress-bubble/" target="_blank">Getting outside the WordPress bubble</a>“, a topic perfect for&nbsp;somebody with deep experiences with other CMS’s and their communities (including commits to Drupal 8!), as well as other communities at large.</p>
<p>WordCamp Philly holds a special place in 10up history, as the place where <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2011/jake-helen-take-wordcamp-philly-2011/">I first met Jake in 2011</a> and began my time as an <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2013/giving-back-to-wordpress/">agency-backed core contributor to WordPress</a>. Doug even found this photo from that 2011 contributor day in the&nbsp;archives! We’re really excited about all of the great talks scheduled for Saturday, and what’s sure to be another fantastic contributor day on Sunday.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-14910" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/IMG_1993.jpg" alt="WordCamp Philly 2011" width="800" height="600" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993-300x225.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993-768x576.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993-756x567.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993-165x124.jpg 165w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/06/IMG_1993-120x90.jpg 120w" sizes="(max-width: 800px) 100vw, 800px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14805 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized sliders-rotators-carousels">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/sliders-rotators-carousels/">Sliders, Rotators, and Carousels — Oh&nbsp;no!</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/taylor/" title="Posts by Taylor Dewey" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TDewey-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/TDewey-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Dewey</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/sliders-rotators-carousels/" title="Sliders, Rotators, and Carousels — Oh no!"><time datetime="2015-06-01T13:00:02-04:00">June 1, 2015</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/sliders-rotators-carousels/#comments" class="comments-count">4 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>There is <a href="http://conversionxl.com/dont-use-automatic-image-sliders-or-carousels-ignore-the-fad/">evidence</a>&nbsp;to indicate that sliders (or rotators or carousels) are generally ineffective.&nbsp;Engagement with the second slide is precipitously low and engagement with the third slide is near negligible.&nbsp;Assuming visitors see it at all.</p>
<blockquote><p>As an adaptation to information overload, web users have trained themselves to divert their attention away from areas that seem unimportant or look like advertising.<br>
<cite>—Hoa Loranger, NNGroup</cite></p></blockquote>
<p>Although Loranger was summarizing a study about right-rail blindness, NNGroup has done previous <a href="http://www.nngroup.com/articles/auto-forwarding/">examinations of sliders</a> and found a similar effect. <a href="http://erikrunyon.com/2013/01/carousel-stats/">Notre Dame university also studied sliders</a> on their home page and found only 1% of visitors interacted with it at all.</p>
<p>Finally, these interfaces often have usability concerns: microscopic control buttons, odd mobile/touch behavior, and the removal of visitors’ control.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/sliders-rotators-carousels/#more-14805" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Sliders, Rotators, and Carousels — Oh&nbsp;no!</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14871 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside 10up-at-wordcamp-miami">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-miami/" title="10up at WordCamp Miami"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TOtt-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TOtt-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-thorsten-ott" title="Posts by Thorsten Ott" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Thorsten Ott</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-miami/" title="10up at WordCamp Miami"><time datetime="2015-05-30T10:25:54-04:00">May 30, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>There will be several 10uppers presenting this weekend at <a href="http://miami.wordcamp.org/2015">WordCamp Miami</a> — Taylor Lovett will be <a href="https://miami.wordcamp.org/2015/session/modernizing-wordpress-search-with-elasticsearch/">presenting</a> on the ins and outs of using Elasticsearch and ElasticPress to make WordPress’ search great, Chris Wiegman will be <a href="https://miami.wordcamp.org/2015/session/how-to-take-your-wordpress-site-security-to-the-next-level/">talking</a> about securing your WordPress installs, and I will be <a href="https://miami.wordcamp.org/2015/session/dev-like-you-mean-it-using-vagrant-to-take-your-development-to-the-next-level/">chatting</a> about making Vagrant a greater part of your development workflow.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14742 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances tag-elasticpress tag-elasticsearch tag-speaking tag-wordcamp post_format-post-format-aside wordcamp-nashville-maine-2015">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wordcamp-nashville-maine-2015/" title="10up at WordCamp Nashville and WordCamp Maine this weekend"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wordcamp-nashville-maine-2015/" title="10up at WordCamp Nashville and WordCamp Maine this weekend"><time datetime="2015-05-15T21:23:34-04:00">May 15, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>This Saturday, I will be presenting “Modernizing WordPress Search with Elasticsearch,” focused on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/meet-elasticpress/">ElasticPress</a>,&nbsp;at <a href="https://nashville.wordcamp.org/2015/">WordCamp Nashville</a>.&nbsp;10up’er Zack Rothauser will also be in attendance.</p>
<p>Up in New England at <a href="https://maine.wordcamp.org/2015/">WordCamp Maine</a>, CEO John Eckman presents,&nbsp;“The Four Agreements and Client Services,” covering core tenets from&nbsp;the popular self-help book (The Four Agreements). Jason Clarke and Jason Boyle will also be attending.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14571 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-around-the-web category-happenings markup-css-best-practices">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/markup-css-best-practices/">Markup, CSS, and Project Structure Best Practices</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/markup-css-best-practices/" title="Markup, CSS, and Project Structure Best Practices"><time datetime="2015-04-29T16:52:07-04:00">April 29, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-14688 size-large" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-756x340.png" alt="front end standards" width="650" height="292" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-756x340.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-300x135.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-768x346.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-220x99.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674-160x72.png 160w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/Screen-Shot-2015-04-29-at-2.46.54-PM-e1430340519674.png 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>We’re proud to announce the&nbsp;release of&nbsp;<a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/markup">Markup</a>, <a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/css">CSS</a>, and <a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/structure">Project Structure</a> sections for&nbsp;our <a href="https://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/">Engineering Best Practices</a>.</p>
<p>When it comes to <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cascading_Style_Sheets">CSS</a>&nbsp;and Markup, our industry offers a&nbsp;vast landscape of choices and philosophies, illustrated by the number of&nbsp;frameworks&nbsp;and&nbsp;preprocessors&nbsp;available. While our Front End Engineering team always&nbsp;pushes the boundaries of these platforms, our Best Practices set a&nbsp;standard&nbsp;bar for the techniques, functionality, tools, and libraries we use.</p>
<p>As we focus on practical business application of technology, our philosophies are guided by a mandate to ensure&nbsp;consistent, reliable, and predictable experiences for website visitors. Many CSS attributes and HTML5 features are amazing, but are also&nbsp;dependent on&nbsp;unreliable <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polyfill">polyfills</a> for compatibility&nbsp;with some&nbsp;popular web browsers. In addition to avoiding known technical pitfalls, standardizing&nbsp;our tools, style, and&nbsp;structure improves efficiency, collaboration, and overall quality of work.</p>
<p>Consistent with our <a href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">support for an open web</a>, our Engineering Best Practices are open and <a href="https://github.com/10up/Engineering-Best-Practices">available on Github</a>. We encourage any and all contributions!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14607 type-post status-publish format-image hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-image annual-summit-boulder">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/annual-summit-boulder/">2015 Annual Summit: Boulder</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/annual-summit-boulder/" title="2015 Annual Summit: Boulder"><time datetime="2015-04-24T20:46:30-04:00">April 24, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-14619 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/IMG_4989-e1429922048660.jpg" alt="Boulder" width="2048" height="983" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660.jpg 2048w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660-300x144.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660-768x369.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660-756x363.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660-220x106.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/IMG_4989-e1429922048660-160x77.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 2048px) 100vw, 2048px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>Every year, around&nbsp;this time, our distributed&nbsp;team&nbsp;gets together&nbsp;for a few days&nbsp;to focus on&nbsp;developing our soft and technical skills, to&nbsp;celebrate our past and plan for&nbsp;our future.&nbsp;The 2015 summit is&nbsp;next week at&nbsp;a beautiful hotel in downtown Boulder, Colorado. It begins Monday&nbsp;afternoon with an optional tour of the <a href="http://www.celestialseasonings.com/tours">Celestial Tea Factory</a> and a mouth-watering prefixed dinner catering to&nbsp;myriad&nbsp;10up diets. Our summit ends on Thursday&nbsp;night, with most 10uppers&nbsp;traveling home on Friday.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/annual-summit-boulder/#more-14607" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 2015 Annual Summit: Boulder</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14538 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances wordcamp-minneapolis">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wordcamp-minneapolis/">Keynoting WordCamp Minneapolis</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-64x64.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-128x128.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/wordcamp-minneapolis/" title="Keynoting WordCamp Minneapolis"><time datetime="2015-04-23T08:56:49-04:00">April 23, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="http://minneapolis.wordcamp.org/2015/"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright wp-image-14550" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls.jpeg" alt="wc-mnpls" width="272" height="272" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls.jpeg 400w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls-150x150.jpeg 150w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls-300x300.jpeg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls-124x124.jpeg 124w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls-336x336.jpeg 336w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/wc-mnpls-90x90.jpeg 90w" sizes="(max-width: 272px) 100vw, 272px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>This weekend I’ll be giving the (very early!) keynote at <a title="WordCamp Minneapolis" href="http://minneapolis.wordcamp.org/2015/" target="_blank">WordCamp Minneapolis</a>, &nbsp;on “<a title="Building Software, Building Community" href="http://minneapolis.wordcamp.org/2015/session/keynote-building-software-building-community/" target="_blank">Building Software, Building Community</a>.” &nbsp;I’ll be talking about the really unique opportunity WordPress presents as a platform and a community capable of changing your own career &nbsp;– and potentially the world.</p>
<p>I’m very much looking forward to my first WordCamp in the twin cities, which has a special meaning for me since&nbsp;the&nbsp;venue is less than 10 miles from where I lived through all &nbsp;of middle school, junior high, and high school.</p>
<p>The <a title="WordCamp Minneapolis Schedule" href="http://minneapolis.wordcamp.org/2015/schedule/" target="_blank">schedule</a> is impressive: a full day of four tracks on Saturday plus two tracks on Sunday, plus an after party Saturday night and brunch on Sunday.</p>
<p>If you’re attending, and are interested in learning more about 10up or working with us (as an employee, partner, or client)&nbsp;I’d be happy to chat with you.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14502 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web post_format-post-format-image net-magazine-seeks-expertise-on-wordpress-themes">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/net-magazine-seeks-expertise-on-wordpress-themes/">10up expertise in Net Magazine’s latest cover&nbsp;story</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/coreyellis/" title="Posts by Corey Ellis" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a07921f8459fb03423b58b013aa354fc?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a07921f8459fb03423b58b013aa354fc?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Corey Ellis</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/net-magazine-seeks-expertise-on-wordpress-themes/" title="10up expertise in Net Magazine’s latest cover story"><time datetime="2015-04-21T15:09:52-04:00">April 21, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="419" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey.jpg" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey.jpg 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey-300x194.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey-768x495.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey-756x488.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey-192x124.jpg 192w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/netmag-corey-140x90.jpg 140w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p><a title="10up in Net Magazine" href="http://www.creativebloq.com/web-design/craft-perfect-wordpress-themes-new-issue-net-magazine-41514708"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-full wp-image-14523" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/corey-netmag.jpg" alt="Corey in NetMag" width="162" height="259" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/corey-netmag.jpg 162w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/corey-netmag-78x124.jpg 78w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/04/corey-netmag-56x90.jpg 56w" sizes="(max-width: 162px) 100vw, 162px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">Net Magazine’s latest cover story</a> details 8 “dos and don’ts” for architecting WordPress themes with&nbsp;best practices and&nbsp;an eye towards maintainability. In this article, I&nbsp;cover the WordPress template hierarchy and <em>the loop</em>, foundational concepts necessary to&nbsp;build and understand WordPress themes. A few 10up clients, <a href="http://hmclause.com/">like H.M.Clause</a>, also get shout outs.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.creativebloq.com/net-magazine">Net Magazine</a>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;20-year-old publication for professional and amateur web designers and developers; having&nbsp;published&nbsp;insights and stories&nbsp;from 10uppers in the past, they’ve come to&nbsp;recognize 10up as an expert resource.</p>
<p>Past contributions by 10up include <a href="http://www.creativebloq.com/netmag/issue-258-81412615">Eric Mann’s strategy for&nbsp;featuring rich graphical media</a> in a WordPress site without sacrificing page performance, and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.creativebloq.com/netmag/discover-wordpress-40s-new-features-latest-net-magazine-91412924">Eric’s preview of WordPress 4.0</a> with contributions from Helen Hou-Sandi.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14427 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-image scaling-storycorps-wordpress-json-api">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/scaling-storycorps-wordpress-json-api/">Scaling StoryCorps.me and the WP JSON&nbsp;API</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/scaling-storycorps-wordpress-json-api/" title="Scaling StoryCorps.me and the WP JSON API"><time datetime="2015-03-31T21:50:31-04:00">March 31, 2015</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/scaling-storycorps-wordpress-json-api/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="410" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM.png" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM.png 873w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM-300x189.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM-768x484.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM-756x476.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM-197x124.png 197w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-31-at-6.49.16-PM-143x90.png 143w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p>We had the privilege of working with <a href="http://storycorps.org/">StoryCorps</a> to help them engineer&nbsp;a reliable, scalable WordPress implementation for their new, TED prize winning&nbsp;project.&nbsp;StoryCorps.me enables anyone to record&nbsp;and share powerful stories&nbsp;using&nbsp;an iOS and Android app; the app’s infrastructure is built on WordPress, and leverages the&nbsp;<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/json-rest-api/">WP REST API</a>.</p>
<p>We&nbsp;built a custom, elastic infrastructure on Amazon Web Services, provided&nbsp;strategic consulting and direction&nbsp;for the WordPress JSON API integration with the app, and comprehensive code review&nbsp;and auditing for the custom theme and plugins built by StoryCorps’s internal developers.</p>
<p>Even as the app was unveiled at TED, and&nbsp;picked up in&nbsp;subsequent press coverage from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.npr.org/2015/03/18/393748277/a-new-smartphone-app-expands-the-reach-of-storycorps">NPR</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fastcoexist.com/3043836/storycorps-wins-the-ted-prize-and-builds-an-app-that-lets-anyone-record-an-interview-on-thei">Fast Company</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://recode.net/2015/03/17/storycorps-using-1-million-ted-prize-to-become-an-app-and-go-global/">Recode</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/british-columbia/ted-prize-winner-to-use-award-to-expand-oral-history-project-globally/article23514273/">the Globe and Mail</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.forbes.com/sites/randalllane/2015/03/17/with-one-new-app-the-entire-worlds-oral-history-is-about-to-go-viral/">Forbes</a>, to name a few, the site and its deep app integrations have&nbsp;scaled and performed like a champ.</p>
<p><a href="https://poststatus.com/how-storycorps-uses-wordpress-to-enable-storytelling-everywhere/">PostStatus published a detailed,&nbsp;insightful write up</a> that describes the project&nbsp;and technical implementation, including kind words from&nbsp;their program manager:</p>
<blockquote><p>Dean noted, “You have to be willing to completely submit to the process.” He says it wouldn’t have succeeded if 10up and [app developer] Maya weren’t committed as StoryCorps to the success of the project.</p></blockquote>
<p>Be sure to <a href="https://poststatus.com/how-storycorps-uses-wordpress-to-enable-storytelling-everywhere/">check out their coverage</a>, and try out <a href="http://storycorps.me/">StoryCorps.me</a>. You can find the&nbsp;app that relies on their WordPress build&nbsp;on the <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/storycorps/id359071069?mt=8">iOS app store</a> and <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.bottlerocketapps.storycorps">Android Play</a>.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14395 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances 10up-at-wordcamp-london">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-london/">10up at WordCamp London</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/10up-at-wordcamp-london/" title="10up at WordCamp London"><time datetime="2015-03-19T06:37:11-04:00">March 19, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-14401" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/featured-london-calling-yellow.jpg" alt="WordCamp London 2015" width="825" height="510" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow.jpg 825w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow-300x185.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow-768x475.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow-756x467.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow-201x124.jpg 201w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/03/featured-london-calling-yellow-146x90.jpg 146w" sizes="(max-width: 825px) 100vw, 825px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a></p>
<p><a title="WordCamp London" href="http://london.wordcamp.org/" target="_blank">WordCamp London</a> is happening this weekend, March 20-22, and our CEO John Eckman and I will be flying over the Atlantic to join in on what is sure to be a fantastic event. I’ll be speaking on Saturday on <a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/a-user-first-approach-to-metadata/">what it means to apply a user-first approach to&nbsp;metadata and fields</a>, a topic that is near and dear to anyone who’s extended the WordPress admin, as well as on a core developer Q&amp;A panel on Sunday.</p>
<p>The entire schedule looks great, in addition to Friday’s Contributor Day. We’re especially looking forward to seeing:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="saturday:%20 Building a Scalable WordPress at News Corp UK (Luke Wheatle, Sophie Plimbley) A User-First Approach to Metadata (10up%E2%80%98s own Helen Hou-Sand%C3%AD) &lt;picture&gt; and Friends: HTML Responsive Images (Bruce Lawson) From Web Address to Web Page %E2%80%93 the Humble URL in WordPress (Simon Wheatley) Sunday: Think Big, Grow Fast. Breaking Into The Enterprise Market (Fabio Torlini) User Experience in WordPress (Sara Cannon) Hiring Employee Number One: From Freelancer to Agency (Brad Williams) How We Built a Market-Leading WordPress Agency; And Why We Walked Away (Simon Dickson)" target="_blank">Indie Design</a> (Laura Kalbag)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/building-a-scalable-wordpress-at-news-corp-uk/" target="_blank">Building a Scalable WordPress at News Corp UK</a> (Luke Wheatle, Sophie Plimbley)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/picture-and-friends-html-responsive-images/" target="_blank">&lt;picture&gt; and Friends: HTML Responsive Images</a> (Bruce Lawson)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/from-web-address-to-web-page-the-humble-url-in-wordpress/" target="_blank">From Web Address to Web Page – the Humble URL in WordPress</a> (Simon Wheatley)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/think-big-grow-fast-breaking-into-the-enterprise-market/" target="_blank">Think Big, Grow Fast. Breaking Into The Enterprise Market</a> (Fabio Torlini)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/user-experience-in-wordpress/" target="_blank">User Experience in WordPress</a> (Sara Cannon)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/hiring-employee-number-one-from-freelancer-to-agency/" target="_blank">Hiring Employee Number One: From Freelancer to Agency</a> (Brad Williams)</li>
<li><a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/session/how-we-built-a-market-leading-wordpress-agency-and-why-we-walked-away/" target="_blank">How We Built a Market-Leading WordPress Agency; And Why We Walked Away</a> (Simon Dickson)</li>
</ul>
<p>Between all of the great talks, networking, and <a href="http://london.wordcamp.org/2015/catering-for-wordcamp-london/" target="_blank">delicious food</a> (who says the British don’t have good food?), this will definitely be a memorable WordCamp.&nbsp;If you’re on Twitter, follow along with WordCamp London on <a href="https://twitter.com/WordCampLondon" target="_blank">Twitter</a> and via the <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/wcldn" target="_blank">#wcldn</a> hashtag.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14299 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-image 4up-birthday">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/4up-birthday/">10up turns&nbsp;four</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/4up-birthday/" title="10up turns four"><time datetime="2015-02-13T17:04:30-05:00">February 13, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="422" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4.jpg" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4.jpg 1000w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4-300x195.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4-768x498.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4-756x491.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4-191x124.jpg 191w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/02/10upis4-139x90.jpg 139w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p>Four years ago, 10up&nbsp;came to life with a couple of clients, and a centrally located team of <em>one</em>. Today, our 100+ team of engineers, designers, and strategists span the globe, &nbsp;privileged to serve&nbsp;Fortune 500 (and 50… and <em>1</em>…) clients, as well as an&nbsp;array&nbsp;of well respected startups and lesser known brands invested in first class technology solutions.&nbsp;Here are a few highlights since our last birthday:</p>
<ul>
<li>Continued to launch projects&nbsp;for renowned clients,&nbsp;like <a title="10up and FiveThirtyEight" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/espn-fivethirtyeight/">FiveThirtyEight</a>: one of the most anticipated website launches in&nbsp;2014.</li>
<li><a title="PushUp: Push Notifications for WordPress" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/pushup-push-notifications-wordpress/">Launched</a> our first product – and since <a title="website push notifications" href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">pushed over 1&nbsp;<em>billion</em>&nbsp;website notifications</a>.</li>
<li>Grew <a title="About Us" href="https://10up.com/about/">our full time&nbsp;team</a>&nbsp;by 100%. More came aboard&nbsp;in&nbsp;the last 2 months than our entire 2nd&nbsp;year.</li>
<li>Grew our revenue. We’ve invoiced more&nbsp;in the last 2 weeks than we earned our in our first year. We’ve&nbsp;collected more revenue in the last two months&nbsp;than we earned in our entire second year.</li>
<li>Welcomed our first&nbsp;<a title="Meet John Eckman, 10up CEO" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/john-eckman-ceo/">Chief Executive Officer</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://twitter.com/10up/status/467098802013229056">Launched</a> a brand new&nbsp;10up.com.</li>
<li>Invested thousands of hours into open source projects, mostly WordPress. WordPress is our&nbsp;third largest client by&nbsp;effort. And that’s only the&nbsp;“company time.”</li>
<li>Led the release of WordPress 4.0, saw our Director of Platform Experience <a title="Director of Platform Experience promoted to Lead WordPress Developer" href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/lead-wordpress-developer/">promoted to a Lead Developer</a> for the project, and <a title="Drew Jaynes selected as WordPress 4.2 release lead" href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead/">kicked off leading WordPress 4.2</a>.</li>
<li>Open sourced and publicly released our <a title="10up Engineering Best Practices" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/engineering-best-practices/">engineering best practices</a>. We’ve seen contributions from <a href="https://github.com/10up/Engineering-Best-Practices/commits?author=paulirish">renowned&nbsp;Google experts</a>, and community <a href="https://twitter.com/10up/status/532334493311328258">translations into languages like Japanese</a>.</li>
<li>Engineered an <a title="Gif the Halls: Holiday Cards Gone Wild" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/gif-the-halls-san-francisco/">interactive holiday card</a> projected in downtown San Francisco.</li>
<li>Helped a&nbsp;hosting partner, WP Engine, build <a title="WP Engine Mercury: Building a WordPress Jet Engine" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wp-engine-mercury/">Mercury:&nbsp;the next generation of their platform</a>.</li>
<li><a title="Varying Vagrant Vagrants: All Grown Up" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/varying-vagrant-vagrants-future/">Graduated Varying Vagrant Vagrants (VVV)</a> from a 10up project that has changed the way many&nbsp;develop locally to an open, external community project.</li>
</ul>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/4up-birthday/#more-14299" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up turns&nbsp;four</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14256 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-happenings post_format-post-format-aside lead-wordpress-developer">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/lead-wordpress-developer/" title="Director of Platform Experience promoted to Lead WordPress Developer"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/lead-wordpress-developer/" title="Director of Platform Experience promoted to Lead WordPress Developer"><time datetime="2015-02-04T21:34:12-05:00">February 4, 2015</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>Three and a half years after her <a title="My First Patch: Helen Hou-Sandi" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/my-first-patch-helen/">very first props</a> in WordPress core and two years after becoming a core committer, Director of Platform Experience Helen Hou-Sandí has been promoted to&nbsp;<a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2015/02/03/new-lead-developers-helen-and-dion/">Lead Developer for the WordPress project</a>. She joins 5 other leads atop the WordPress credits screen, including&nbsp;project founder Matt Mullenweg. 10up is now the&nbsp;first and only consulting agency to have the honor of a Lead Developer in its ranks, as well as&nbsp;the only agency with&nbsp;not just one, but two WordPress&nbsp;<a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2014/04/30/helen-is-the-wordpress-4-0-release-lead/">release</a> <a title="Drew Jaynes selected as WordPress 4.2 release lead" href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead/">leads</a>. We’re proud of Helen, and proud of our growing contributions.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14212 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead/">Drew Jaynes selected as WordPress 4.2 release&nbsp;lead</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead/" title="Drew Jaynes selected as WordPress 4.2 release lead"><time datetime="2015-02-02T19:54:19-05:00">February 2, 2015</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/drew-jaynes-wordpress-4-2-release-lead/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-medium wp-image-14238" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/drew_wtd-300x300.jpg" alt="Drew Jaynes at Write the Docs" width="300" height="300" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-300x300.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-150x150.jpg 150w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-768x767.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-756x755.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-124x124.jpg 124w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-620x620.jpg 620w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-336x336.jpg 336w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd-90x90.jpg 90w, https://10up.com/uploads/2015/01/drew_wtd.jpg 1000w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">10up Web Engineer <a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-drew-jaynes">Drew Jaynes</a> will be <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2015/01/21/drew-jaynes-is-the-4-2-release-lead/">leading the WordPress 4.2 development cycle</a>, slated for release in April 2015. WordPress’s releases come a few times a year and involve hundreds of people and thousands of lines of code. A release lead coordinates all of these contributors and contributions, while also managing schedules, priorities, and announcements.&nbsp;As&nbsp;a committer for the past year (with&nbsp;direct access to change the&nbsp;source code)&nbsp;and a driving force behind WordPress&nbsp;documentation, Drew has proven that he’s well-suited to the task, and we’re looking forward to&nbsp;this&nbsp;next release.</p>
<p>As a part of our commitment to the WordPress and open source community, roughly half of Drew’s time is donated to working on core and community initiatives. Building on my own experience as the WordPress 4.0 release lead and fellow committer, I’ll also be close at hand as a ready and willing mentor. We were really excited to be the first agency to sponsor a release lead, and we’re even more excited to do it&nbsp;again so soon. Please join us in congratulating Drew!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14200 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings elasticpress-and-10up-at-wordcamp-paris">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/elasticpress-and-10up-at-wordcamp-paris/">ElasticPress and 10up at WordCamp Paris</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/elasticpress-and-10up-at-wordcamp-paris/" title="ElasticPress and 10up at WordCamp Paris"><time datetime="2015-01-22T10:51:06-05:00">January 22, 2015</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2015/elasticpress-and-10up-at-wordcamp-paris/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p>ElasticPress is coming to Paris this weekend. I will be speaking at WordCamp Paris on January 23, 2015. Day one of the camp is being held at MAS Paris, and day two is at the EEMI school.</p>
<p>My session, occuring Friday at 3pm, is titled “Modernizing WordPress Search with Elasticsearch”. I will describe the limitations of WordPress search and present an alternative, Elasticsearch and ElasticPress. I will explain some basic Elasticsearch cluster configuration tips, run through ElasticPress setup, and demonstrate some really interesting queries that can be achieved with the plugin.</p>
<p>Whether you are a novice WordPress developer or an expert systems engineer with Elasticsearch experience, my session will demonstrate the power of WordPress and ElasticPress and hopefully spark some ideas on how you can improve your site’s search experience.</p>
<p>If you are attending WordCamp Paris, please come say hello! 10up is hiring, and I am always happy to chat about opportunities.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14110 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized gif-the-halls-san-francisco">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/gif-the-halls-san-francisco/">Gif the Halls: Holiday Cards Gone&nbsp;Wild</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/davidperalty/" title="Posts by David Peralty" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/2056ec3b78ef7dd31bf3e8659e219a56?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/2056ec3b78ef7dd31bf3e8659e219a56?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> David Peralty</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/gif-the-halls-san-francisco/" title="Gif the Halls: Holiday Cards Gone Wild"><time datetime="2014-12-16T18:10:06-05:00">December 16, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/gif-the-halls-san-francisco/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>When&nbsp;<a href="http://wpengine.com/">WP Engine</a>&nbsp;came to us&nbsp;to help engineer <em><strong>Gif the Halls</strong></em> –&nbsp;part digital&nbsp;holiday greeting, part&nbsp;holiday art exhibition – we were more than a little intrigued.</p>
<p>The WP Engine Labs team&nbsp;commissioned six digital artists to create holiday themed animations, to be projected onto buildings in San Francisco – and they&nbsp;needed a way to collect holiday messages from the masses. Enabling visitors, directed from the exhibit, to&nbsp;build digital holiday cards on the (WP Engine hosted) website was the <em>easy</em> part.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-14127" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357.png" alt="Gif the Halls" width="914" height="693" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357.png 914w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357-300x227.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357-768x582.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357-756x573.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357-164x124.png 164w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/screencapture-gifthehalls-com1-e1418348050357-119x90.png 119w" sizes="(max-width: 914px) 100vw, 914px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>First, we had to build an output system to&nbsp;project&nbsp;cards onto the buildings in San Francisco, and that output system needed a queue manager, so that&nbsp;only approved&nbsp;cards would appear. Still&nbsp;doesn’t sound too hard?</p>
<p><strong><em>We also had to engineer remote controlled video capture.</em></strong>&nbsp;Collecting and displaying cards wasn’t enough: we&nbsp;wanted to capture reactions to the&nbsp;exhibit right on the street. Our set-up would determine when a&nbsp;camera should&nbsp;record, transcode that video&nbsp;recording, and share the reaction with the&nbsp;original card creator,&nbsp;who would in turn share the video with friends and family. Without getting too technical,&nbsp;we created a bridge between WordPress and a digital SLR so that when cards are&nbsp;presented, the camera in San Francisco begins&nbsp;recording.</p>
<p><strong>You can check out the result of our partnership&nbsp;with&nbsp;WPEngine, featuring&nbsp;art curated by <a href="http://grayarea.org/">Grey Area</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;presented in partnership with <a href="http://www.ybcbd.org/">YBCBD</a>, by&nbsp;heading over to <a title="Gif the Halls" href="http://web.archive.org/web/20141217234643/http://gifthehalls.com/">GiftheHalls.com</a> and&nbsp;visiting the&nbsp;<a href="https://www.google.com/maps/place/785+Market+St,+San+Francisco,+CA+94103/@37.7857167,-122.4052073,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x8085808626988ced:0xb364e0eda3a4a476">Humboldt Bank Building</a> or <a href="https://www.google.com/maps/place/685+Market+St,+San+Francisco,+CA+94103/@37.7876634,-122.4030934,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x808580886ac3768f:0xc10ad136f515378d">Monadnock Building </a>on Market Street between the hours of 6pm and&nbsp;6am, December 20-22.</strong></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-14137 type-post status-publish format-aside has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside 10up-at-backboneconf">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-at-backboneconf/" title="10up at BackboneConf"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/RBaker-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/RBaker-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/rachel-baker/" title="Posts by Rachel Baker" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Rachel Baker</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-at-backboneconf/" title="10up at BackboneConf"><time datetime="2014-12-16T15:30:15-05:00">December 16, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>On December 16-17, the third annual BackboneConf will take place in Cambridge, MA. <a title="BackboneConf" href="http://backboneconf.com/">BackboneConf</a> is conference about building real-time applications for the web, with a focus on the Backbone.js library.</p>
<p>I will be giving a talk on the WordPress JSON REST API. I have been actively involved in the REST API project over the past year, and I am excited to share our efforts with a new community. In my presentation I cover some of the challenges building an API for 23% of the web brings, and what the project means to the future of WordPress.</p>
<p>If you are interested in getting involved with the WordPress JSON REST API proejct or working for 10up pull me aside.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13763 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings wp-engine-mercury">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wp-engine-mercury/">WP Engine Mercury: Building a WordPress Jet&nbsp;Engine</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wp-engine-mercury/" title="WP Engine Mercury: Building a WordPress Jet Engine"><time datetime="2014-11-20T09:00:59-05:00">November 20, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wp-engine-mercury/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright wp-image-14025" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/mercury-logo.png" alt="WP Engine Mercury" width="200" height="200" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/mercury-logo.png 296w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/mercury-logo-150x150.png 150w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/mercury-logo-124x124.png 124w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/mercury-logo-90x90.png 90w" sizes="(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">Putting problem solving before technology often means <em>figuring the technology out</em> – sometimes as we go. From <a title="Safari Push Notifications" href="https://pushupnotifications.com/">push notifications</a> and <a title="Meet ElasticPress" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/meet-elasticpress/">search</a> to <a title="Varying Vagrant Vagrants" href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/varying-vagrant-vagrants-future/">standardizing local development</a>, we’re most proud of contributions that advance markets and platforms, not just 10up.</p>
<p>Months ago, <a href="http://wpengine.com/">WP Engine</a>, a market leader in managed WordPress hosting, reached out to us for candid feedback with an eye toward&nbsp;the platform’s future. The <a title="WP Engine Labs" href="http://wpengine.com/labs">Labs</a> team was determined to invent not only the future of WP Engine, but the future of WordPress hosting; to be as disruptive as WP Engine was in its earliest days. From better hardware and developer tools to bleeding edge performance technology, the vision was compelling, and it was clear that from CEO Heather Bruner to Founder &amp; CTO Jason Cohen, they were all in.</p>
<p>Its 10up’s position that a rich, forward-looking ecosystem of managed hosting choices is <strong><em>vital</em></strong> to the success of a web platform; we’re only as strong as the weakest part of our stack. Membership, integrated social engagement – even e-commerce – are increasingly entangled with content and publishing, and there are, unsurprisingly, a dearth of hosted WordPress choices tackling these use cases. As the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Failwhale.png">fail-whale</a> oft-reminded us, these cases are very hard to scale, particularly with run-time languages like PHP atop traditional SQL databases. Just ask Facebook. (Actually: we did. Read on.)</p>
<p>WP Engine wanted to tackle this problem. They had us at “do you want to help us build it?”</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wp-engine-mercury/#more-13763" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on WP Engine Mercury: Building a WordPress Jet&nbsp;Engine</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13752 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside confab-higher-ed">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/confab-higher-ed/" title="Confab Higher Ed"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-256x256.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-512x512.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/confab-higher-ed/" title="Confab Higher Ed"><time datetime="2014-11-12T12:46:41-05:00">November 12, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I’ll be headed to Atlanta today for <a title="Confab Higher Ed" href="http://confabevents.com/events/higher-ed">Confab Higher Ed</a>, where I’ll be speaking tomorrow on “<a title="Talking to Developers About Content" href="http://confabevents.com/events/higher-ed/program/talking-to-developers-about-content" target="_blank">Engineering Influence: Talking to Developers About Content.</a>” &nbsp;It’s part of the <a title="Confab Events" href="http://confabevents.com/" target="_blank">confab series of events</a>&nbsp;which I’ve always found to be very well put together, and I’m proud to be part of it.</p>
<p><a href="http://confabevents.com/events/higher-ed"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-13755 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/confab-highered-banner-H.png" alt="confab-highered-banner-H" width="770" height="167" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H.png 770w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H-300x65.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H-768x167.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H-756x164.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H-220x48.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/11/confab-highered-banner-H-160x35.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 770px) 100vw, 770px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a></p>
</div>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-13590 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances worklife-balance-at-wordcamp-raleigh">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/worklife-balance-at-wordcamp-raleigh/">Work/Life Balance at WordCamp Raleigh</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/christinegarrison/" title="Posts by Christine Garrison" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christine Garrison</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/worklife-balance-at-wordcamp-raleigh/" title="Work/Life Balance at WordCamp Raleigh"><time datetime="2014-11-06T20:17:38-05:00">November 6, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright" src="http://2014.raleigh.wordcamp.org/files/2014/09/wordcamp-raleigh-2014-speaker-badge.jpg" alt="WordCamp Raleigh" width="250" height="250" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">This weekend I’m&nbsp;speaking at <a href="http://2014.raleigh.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Raleigh</a>, at North Carolina State University’s Centennial Campus. Centennial Campus is a research park and campus that is home to the NCSU School of Engineering along with the Hunt Library, ABB, and Broadband.com.</p>
<p>Saturday Afternoon, I’ll be presenting my talk, “<a href="http://2014.raleigh.wordcamp.org/session/the-art-of-untethering-how-is-your-worklife-balance/">The Art of Untethering: How Is Your Work/Life Balance?</a>”, on the Power User’s Track.</p>
<p>In this talk, we will discuss what work/life balance is; how to see the warning signs that the paths are crossing; and how to maintain the balance so that both work and life are enjoyable and fulfilling.</p>
<p>Also in attendance, you’ll find 10up Web Engineer Amy Hendrix.</p>
<p>There are <a href="http://2014.raleigh.wordcamp.org/tickets/">still tickets left</a>, so come out to the Oak City this weekend and catch myself and Amy at WordCamp Raleigh.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13595 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings tag-best-practices tag-development tag-open-source tag-wordpress engineering-best-practices">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/engineering-best-practices/">10up Engineering Best Practices</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/engineering-best-practices/" title="10up Engineering Best Practices"><time datetime="2014-11-05T09:39:54-05:00">November 5, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/engineering-best-practices/#comments" class="comments-count">1 Comment</a>
</p>
<p>At 10up, we build custom publishing experiences. We take great pride in all aspects of building websites, from user interaction design&nbsp;to code performance. Security, style, workflow, design patterns, performance, and even tools all influence that publishing experience. We use the term “engineer” rather than “develop” because of the amount of skillful strategy and true craftsmanship involved in what we build.</p>
<p>With over 90 full time employees, 10up has a diverse team of strategists, project managers, designers, and a few dozen incredibly smart, diverse engineers. Standardization in engineering is increasingly important with such a large team. Over the past few months we collaborated as a company to document how we engineer and why. We spent a great deal of time considering various things such as WP_Query performance recommendations, workflows to maximize efficiency, and tools we want to use and maintain as a team.</p>
<p><strong>We are proud to open source&nbsp;our <a href="http://10up.github.io/Engineering-Best-Practices/">Engineering Best Practices</a> as a <a href="https://github.com/10up/Engineering-Best-Practices">public project on GitHub</a></strong>. WordPress is an open-source project and so are our Engineering Best Practices. We believe WordPress has continued to grow because of its embracement of open source philosophies. We want&nbsp;our Best Practices to follow that model. We know there are opportunities to keep improving,&nbsp;and want to <strong>welcome&nbsp;community contributions that are in tune with our philosophies</strong>.</p>
</div>
</article>
