<article class="blog-archive-post post-13547 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-happenings tag-development tag-elasticsearch tag-plugin tag-search meet-elasticpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/meet-elasticpress/">Meet ElasticPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/meet-elasticpress/" title="Meet ElasticPress"><time datetime="2014-10-26T13:02:19-04:00">October 26, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/meet-elasticpress/#comments" class="comments-count">5 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>We are proud to announce the release of a new plugin, <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/elasticpress/">ElasticPress</a>, to the WordPress&nbsp;community. The project&nbsp;started as an internal initiative to meet a particularly common yet difficult client request: improved WordPress search.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright wp-image-13551 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/icon-256x256.jpg" alt="ElasticPress" width="216" height="216" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/10/icon-256x256.jpg 216w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/10/icon-256x256-150x150.jpg 150w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/10/icon-256x256-124x124.jpg 124w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/10/icon-256x256-90x90.jpg 90w" sizes="(max-width: 216px) 100vw, 216px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>ElasticPress integrates WordPress search with Elasticsearch which has become increasingly prominent powering search on major enterprise websites such as Github and WordPress.com. Elasticsearch is a scalable, peformant, and open source standalone search server based on a technology from Apache called Lucene.&nbsp;Besides being fast and scalable, Elasticsearch can do things like relevant results, autosuggest, geographic search, fuzzy matching, data weighting, and more.</p>
<p>ElasticPress ties your Elasticsearch instance to WordPress. It is a lightweight plugin that&nbsp;overrides the <code>WP_Query</code> object to return posts from Elasticsearch instead of MySQL. There are a number of <a href="https://github.com/10up/ElasticPress#supported-wp_query-parameters">special WP_Query parameters</a> that the plugin supports to do things like meta, taxonomy, and author searches. ElasticPress can also handle cross-blog search on WordPress multi-site installations.</p>
<p>Full documentation and usage instructions for the plugin are on <a href="https://github.com/10up/ElasticPress">Github</a>. ElasticPress requires WP-CLI as it is preferable to handle things like bulk indexing through PHP CLI.</p>
<p>Please reach out on Github with any questions. We are happy to help and greatly appreciate contributions.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13540 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances wordcamp-san-francisco-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-san-francisco-2014/">10up takes WordCamp San Francisco 2014</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-san-francisco-2014/" title="10up takes WordCamp San Francisco 2014"><time datetime="2014-10-24T12:56:00-04:00">October 24, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-san-francisco-2014/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p><a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp San&nbsp;Fransisco</a> was the first WordPress conference, has historically remained the largest (certainly on the North American continent), and is&nbsp;home to&nbsp;WordPress co-founder and project lead Matt Mullenweg’s annual&nbsp;State of the Word address.</p>
<p>In 2012, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2012/wordcamp-san-francisco-10up-annual-meeting-2012/">we brought the “whole team” out</a> (all 14 of us), and watched with delight as our own Helen Hou-Sandi was called out&nbsp;in the&nbsp;State of the Word as a rockstar. In 2013, we decided that taking a team of ~35 was neither logistically practical nor a great way for us to focus on team building, <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2013/10up-wordcamp-san-francisco/">so we brought a contingent of 8</a>, and&nbsp;were proud to showcase four speakers&nbsp;and see &nbsp;Drew Jaynes called out as a&nbsp;rockstar.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-11722" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/1.jpg" alt="1" width="719" height="472" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/04/1.jpg 719w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/04/1-300x197.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/04/1-189x124.jpg 189w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/04/1-137x90.jpg 137w" sizes="(max-width: 719px) 100vw, 719px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>WordCamp San Francisco 2014 is this weekend, and this time you’ll find a dozen (12) 10uppers roaming the conference.&nbsp;<strong>This year we’re proud to have 5 speakers participating:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>On Saturday,&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/session/code-is-poetry-a-musicians-tale/">Helen Hou-Sandi</a> connects her&nbsp;training as professional musician with her career&nbsp;as a code poet.</li>
<li>Kicking off Sunday, <a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/session/how-wordpress-saves-lives-moves-governments/">Paul Clark</a> inspires us by reminding how&nbsp;web publishing and WordPress can save lives and move governments.</li>
<li>The three <a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/session/lightning-talks-wordpress-in-context/">“WordPress in Context” lightning talks</a>&nbsp;on Saturday feature 2 10uppers – and one 10up alumnus! 10up&nbsp;CEO&nbsp;John Eckman and Senior Engineer Rachel Baker are joined by former&nbsp;Engineering Director (now a leader in the university system) Jeremy Felt.</li>
<li>Finally, our&nbsp;Creative Director, Taylor Aldridge, joins a set of Saturday <a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/session/lightning-talks-design-business/">lightning talks on Design &amp; Business</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-san-francisco-2014/#more-13540" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on 10up takes WordCamp San Francisco 2014</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13530 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside css-dev-conf">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/css-dev-conf/" title="10up at CSS Dev Conf"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jonbellah-btw-256x256.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/jonbellah-btw-512x512.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/jonbellah/" title="Posts by Jon Bellah" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Jon Bellah</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/css-dev-conf/" title="10up at CSS Dev Conf"><time datetime="2014-10-12T19:22:07-04:00">October 12, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>This week I’ll be representing team 10up&nbsp;at <a href="http://2014.cssdevconf.com/">CSS Dev Conf</a> in New Orleans. I’m honored to be speaking alongside industry luminaries&nbsp;like Chris Coyier, Dan Cederholm, and Rachel Nabors. On Monday afternoon, I present&nbsp;<a href="http://cssdevconf2014.sched.org/event/5c4f1e9f09e70cd4d3dcb613a31b5e3d">Embracing&nbsp;Performance Optimization</a>, an essential ingredient&nbsp;for&nbsp;great user experiences. I’ll cover&nbsp;optimization of the critical rendering path, elimination of unnecessary roundtrips, and leveraging caching… And since it <em>is</em> CSS Dev Conf, I’ll dive deep&nbsp;into the keys to CSS performance.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13509 type-post status-publish format-event has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-event 10up-returns-to-seattle-givecamp">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-returns-to-seattle-givecamp/">10up Returns to Seattle GiveCamp</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/grantlandram/" title="Posts by Grant Landram" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Grant-Landram_avatar_1469546895-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/07/Grant-Landram_avatar_1469546895-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Grant Landram</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-returns-to-seattle-givecamp/" title="10up Returns to Seattle GiveCamp"><time datetime="2014-10-03T20:33:27-04:00">October 3, 2014</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Oct</span>
4</time>

<p class="event-title">Seattle GiveCamp</p>

<p class="location">Redmond, Wa</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>This weekend over 200&nbsp;Volunteers &nbsp;and 28 Non-Profit Organizations are expected to&nbsp;gather on Microsoft’s campus in Redmond, Washington for the annual <a href="http://seattlegivecamp.org/" target="_blank">Seattle Givecamp</a>, a weekend-long “hackathon” style event where software developers, website wonks, project managers and designers donate their time to design and build solutions for non-profit organizations in need. From health and wildlife outreach programs to community food coalitions, participating non-profits submit technology projects that require assistance they don’t have funding or expertise to carry out. Volunteers will gather on Friday to learn&nbsp;about each Organizations’s Project, form teams, and spend the rest of the weekend (often working through the night) hacking together solutions.</p>
<p>On Saturday morning I will be returning for a 3rd year to lead a workshop for participating organizations and volunteers on how to better leverage WordPress on their projects during the weekend and beyond. Many of the participating organizations are either already using WordPress, or have identified their project as requiring a WordPress component. In my session I will cover a variety of WordPress topics ranging from how to start using WordPress for the first time, to using some it’s more advanced APIs, to simple every day tips and tricks. The session will be Saturday morning at 10:30am and is open to the general public.</p>
<p>For more information about Seattle GiveCamp visit <a href="http://seattlegivecamp.org/" target="_blank">http://seattlegivecamp.org/</a> and follow them on Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/seattlegivecamp" target="_blank">@SeattleGivecamp</a>. Best of luck to all the project teams this weekend, and if you’re in the Seattle area I hope to see you there!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13517 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances tag-wordcamp wordcamp-dallas">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-dallas/">Double Days of Discourse in&nbsp;Dallas</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/paul-clark/" title="Posts by Paul Clark" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/PClark-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/PClark-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Paul Clark</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-dallas/" title="Double Days of Discourse in Dallas"><time datetime="2014-10-03T00:22:19-04:00">October 3, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>I’m proud to be joining my fellow 10uppers for not one, but <em>two</em> WordPress-focused conferences in Dallas, Texas this weekend!</p>
<p><a href="http://podscamp.org/speakers/#wcorg-speaker-scott-kingsley-clark">Scott Kingsley Clark</a>, Lead Developer of the <a href="http://pods.io/" target="_blank">Pods Framework for WordPress</a>, will kick things off with several&nbsp;talks <a href="http://podscamp.org/schedule/" target="_blank">on Friday</a>&nbsp;at PodsCamp, which focuses on the flexibility and varying use cases for the Pods plugin.</p>
<p>If Scott doesn’t collapse from exhaustion after giving four talks, he’ll join Corey Ellis, Jon Bellah, and myself at WordCamp Dallas the next day. Come say hello between sessions, or join us at one of our talks listed below!</p>
<p>Between the four of us, there’s content for WordPress developers of all skill levels: Corey will dig into WordPress themes for those just getting started. I’ll cover the benefits and trade-offs of several WordPress career tracks, while&nbsp;Jon will bring your development skills to the next level for high-performance sites. Want to know how to quickly extend WordPress to manage almost any type of content? Any of Scott’s talks at PodsCamp will fit the bill!</p>
<h2><a title="WordPress Pods CMS" href="http://podscamp.org/" target="_blank">PodsCamp Dallas</a> — October 3, 2014</h2>
<p><a href="http://podscamp.org/speakers/#wcorg-speaker-scott-kingsley-clark">Scott Kingsley Clark</a>&nbsp;will be presenting four (yes, four!) talks on the popular Pods plugin:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://podscamp.org/session/introduction-pods/">Introduction to Pods</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podscamp.org/session/pods-gravity-forms/">Pods and Gravity Forms</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podscamp.org/session/tweaks-optimizations-workflow-oh/">Tweaks, Optimizations, and Workflow — Oh, My.</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podscamp.org/session/undercover-pods-wp-functions/">Undercover Pods / WP Functions</a></li>
</ul>
<h2><a title="10up at WordCamp Dallas" href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/schedule/" target="_blank">WordCamp Dallas</a>&nbsp;— October 4, 2014</h2>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/session/anatomy-of-a-wordpress-theme/" target="_blank">Anatomy of a WordPress Theme</a>&nbsp;with&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/speakers/#wcorg-speaker-corey-ellis" target="_blank">Corey Ellis</a></li>
<li><a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/session/tba/" target="_blank">Find Your Dream Job: Freelancer, Founder, or Agency?</a>&nbsp;with&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/speakers/#wcorg-speaker-paul-clark" target="_blank">Paul Clark</a></li>
<li><a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/session/building-high-performance-wordpress-websites/" target="_blank">Building High Performance WordPress Websites</a>&nbsp;with&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.dfw.wordcamp.org/speakers/#wcorg-speaker-jon-bellah" target="_blank">Jon Bellah</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13484 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-happenings tag-json-rest-api tag-wordcamp-providence tag-wp-api wordcamp-providence-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-providence-2014/">10up at WordCamp Providence 2014</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-taylor-lovett" title="Posts by Taylor Lovett" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TLovett-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/TLovett-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Lovett</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-providence-2014/" title="10up at WordCamp Providence 2014"><time datetime="2014-09-26T13:53:26-04:00">September 26, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="http://2014.providence.wordcamp.org/"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-medium wp-image-13493" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wcprovlogo_1x-300x225.jpg" alt="wcprovlogo_1x" width="300" height="225" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/wcprovlogo_1x-300x225.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/wcprovlogo_1x-165x124.jpg 165w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/wcprovlogo_1x-120x90.jpg 120w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/wcprovlogo_1x.jpg 400w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>On September 26-27, John Eckman and I will be attending <a title="WordCamp Providence" href="http://2014.providence.wordcamp.org/" target="_blank">WordCamp Providence</a> at the University of Rhode Island. The excitement continues around the <a title="WP API Documentation" href="http://wp-api.org/" target="_blank">JSON REST API</a> slated for core integration in the near feature. (I participated on the WP API team, along with fellow 10up’er Rachel Baker). A huge amount of work has gone into the API, and we are all super excited to present on it at WordCamps around the world.</p>
<p>I’ll be giving a <a title="JSON REST API" href="http://2014.providence.wordcamp.org/session/json-rest-api/" target="_blank">talk</a> covering&nbsp;the need for the API, cover REST basics, and teach developers to use the API. Having been the lead contributor to the Backbone client, I will be talking about how developers can use JavaScript to interact with the API.&nbsp;There are already some awesome JavaScript implementations of the API popping up such as my own <a title="_s_backbone" href="https://github.com/tlovett1/_s_backbone" target="_blank">_s_backbone</a>.</p>
<p>If anyone is interested in talking about the API, working for 10up, or just generally chatting feel free to pull me aside!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13473 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances wordcamp-europe">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-europe/">10up goes to WordCamp Europe</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-europe/" title="10up goes to WordCamp Europe"><time datetime="2014-09-24T15:03:43-04:00">September 24, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/NDK_Sofia_2012_PD_06.jpg/1024px-NDK_Sofia_2012_PD_06.jpg" alt=""></p>
<p>This weekend marks the second annual <a href="http://2014.europe.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Europe</a>, being held in Sofia, Bulgaria. I am very excited to be presenting on enhancing WordPress development by getting curious about core; inspired by the&nbsp;10up experience of&nbsp;building <em>with</em> WordPress and building WordPress <em>itself</em>. I’m also excited&nbsp;to meet a large group of end users, developers, and contributors who&nbsp;many of us based in the United States&nbsp;have few opportunities to see in person, and look forward to&nbsp;collaborating with them&nbsp;at Monday’s Contributor Day.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13452 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances wordcamp-salt-lake-city">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-salt-lake-city/">10up takes Salt Lake&nbsp;City</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-vasken-hauri" title="Posts by Vasken Hauri" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/VHauri-600x600-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/11/VHauri-600x600-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Vasken Hauri</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-salt-lake-city/" title="10up takes Salt Lake City"><time datetime="2014-09-12T17:37:54-04:00">September 12, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-full wp-image-13453" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/WordCamp_SLC_2014_logo.png" alt="WordCamp_SLC_2014_logo" width="175" height="199" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/WordCamp_SLC_2014_logo.png 175w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/WordCamp_SLC_2014_logo-109x124.png 109w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/WordCamp_SLC_2014_logo-79x90.png 79w" sizes="(max-width: 175px) 100vw, 175px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">This Saturday, September 13th, I’ll be&nbsp;presenting at WordCamp Salt Lake City on the topic of JavaScript and jQuery best practices in WordPress. In light of the upcoming integration of the WP JSON API into WordPress Core, my presentation will focus on building high-quality, performant front-end code that can be safely distributed in the WordPress.org repo.</p>
<p>As WordPress grows beyond a publishing platform to become a powerful and highly extensible CMS with its own JSON API, the need to write clean, readable, and efficient JavaScript is becoming increasingly critical. My&nbsp;talk will cover some common pitfalls that can occur in JavaScript engineering, including overuse of DOM elements, improper variable scoping, and lack of closures within script files. In particular, I’ll explore current best practices in PHP WordPress engineering, with an eye towards applying those same lessons and standards to JavaScript.</p>
<p>Heckling me from the crowd will be various members of an entire 10up pod, visiting Salt Lake City&nbsp;as part of their annual pod retreat.&nbsp;10uppers in attendance include Kailey Lampert, Rachel Backer, Cameron Benedict, Faison Zutavern, Erin Crutcher, Darin Kotter, John Bloch, Cole Geissenger, and Grant Landram.</p>
<p>If you’re a WordPress engineer looking to find out about the latest and greatest that the upcoming JSON API has to offer, as well as how you can create plugins that use the API effectively while still playing nicely with other plugins, this talk is for you.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
</div>
</article>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-13411 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances wordcamp-la-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-la-2014/">Wearing Two Hats at WordCamp&nbsp;LA</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/taylor-aldridge/" title="Posts by Taylor Aldridge" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TAldridge-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/TAldridge-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Aldridge</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-la-2014/" title="Wearing Two Hats at WordCamp LA"><time datetime="2014-09-04T18:42:56-04:00">September 4, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright wp-image-13412 size-medium" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-300x300.png" alt="WCLAX" width="300" height="300" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-300x300.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-150x150.png 150w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-124x124.png 124w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-336x336.png 336w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n-90x90.png 90w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/10489815_776441965719685_7191554778165399067_n.png 423w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><a href="http://2014.la.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Los Angeles</a> keeps getting better. This year, by&nbsp;adding&nbsp;another full day of talks for designers, small business owners, and beginners, the organizers have improved upon an already stellar and full weekend of sessions and activities.</p>
<p>I have the honor of speaking not once, but twice. Friday morning, in the business track, I’ll wear my former small business owner hat, joining&nbsp;Wes Chyrchel for a short Q&amp;A session covering what web shops need to know when scoping a project. After lunch, I switch to my Creative Director hat where, in the design track, I’ll present&nbsp;<a title="Uncommon Design for a Common Web" href="http://2014.la.wordcamp.org/session/uncommon-design-for-the-common-web/">Uncommon Design for a Common Web</a>.</p>
<p>I’m looking forward&nbsp;to connecting with&nbsp;WordCamp friends, and meeting up in-person with fellow 10upper, Senior Engineer&nbsp;Mary Cadwell.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13395 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances wordcamp-boston-turns-5-10up-helps-celebrate">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-boston-turns-5-10up-helps-celebrate/">WordCamp Boston Turns 5, 10up Helps Celebrate</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-eckman" title="Posts by John Eckman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="John Eckman" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/jeckman-64x64.png" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2019/11/jeckman-128x128.png 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> John Eckman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-boston-turns-5-10up-helps-celebrate/" title="WordCamp Boston Turns 5, 10up Helps Celebrate"><time datetime="2014-08-21T18:16:29-04:00">August 21, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="http://2014.boston.wordcamp.org/"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-medium wp-image-13397" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wcboston-203x300.png" alt="wcboston" width="203" height="300" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/wcboston-203x300.png 203w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/wcboston-84x124.png 84w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/wcboston-61x90.png 61w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/wcboston.png 369w" sizes="(max-width: 203px) 100vw, 203px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a></p>
<p>This weekend, Boston will hold its&nbsp;fifth WordCamp, and 10up will be there to help celebrate the <a title="WordCamp Boston" href="http://2014.boston.wordcamp.org/" target="_blank">#BestWordCampEver</a>.</p>
<p>Jake and I will be part of a panel on “<a title="What Boston Gave WordPress, What WordPress Gave Boston" href="http://2014.boston.wordcamp.org/session/what-boston-gave-wordpress-and-what-wordpress-gave-boston/" target="_blank">What Boston&nbsp;Gave WordPress, and What&nbsp;WordPress&nbsp;Gave Boston</a>,” which will include the story of the first WordCamp Boston, which we helped plan back in late 2009 / early 2010. In many ways that first WordCamp Boston set in motion a series of events that would result in his founding of 10up and my joining as CEO. It’s really exciting to see the impact the camp (and the meetup) have had on the WordPress community in Boston and across New England.</p>
<p>Taylor Lovett, our Director of Web Engineering, will also be giving a talk about the <a title="JSON REST API" href="http://2014.boston.wordcamp.org/session/the-new-json-rest-api/" target="_blank">JSON REST API</a> targeted for&nbsp;WordPress core in 4.1.</p>
<p>Finally, we’ll be joined at the 10up sponsor table and throughout the weekend by 10uppers Dave Ross, Sara Tirrell, and Helen Hou-Sandí. Stop by and say hello!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13251 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized brooklynjs-jerseyscript">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/brooklynjs-jerseyscript/">From West of the Hudson to East of the East&nbsp;River</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/brooklynjs-jerseyscript/" title="From West of the Hudson to East of the East River"><time datetime="2014-08-18T22:03:33-04:00">August 18, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>They say good things happen in threes, and the next week of meetups in NYC are no&nbsp;exception.</p>
<p>At the <a href="http://www.meetup.com/WordPressNYC/events/200298642/">WordPress NYC Meetup</a> next Tuesday, August 19, I’ll be showing off a preview of the upcoming WordPress 4.0 and talking a bit about what it’s been like to lead the&nbsp;release.</p>
<p>On Thursday the 21st, I will be presenting “Code is Poetry: A Musician’s Tale” at the JerseyScript takeover of <a href="http://brooklynjs.com/">Brooklyn JS</a>, which 10up is excited to sponsor. I’ll be giving a longer version of the talk at <a href="http://2014.sf.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp San Francisco</a> in October, so no spoilers here! Be on the lookout: our Director of Engineering, Taylor Lovett, will be in attendance as&nbsp;well.</p>
<p>Finally, Brooklyn JS will turn the tides and take over the <a href="http://www.meetup.com/jerseyscript/events/200918722/">JerseyScript meetup</a> on Tuesday, August 26, also sponsored by 10up. I’m especially excited to be coming on board as a co-organizer for JerseyScript proper. We’ll be releasing another block of tickets soon, so get on the waitlist now if you’d like to join us and check out Jersey City, just a quick subway ride over from&nbsp;Manhattan.</p>
<p>If I won’t see you here on one of the sides of the rivers, there’s always <a href="http://2014.boston.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Boston</a> the weekend in between. If you will be at any of these places, come say&nbsp;hi!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-13243 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized wordcamp-maine">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-maine/">10uppers, Code, and Lobsters at WordCamp Maine</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jason-clarke" title="Posts by Jason Clarke" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jason-Clarke_avatar_1526492567-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2018/05/Jason-Clarke_avatar_1526492567-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jason Clarke</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-maine/" title="10uppers, Code, and Lobsters at WordCamp Maine"><time datetime="2014-08-13T21:08:24-04:00">August 13, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><div style="width:300px;height:284px;background-image:url(data:image/svg+xml;base64,);background-repeat:no-repeat;background-size:300px 284px;" data-xblocker="blocked"></div></p>
<p>Fresh off his popular talk on modernism and responsive design at WordCamp NYC&nbsp;last weekend, CEO John Eckman will take the stage twice in Maine: first joining MaineToday Media’s Director of Digital Services to present&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.maine.wordcamp.org/session/delivering-the-news-on-wordpress/">Delivering the News</a> – a look at their <a href="https://10up.com/our-work/mainetoday-media/">online relaunch</a>, and second, to&nbsp;give the&nbsp;<strong>keynote address</strong>!&nbsp;Senior Strategic Engineer Rachel Baker joins the <a href="http://2014.maine.wordcamp.org/session/development-panel/">development&nbsp;panel</a> to answer Maine’s toughest engineering questions, and I’ll be&nbsp;discussing&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.maine.wordcamp.org/session/empathy-the-secret-ingredient-in-wordpress-development-work-and-success/">empathy for our clients and teammates, and how that leads to better projects</a>.</p>
<p>Tickets are still available – including a harbor cruise with the requisite lobster dinner – so it’s not too late to join us this weekend for some WordPress-centric learning and conversation during the beautiful Maine summer!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12873 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized wordcamp-birmingham-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-birmingham-2014/">10up at WordCamp Birmingham – #WPYall</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-birmingham-2014/" title="10up at WordCamp Birmingham – #WPYall"><time datetime="2014-08-11T15:28:23-04:00">August 11, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-13241" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-756x166.png" alt="WordCamp Birmingham 2014" width="650" height="142" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-756x166.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-300x66.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-768x169.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-220x48.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM-160x35.png 160w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/08/Screen-Shot-2014-08-11-at-12.27.26-PM.png 1037w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">On August 16th, Birmingham will have the chance to hear from 4 10uppers as we pay a visit to the Magic City. <a href="http://2014.birmingham.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Birmingham</a> is the South’s oldest WordCamp, starting&nbsp;back in 2008. We say WPY’all loud and proud&nbsp;and look forward to&nbsp;sharing&nbsp;with&nbsp;this&nbsp;community.</p>
<p>Being&nbsp;local to Birmingham, I’ve had the pleasure of&nbsp;o-organizing the camp this year. I’ll also be talking to designers about&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.birmingham.wordcamp.org/session/using-wordpress-to-present-a-design-in-browser/">How to Use WordPress to Present a Design in the Browser</a>. Senior Designer&nbsp;Louis Dorman will be presenting his experience <a href="http://2014.birmingham.wordcamp.org/session/designing-for-growth/">Designing for Growth</a>, and&nbsp;Design Engineer Allen Moore will describe how 10up&nbsp;used child themes to quickly turn out big features on multiple sites in his talk,&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.birmingham.wordcamp.org/session/3-sites-in-6-weeks-wordpress-can-do-that/">3 sites in 6 weeks? WordPress can do&nbsp;that!</a></p>
<p>Last but not least, our President, Jake Goldman, will be giving the keynote address following lunch:&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.birmingham.wordcamp.org/session/keynote-dont-create-for-wordpress-create-with-wordpress/">Don’t Create For WordPress* (*Create With WordPress)</a>. He’ll inspire us to build the next great sites on WordPress by focusing on&nbsp;project&nbsp;vision, and worrying&nbsp;about&nbsp;tools like WordPress after the&nbsp;fact.</p>
<p>It’s going to be a great weekend in the Magic City and we’re excited to be a part of&nbsp;it!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12254 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-appearances 10up-at-wordcamp-nyc">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-at-wordcamp-nyc/">10up at WordCamp&nbsp;NYC</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-at-wordcamp-nyc/" title="10up at WordCamp NYC"><time datetime="2014-07-31T17:51:36-04:00">July 31, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>WordCamp NYC 2014 is this weekend and we’re excited to take part as speakers, attendees, and sponsor. WordCamp NYC is always a great time, and this one is no different, with four full tracks across two days at the Marriott at Brooklyn Bridge.</p>
<p>On Saturday, Adam Silverstein will be presenting&nbsp;<a class="wcpt-session-title" href="http://2014.nyc.wordcamp.org/session/put-a-little-backbone-in-your-wordpress/">Put a little Backbone in your WordPress!</a> and our President, Jake Goldman, will share <a class="wcpt-session-title" href="http://2014.nyc.wordcamp.org/session/best-practices-for-plugin-development/">Best Practices for Plugin Development</a>. Then on Sunday, catch Drew Jaynes’s insight into the core docs initiative and the major part he played as the docs committer for WordPress. Director of Platform Experience Helen Hou-Sandí and CEO John Eckman will be presenting simultaneously with a <a href="http://2014.nyc.wordcamp.org/session/so-you-know-wp_query-now-what/">deep dive into WP_Query</a> and ‘<a class="wcpt-session-title" href="http://2014.nyc.wordcamp.org/session/these-fragments-i-have-shored-against-my-ruins-modernism-post-modernism-and-responsive-web-design/">These fragments I have shored against my ruins’: Modernism, Post-Modernism, and Responsive Web Design</a>, respectively. Doug Stewart and Amy Hendrix will also be in attendance, and you’ll also find many of us at <a href="http://2014.nyc.wordcamp.org/save-the-date-and-rsvp-for-contributor-day/">Friday’s Contributor Day</a> at NYU.</p>
<p>We’re also Park Avenue sponsors under the <a title="Safari Push Notifications for WordPress" href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">PushUp&nbsp;Notifications</a> brand, so stop by the 10up/PushUp sponsor table and say hello. We’ll be happy to chat with you, especially about push notifications and 10up, and get you signed up for PushUp with the help of our team for just 99 cents.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12272 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-around-the-web tag-github tag-techcrunch tag-wordpress asynchronous-wordpress">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/asynchronous-wordpress/">Asynchronous WordPress</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-eric-mann" title="Posts by Eric Mann" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/EMann-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/EMann-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Eric Mann</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/asynchronous-wordpress/" title="Asynchronous WordPress"><time datetime="2014-07-31T12:00:40-04:00">July 31, 2014</time></a>
•
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/asynchronous-wordpress/#comments" class="comments-count">2 Comments</a>
</p>
<p>When <a title="John Bloch" href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-john-bloch">John Bloch</a> and I (Eric Mann) started working with TechCrunch last year on <a href="http://techcrunch.com/2013/10/15/techcrunch-has-redesigned-again/">their site redesign</a>, one of the main&nbsp;goals was to improve site performance. Among the various tools we built to help meet that metric was a library called <a title="TechCrunch Open Sources Its WordPress Async Task Library" href="http://techcrunch.com/2014/07/31/wp-async-task-our-new-open-source-library/">WP Async Task</a>: an abstract library meant to give structure to asynchronous background tasks.</p>
<p>Thanks to WP Async Task, we can offload time-consuming requests (like Twitter interactions) from the main WordPress thread. Editors can publish posts as usual while expensive tasks run in the background rather than holding up the publication process.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-12280 size-large" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-756x101.png" alt="tc performance" width="650" height="87" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-756x101.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-300x40.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-768x102.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-220x29.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56-160x21.png 160w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/screen-shot-2014-07-31-at-12-08-56.png 834w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>In June, the TechCrunch team presented on&nbsp;“<a href="http://vip.wordpress.com/2014/07/01/non-blocking-wordpress/">Non-Blocking WordPress</a>,” explaining some of the approaches we took. Attendees were interested in learning more about WP Async Task and particularly interested in whether the code was available anywhere.</p>
<p>Being big believers in the power of open-source and giving back to the community, we’re thrilled to say that TechCrunch has decided to open-source the library and make it <a href="https://github.com/techcrunch/wp-async-task/">available on GitHub</a>. Check out the library and look at the documentation on <a href="https://github.com/techcrunch/wp-async-task#quick-start">how to use the library</a> in your own code.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12240 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances 10up-in-the-brew-city-at-wordcamp-milwaukee">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-in-the-brew-city-at-wordcamp-milwaukee/">10up in the Brew City at WordCamp Milwaukee</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/10up-in-the-brew-city-at-wordcamp-milwaukee/" title="10up in the Brew City at WordCamp Milwaukee"><time datetime="2014-07-24T13:00:20-04:00">July 24, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner.jpg"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="size-full wp-image-12241 aligncenter" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner.jpg" alt="WordCampMKE-2014-banner" width="926" height="160" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner.jpg 926w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner-300x52.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner-768x133.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner-756x131.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner-220x38.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/07/WordCampMKE-2014-banner-160x28.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 926px) 100vw, 926px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a></p>
<p>This weekend, 10up will be making its midwestern presence known&nbsp;in Brew City. &nbsp;Seven 10uppers will be taking part in the event, many taking on multiple roles to make this an amazing WordCamp. &nbsp;<a href="http://2014.milwaukee.wordcamp.org/">Learn more about WordCamp Milwaukee on&nbsp;the official website.</a></p>
<p>The organizing committee features two 10uppers: lead organizer&nbsp;Dustin Filippini, and Kara Buffardi, who is organizing the Charity Hackathon which will build a web site for a Milwaukee area non-profit dedicated to helping young women and girls in the city.</p>
<p>10uppers will also be speaking throughout the day. In a can’t miss talk, Rachel Baker will be presenting on the new WordPress JSON REST API, which she took a major role in developing. &nbsp;VP of Strategic Engineering Vasken Hauri will be presenting&nbsp;“jQuery: The good, the bad, and the anonymous.” &nbsp;Faison Zutavern, Web Engineer, addresses&nbsp;Ethics in Web Development with his talk on Sunday, and Alison Barrett rounds out the schedule, discussing&nbsp;cooperation between developers and designers in “So I Married a Developer.” &nbsp;Jess Jurick, our&nbsp;VP of Consulting Services, will also be in attendance. &nbsp;Check out&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.milwaukee.wordcamp.org/schedule/">the full schedule</a>.</p>
<p>We’re also sponsoring the camp under our&nbsp;<a title="Safari Push Notifications for WordPress" href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">PushUp&nbsp;Notifications</a> product brand; so if you’ll be at WordCamp Milwaukee,&nbsp;stop by the 10up/PushUp sponsor table, talk with one of the many 10uppers, and sign up for PushUp with the help of our team for just 99 cents.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12192 type-post status-publish format-event has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-event wordcamp-seattle">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-seattle/">WordCamp Seattle</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/grantlandram/" title="Posts by Grant Landram" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Grant-Landram_avatar_1469546895-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2016/07/Grant-Landram_avatar_1469546895-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Grant Landram</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-seattle/" title="WordCamp Seattle"><time datetime="2014-06-27T17:51:01-04:00">June 27, 2014</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Jun</span>
28</time>

<p class="event-title">WordCamp Seattle</p>

<p class="location">Seattle, Washington</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="attending">Attending</span>
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>This weekend 10up will be&nbsp;bringing some&nbsp;sunshine (and ten&nbsp;10uppers!) to the Northwest for the 5th annual&nbsp;WordCamp Seattle. Seattle is a two day WordCamp this year with a jam packed&nbsp;Saturday featuring&nbsp;speakers, panels, lightning talks and even workshops. Sunday is a special <a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/contributor-day-sunday-june-29th/" target="_blank">contributor day</a> with a number of core contributors leading groups&nbsp;who will be contributing back to the WordPress project. If you’re in the Northwest and haven’t already picked up your ticket, don’t&nbsp;miss this massive, 700-attendee WordCamp!</p>
<p>Kicking off the day on Saturday,&nbsp;Kailey Lampert and Adam Silverstein will each be delivering a presentation&nbsp;as a part of the&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/about/sessions/#wcorg-session-807063" target="_blank">developer lightning talks</a>. Their sessions will focus&nbsp;on the hidden treasures&nbsp;of WordPress core and working with WordPress revisions in Backbone. Kailey will be pulling a double feature on Saturday, also being a part of the <a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/about/sessions/#wcorg-session-807141" target="_blank">How to Become a Better WordPress Developer panel</a> with&nbsp;Kronda Adair,&nbsp;Jeremy Felt,&nbsp;Zack Tollman and&nbsp;Morten Rand-Hendriksen.</p>
<p>Next, Paul Clark will be running&nbsp;an excellent session on <a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/session/case-study-performance-scale-and-wordpress/" target="_blank">Performance, Scale and WordPress</a>, using real world examples from 10up’s experience with sites&nbsp;like Ted.com and hosting platforms like&nbsp;WordPress.com VIP. For anyone considering WordPress and it’s application in&nbsp;an enterprise context, don’t miss Paul’s presentation!</p>
<p>At the same time as Paul, Taylor Dewey will be running <a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/session/sass-its-more-than-just-variables-in-your-css/" target="_blank">a workshop on SASS</a>, walking through real life examples and breaking down some of the complexities of the workflow. If you’re thinking about getting into SASS, or have started and need a good&nbsp;tutorial, make sure you check out Taylor’s workshop. Taylor is also pulling a double feature, and will be giving a lightning talk on <a href="http://2014.seattle.wordcamp.org/about/sessions/#wcorg-session-807118" target="_blank">Responsive Web Design Workflows</a>.</p>
<p>In addition to the four 10uppers presenting this weekend Andrew Mowe, Zach Brown, Luke Woodward, Cole Geissinger, Drew Jaynes and myself will all be on-site organizing, volunteering and contributing&nbsp;to the event. We’d love to see you there!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12180 type-post status-publish format-event has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances tag-europe tag-romania tag-wordcamp post_format-post-format-event wordcamp-romania">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-romania/">Telling my story at WordCamp Romania</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-eric-mann" title="Posts by Eric Mann" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/EMann-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/EMann-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Eric Mann</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-romania/" title="Telling my story at WordCamp Romania"><time datetime="2014-06-26T18:12:42-04:00">June 26, 2014</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Jun</span>
28</time>

<p class="event-title">WordCamp Romania</p>

<p class="location">Universitatea De Vest Din Timisoara</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="attending">Attending</span>
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>I love working in a global community! WordPress touches every corner of the globe and attracts both writers and developers from just about every country on the planet. Many of them are so enthusiastic they hold annual WordCamps to celebrate the application that ties us together. This weekend, I get to visit one such&nbsp;WordCamp.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignright size-medium wp-image-12181" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/wordcamp_2014_logo_diacritice_date1-172x300.png" alt="WordCamp Romania" width="172" height="300" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/wordcamp_2014_logo_diacritice_date1-172x300.png 172w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/wordcamp_2014_logo_diacritice_date1-71x124.png 71w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/wordcamp_2014_logo_diacritice_date1-52x90.png 52w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/wordcamp_2014_logo_diacritice_date1.png 286w" sizes="(max-width: 172px) 100vw, 172px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;">On Saturday and Sunday, I’ll (Eric Mann) be visiting the far reaches of Europe at <a title="WordCamp Romania" href="http://2014.romania.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Romania</a> – my&nbsp;<em>first</em> international WordCamp experience! It’s going to be a trip to&nbsp;remember.</p>
<p>WordCamp Romania&nbsp;is themed around telling stories, so I’ll be telling a bit of my own history with WordPress as well as encouraging new developers to become even more involved in the&nbsp;platform.</p>
<p>Sunday is a “leisure day” when I hope to touch base with some other WordPress aficionados to sit down and work on core code (the WordPress 4.0 beta&nbsp;<em>is</em> coming near, we need all hands on&nbsp;deck!).</p>
<p>Above all, though, I’m excited to connect even more with the global WordPress community. WordPress is global, and 10up has a growing global presence. I’m just honored to be a part of&nbsp;both!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12167 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside speaking-at-wp-summit">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/speaking-at-wp-summit/" title="Speaking at WP Summit"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a07921f8459fb03423b58b013aa354fc?s=256&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a07921f8459fb03423b58b013aa354fc?s=512&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-256 photo" height="256" width="256" loading="lazy" decoding="async" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></a>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/coreyellis/" title="Posts by Corey Ellis" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"> Corey Ellis</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/speaking-at-wp-summit/" title="Speaking at WP Summit"><time datetime="2014-06-18T09:39:01-04:00">June 18, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<div class="body-copy">
<p>I’m excited to be the lead-off speaker at the 3rd annual WP Summit today. This one-day online conference brings together some of the most talented presenters covering various aspects of WordPress. &nbsp;My talk will focus on the nuts and bolts of putting together a WordPress theme. &nbsp;If you have ever wanted to start building your own themes then <a href="http://environmentsforhumans.com/2014/wp-summit/" target="_blank">this talk will get you started</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12151 type-post status-publish format-event has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-event catch-pushup-and-10up-at-wordcamp-chicago-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/catch-pushup-and-10up-at-wordcamp-chicago-2014/">Catch PushUp and 10up at WordCamp Chicago&nbsp;2014</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/aaronholbrook/" title="Posts by Aaron Holbrook" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/AHolbrook-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/AHolbrook-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Aaron Holbrook</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/catch-pushup-and-10up-at-wordcamp-chicago-2014/" title="Catch PushUp and 10up at WordCamp Chicago 2014"><time datetime="2014-06-11T15:00:11-04:00">June 11, 2014</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Jun</span>
13</time>

<p class="event-title">WordCamp Chicago</p>

<p class="location">Chicago, Illinois</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="attending">Attending</span>
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
<span class="sponsoring">Sponsoring</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>10up will be brewing up a storm in the Windy City this upcoming weekend at <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Chicago</a>, with wall to wall speakers&nbsp;supported by a&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/sponsor/pushup/">John Hancock Sponsorship</a> under the <a title="website push notifications" href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">PushUp Notifications</a> product brand.</p>
<p>Our&nbsp;rundown of speakers&nbsp;starts with Dustin Filippini presenting&nbsp;a <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/comprehensive-dashboard-walkthrough/">Comprehensive Dashboard Walkthrough</a>&nbsp;on Foundation Friday. On Saturday, Kelly Dwan kicks things off with <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/a-walk-around-the-loop/">A Walk Around the Loop</a>, a study of the post loop from an advanced developer’s perspective. Alison Barrett takes the stage&nbsp;for a lightning talk at noon with <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/knowing-what-you-dont-know/">Knowing What You Don’t Know</a> followed by James Barrett on <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/wireframing-essentials/">Wireframing Essentials</a>.</p>
<p>On Sunday I’ll pause from organizer duties&nbsp;for&nbsp;an <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/introduction-to-ides-and-debugging/">Introduction to IDEs and Debugging</a>, which makes the case&nbsp;for&nbsp;IDEs by showing off&nbsp;the amazing powers they&nbsp;bestow. John James Jacoby will dive into&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/multisite-and-multi-network/">Multisite and Multi-network</a>, emphasizing&nbsp;the lesser used multi-network feature. Wrapping up the day on Sunday, Rachel Baker demonstrates&nbsp;how&nbsp;developers can <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/put-your-site-to-rest-with-wp-api/">Put Your Content to REST With WP-API</a>, a look at the exciting new JSON REST API (WP API).</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone wp-image-12158 size-full" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/chicago.jpg" alt="WordCamp Chicago 2014" width="800" height="186" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago.jpg 800w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago-300x70.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago-768x179.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago-756x176.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago-220x51.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/chicago-160x37.jpg 160w" sizes="(max-width: 800px) 100vw, 800px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p>In addition to our speakers, you’ll also find&nbsp;10uppers Kara Buffardi and Gus Gerhardt at our&nbsp;<a href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">PushUp</a> sponsor&nbsp;table, showing off&nbsp;our website push notifications product. We’ll be on hand to demo the product, answer questions, and provision new customers as they sign up – and <strong>we’re offering a 99¢ sign up code</strong> (discounted from $14.99) for anyone&nbsp;who registers&nbsp;on the spot!</p>
<p>I’ll also be leading the <a href="http://2014.chicago.wordcamp.org/session/activities/">Networking lunch activity</a>&nbsp;at noon on Saturday; stop by and say hello!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12134 type-post status-publish format-image has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized post_format-post-format-image louis-dorman-senior-designer">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/louis-dorman-senior-designer/">Design visionary Louis Dorman joins 10up as Senior Designer</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/taylor-aldridge/" title="Posts by Taylor Aldridge" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/TAldridge-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/12/TAldridge-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Taylor Aldridge</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/louis-dorman-senior-designer/" title="Design visionary Louis Dorman joins 10up as Senior Designer"><time datetime="2014-06-05T19:29:08-04:00">June 5, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<img width="650" height="345" src="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about.png" class="blog-archive-image wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about.png 1200w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about-300x159.png 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about-768x408.png 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about-756x401.png 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about-220x117.png 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/06/louisdorman_post_about-160x85.png 160w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"><p>At 10up, we think&nbsp;that a truly outstanding web&nbsp;publishing experience&nbsp;happens&nbsp;at the intersection of great design, strategy, and engineering. We also know that the modern web requires talent&nbsp;that understands that great design is not just how a website looks, but how it feels across input interfaces and screen sizes.&nbsp;As we continue to grow our&nbsp;design team, we’re very excited to welcome a designer that embodies our vision of client-centered&nbsp;design, as innovative in its aesthetics as its interactions.</p>
<p>Louis Dorman has been designing for the web since the days of dial-up. After&nbsp;graduating from the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.artinstitutes.edu/phoenix/">Art Institute of Phoenix</a> in 2001, he went&nbsp;on to be responsible for the design and manufacturing of millions of products around the world. Louis was one of the first employees at <a href="http://mashable.com/">Mashable</a>, one of the most popular WordPress-powered websites. As Art Director, he managed all areas&nbsp;of&nbsp;design,&nbsp;from the web presentation and UX to marketing&nbsp;collateral, as the company scaled to 30 million+ monthly unique visitors.</p>
<p>Louis was also a founder of&nbsp;<a href="http://techcrunch.com/2008/02/07/adcamo-offers-background-advertising-hmmmm/">AdCamo</a>, which would become&nbsp;a pioneer in the development of background ad units under his direction. In addition to steering&nbsp;vision and project development, Louis&nbsp;hired and mentored creative and engineering&nbsp;teams, managed communication between sales and engineering, and created campaigns for clients like ABC, Comcast, Craftsman, MGM, Sony, and WWE, to name a few.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/louis-dorman-senior-designer/#more-12134" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Design visionary Louis Dorman joins 10up as Senior Designer</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12075 type-post status-publish format-event has-post-thumbnail hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-event keynoting-wordcamp-philly-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/keynoting-wordcamp-philly-2014/">Keynoting WordCamp Philly&nbsp;2014</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/helen/" title="Posts by Helen Hou-Sandi" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Helen Hou-Sandí" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/HHouSandi-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/HHouSandi-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Helen Hou-Sandi</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/keynoting-wordcamp-philly-2014/" title="Keynoting WordCamp Philly 2014"><time datetime="2014-06-03T03:15:06-04:00">June 3, 2014</time></a>
</p>


<div class="event-meta">

<time datetime="2013-12-14T00:00">
<span class="mo">Jun</span>
7</time>

<p class="event-title">WordCamp Philly</p>

<p class="location">Philadelphia, PA</p>

<div class="meta">
<span class="attending">Attending</span>
<span class="speaking">Speaking</span>
</div>
</div>

<p>I’m really excited to debut&nbsp;my first WordCamp keynote this coming weekend at the illustrious <a href="http://2014.philly.wordcamp.org/wordcamp-philly-keynote-speaker-helen-hou-sandi/">WordCamp Philly</a>! I’m&nbsp;presenting&nbsp;a remix of a&nbsp;my WordCamp Connecticut talk,&nbsp;“How I convinced my boss to let me work on WordPress full-time”, arguing&nbsp;for personal and company&nbsp;investment in open source. I’ll look at how and why teams like 10up&nbsp;<a title="Giving Back" href="https://10up.com/giving-back/">donate back to the community</a>, and offer&nbsp;ways that attendees&nbsp;can give back, too.</p>
<p>10uppers will also be quite well represented: Dave Ross will be speaking on “<a href="http://2014.philly.wordcamp.org/session/easier-more-secure-deploys-with-docker-and-dokku/">Easier, More Secure Deploys with Docker and Dokku</a>“, Doug Stewart pulls double duty as co-organizer and <a href="http://2014.philly.wordcamp.org/session/working-from-home/">“working from home”&nbsp;panel</a> moderator, and Cindy Kendrick and Spencer Hansen will be in attendance. Hope to&nbsp;see you there, whether in a session, Sunday’s contributor day, or in the hallways.</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-12118 type-post status-publish format-aside hentry category-appearances post_format-post-format-aside in-browser-design-at-wordcamp-orange-county">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content"><div style="width:800px;height:421px;background-image:url(data:image/svg+xml;base64,);background-repeat:no-repeat;background-size:800px 421px;" data-xblocker="blocked"></div></div>

<article class="blog-archive-post post-11581 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized wordcamp-miami-connecticut-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-miami-connecticut-2014/">WordCamps in Miami and Connecticut</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/" title="Posts by " rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo avatar-default" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> </a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/wordcamp-miami-connecticut-2014/" title="WordCamps in Miami and Connecticut"><time datetime="2014-05-09T16:55:50-04:00">May 9, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>10up has the east coast covered top-to-bottom this weekend at both WordCamp <a href="http://2014.connecticut.wordcamp.org/">Connecticut</a> and WordCamp <a href="http://2014.miami.wordcamp.org/">Miami</a>.</p>
<p>In the north Jake Goldman will teach you how&nbsp;to&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.connecticut.wordcamp.org/session/leveraging-wordpresss-html5-media-player/">leverage WordPress’s native media player</a>, based on MediaElement.js, Taylor Lovett will show you how to&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.connecticut.wordcamp.org/session/save-time-with-wp-cli/">save time with WP-CLI</a>, and Helen Hou-Sandi will make the&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.connecticut.wordcamp.org/session/how-i-convinced-my-boss-to-let-me-work-on-wordpress-full-time/">business case for contributing to&nbsp;WordPress core full-time</a>.&nbsp;CEO John Eckman and Engineer Kelly Dwan will also be participating.</p>
<p>We’re also a <a href="http://2014.connecticut.wordcamp.org/sponsor/10up/">Gold Sponsor of&nbsp;WordCamp Connecticut</a>, under the PushUp brand, our <a href="http://pushupnotifications.com/">website push notifications&nbsp;product</a>. We’ll be&nbsp;on hand to demo the product and provision new customers&nbsp;on the spot – and we’re&nbsp;offering a 99¢ sign up code&nbsp;(discounted from $14.99) for new customers who sign up on the spot!</p>
<p>In the south, I’m (John James Jacoby)&nbsp;talking about <a href="http://2014.miami.wordcamp.org/session/developers-getting-involved-with-buddypress/">contributing to WordPress, BuddyPress, and bbPress</a>, and reviewing&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.miami.wordcamp.org/session/buddypress-2-0-and-beyond/">what’s new in BuddyPress 2.0</a>.</p>
<p>If you happen to see us at either event,&nbsp;stop by our table in Connecticut or find me in Miami!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-11522 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized tag-open-source tag-plugin tag-twitter tweet-by-category">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/tweet-by-category/">Team Collaboration: Tweet by&nbsp;Category</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-eric-mann" title="Posts by Eric Mann" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/EMann-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/EMann-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Eric Mann</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/tweet-by-category/" title="Team Collaboration: Tweet by Category"><time datetime="2014-05-05T16:16:21-04:00">May 5, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>When I first joined 10up, one of my first challenges was building a <a title="Tweet by Category" href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/publish-to-twitter/">Twitter plugin</a> for a client who wanted to automatically tweet based on&nbsp;<em>category</em>.&nbsp;Luckily, I work with an&nbsp;amazing team. I lamented in our team IRC room, and to my surprise,&nbsp;discovered that&nbsp;we already had a plugin that did exactly what I needed. Well, almost exactly.</p>
<p>The&nbsp;existing module,&nbsp;built for another client, was&nbsp;all but abandoned before it was fully polished for non-specific use cases. It also used Twitter’s deprecated v1 API, so I had to swap out the communication layer. Still, I had a starting point thanks to the inventiveness of the team, and our consistent application of coding standards.</p>
<p>A few weeks later, we had a solid, polished release using the v1.1 API ready for a new client. We released the project (it was still not fully abstracted, but complete enough for their purposes) and pushed it to the back burner (read: all but abandoned it again).&nbsp;Last month, yet another client requested the same feature. I dusted off <a href="https://github.com/10up">our Git repository</a> and started smoothing out the still rough edges so we could launch an even more refined&nbsp;version for&nbsp;a third client.</p>
<p>That’s when it hit me: this plugin only exists as a result&nbsp;of the way our&nbsp;team collaborates. It has been gradually improved and iterated&nbsp;over time across&nbsp;multiple developers and disparate project requirements. Yet we had&nbsp;<em>never</em> released the source outside of our company.</p>
<p>A couple of emails and about 10 minutes later, <strong>Publish to Twitter</strong> went&nbsp;public&nbsp;on both <a title="Publish to Twitter" href="https://github.com/10up/publish-to-twitter">GitHub</a> and <a title="Publish to Twitter" href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/publish-to-twitter/">WordPress.org</a>. I’d personally like to invite you to join the growing team of collaborators on this project to help make it even more flexible and useful for our entire&nbsp;community.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/tweet-by-category/#more-11522" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Team Collaboration: Tweet by&nbsp;Category</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-11552 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorized conferencing-continent">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/conferencing-continent/">10up conferencing across the&nbsp;continent</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/blog/author/christinegarrison/" title="Posts by Christine Garrison" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=64&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a54756b4e907df4d47a780bfc76c5a36?s=128&amp;d=mm&amp;r=pg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Christine Garrison</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/conferencing-continent/" title="10up conferencing across the continent"><time datetime="2014-05-03T13:07:00-04:00">May 3, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>Over the next few days, WordCamps and conferences all across North America, are&nbsp;featuring 10uppers as guest speakers.</p>
<p>John James Jacoby, Director of Web Engineering, will be hosting a&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.northcanton.wordcamp.org/sessions/#wcorg-session-686062"><i>Q&amp;A session on BuddyPress and bbPress</i></a> at&nbsp;<a href="http://2014.northcanton.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp North Canton</a>, on Saturday May 3rd, as part of the Beginner track.</p>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-11557" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-756x425.jpg" alt="JJJ presenting" width="710" height="399" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-756x425.jpg 756w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-300x169.jpg 300w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-768x432.jpg 768w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-220x124.jpg 220w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-1152x648.jpg 1152w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-576x324.jpg 576w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original-160x90.jpg 160w, https://10up.com/uploads/2014/05/wonderful-wordpress-workflow_hd.original.jpg 1280w" sizes="(max-width: 710px) 100vw, 710px" data-xblocker="passed" style="visibility: visible;"></p>
<p><a href="http://2014.ottawa.wordcamp.org/">WordCamp Ottawa</a> will feature two 10uppers: Senior Engineers&nbsp;Taylor Lovett and&nbsp;Alison Barrett. Taylor will present&nbsp;<i><a href="http://2014.ottawa.wordcamp.org/session/saving-time-with-wp-cli/">Saving Time with WP-CLI</a>,</i>&nbsp;a walk through of&nbsp;WordPress in the command line, focusing on scalable practices and eye-opening&nbsp;use cases. Alison will be speaking on&nbsp;<i><a href="http://2014.ottawa.wordcamp.org/session/develop-plugins-like-a-pro/">Developing Plugins Like A Pro</a>,</i>&nbsp;covering the basics of plugin development; her&nbsp;tips will&nbsp;have attendees&nbsp;writing plugins like a pro in no time.</p>
<p>Finally, Web Engineer&nbsp;<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-drew-jaynes">Drew Jaynes</a>&nbsp;is speaking at “<a href="http://conf.writethedocs.org/na/2014/">Write the Docs</a>” in Portland, Oregon on Tuesday, May 6th. Drew’s talk,&nbsp;<a href="http://docs.writethedocs.org/2014/na/talks/#drew-jaynes-putting-the-docs-cart-before-the-standards-horse"><i>Putting the (docs) Cart Before the (standards) Horse</i></a>, is about how WordPress core developed documentation standards using 10 years of documentation, putting&nbsp;the cart before the proverbial horse.</p>
<p>See you around the continent!</p>
</div>
</article>
<article class="blog-archive-post post-11536 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized learning-summit-2014">
<div class="blog-archive-post-content">
<h1><a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/learning-summit-2014/">Staying on top: 10up Learning Summit&nbsp;2014</a></h1>
<p class="author byline">
<a href="https://10up.com/about/#employee-jake-goldman" title="Posts by Jake Goldman" rel="author" class="author-posts-link"><img alt="Avatar photo" src="./Blog _ 10up_files/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-64x64.jpg" srcset="https://10up.com/uploads/2014/09/Jake-Goldman_avatar_1410997004-128x128.jpg 2x" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" height="64" width="64" loading="lazy" decoding="async"> Jake Goldman</a> on <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/learning-summit-2014/" title="Staying on top: 10up Learning Summit 2014"><time datetime="2014-04-25T17:09:49-04:00">April 25, 2014</time></a>
</p>
<p>Around this time in 2013 we held&nbsp;a&nbsp;<a title="Preparing for Portland: 10up’s Developer Summit" href="https://10up.com/blog/preparing-for-developer-summit/">Developer Summit</a> – an in person gathering of&nbsp;our team focused on skill building. We covered everything from PHP unit testing to JavaScript performance optimization, and even rolled out <a title="Varying Vagrant Vagrants: All Grown Up" href="https://10up.com/blog/varying-vagrant-vagrants-future/">Varying Vagrant Vagrants</a>. From SASS to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.ericdelabar.com/2008/05/metaprogramming-javascript.html">duck punching</a>, that summit influences how I write code today, when I still have the occasion&nbsp;to do so.</p>
<p>10up has grown since April 2013, not just in&nbsp;raw&nbsp;numbers (we’ve tripled), but in scope. Add a&nbsp;talented design team and&nbsp;nearly a dozen web strategists and project managers and our&nbsp;second annual “developer” summit already needs a rebranding: let’s call it a&nbsp;<strong>Learning Summit</strong>.</p>
<p><div style="width:800px;height:277px;background-image:url(data:image/svg+xml;base64,);background-repeat:no-repeat;background-size:800px 277px;" data-xblocker="blocked"></div></p>
<p>This time, we’re taking over a resort in beautiful Scottsdale, Arizona. We’re kicking off on the afternoon of Tuesday, May 13, with practical activities&nbsp;focusing on&nbsp;the art of effective, consistent, and thoughtful&nbsp;client engagement.&nbsp;Wednesday we have&nbsp;<strong><em>three tracks</em></strong>&nbsp;filled with incredible&nbsp;workshops: design, engineering, and project management.</p>
<p> <a href="https://10up.com/blog/2014/learning-summit-2014/#more-11536" class="more-link">Read More <span class="screen-reader-text">on Staying on top: 10up Learning Summit&nbsp;2014</span></a></p>
</div>
</article>
